We incorporated a swipe limit to help our users get the results they‚Äôre hoping for. If you're in a rush to see more users though, you're always welcome to upgrade your account to Boost or Premium.", 'modified': '2022-12-23T19:30:55Z'}
review:
This use to be one of the better dating apps but with every new ‚Äúfeature‚Äù or update it gets a bit worse and worse.

For example, why is it that I have five likes, and have had five likes for over four months? I know when you swipe left on a possible match they disappear from your likes, and if you swipe right you match with them. And yet I‚Äôve had five blurred out in my likes that have never shown up in my queue. That‚Äôs not okay. I don‚Äôt get many likes, so I need all the opportunities I can get.

Another example, is why such a low swipe limit. I don‚Äôt go on often, probably once a week. So when I log on after getting a notification I got a match after about three days of not opening the app, why am I out of likes after five swipes? Now I have to wait a full 24 hours just to get what another 10 swipes. Why doesn‚Äôt it reset each day regardless of how many swipes you did the day before? Dating app has become a gatcha mobile game where you have to log on everyday to receive your daily reward. That‚Äôs not how dating should work, and that‚Äôs not how apps promoting dating should work.
title: Became worse

developerResponse: {'id': 34989904, 'body': "We appreciate you sharing your feedback with us. We are always looking for ways to improve our users' experience on the app so we will make sure to pass your input along to our Product Team. üíõ", 'modified': '2023-02-21T11:15:23Z'}
review: App interface is really finicky on a touchscreen. The left and right swipes are too sensitive. App will randomly swipe based off the slightest actions. It will send super swipes randomly. There of course is no undo for right swipes, which is absolutely stupid. So then if that accidental swipe leads to a match, now I have to be the jerk and instantly unmatch. As someone else mentioned, imagine how terrible the other person feels when that happens. There's no reason not to have an undo on right/super swipe, especially if you make the swipe actions so sensitive. If anything, make it so the swipe actions are disabled when scrolling the profile. As for the quality of the dating pool, it's a step above the "fire app" it seems. I feel like there's not many serious women here. For an app where women are supposed to message first, it doesn't seem to happen. I'll have to extend a match for 24 hours and wait for them to message. Then they just disappear. I get encouraging messaging by using the time limit. However, it really seems to be counterproductive. This apps seems like a waste of time at this point.
title: Fix the swipe sensitivity & add full undo

developerResponse: {'id': 22235257, 'body': 'Our team fully investigates all reports before taking action and moderates based solely on our Community Guidelines. We would never arbitrarily block someone from our platform. If you would like our team to review your case, message @BumbleSupport on Twitter or Facebook.', 'modified': '2021-04-14T08:31:41Z'}
review: I‚Äôve had this app for years. At times I‚Äôve even paid for premium subscriptions, and all in all, it‚Äôs my ‚Äòfavorite‚Äô as far as ease of use, response from matches and overall connections that I‚Äôve made. I have connections in other towns, going back years- that I reach out to when traveling, and we meet up for dinner & drinks, hikes, any adventure really. Well yesterday I was in the middle of a conversation with a man and out of no where, was signed out of the app. I had to go through a verification process to get back in, but was given a screen that told me I had been blocked. Something about ‚Äòseveral complaints‚Äô of me selling something!?!? That‚Äôs absolutely not true and if someone has (falsely) reported me for such things, it‚Äôs just some lowlife scammer upset that I‚Äôm not responsive to his sob story about being ‚Äòstationed in Afghanistan on a peacekeeping mission while widowed and left with 2 young gorgeous children and a German Shepherd, just looking for a Mum to love them‚Äô. So just like that, I lose all of my connections and am locked out of my account with no recourse? Is there no way to appeal this? I‚Äôm not now or ever selling anything here, or anywhere else for that matter. There needs to be a better way, Bumble.
title: Was blocked for NO reason

review:
So this app is not what it used to be. I got this app when it first came out since I was hearing it was a platform more serious then Tinder at the time. I used it for awhile and I had some decent luck. I took some time off due to meeting someone in person and after 5 years I eventually made my way back. Since I‚Äôve been back it‚Äôs been a horrible experience. I constantly get a lot of likes but they just sit in the Q until they expire with no way of engaging the person. I honestly think it‚Äôs for
Insecure women to feel good about themselves without the commitmentüòÇ I‚Äôve had a couple conversations (With no indication of it going badly) leave off on a planned date for the night and by the next morning they are gone from the platform. The few dates that have gone thru had me running all over the place paying getting the tab just to tell me the next day their not looking for anything, they don‚Äôt want anything to do with me, or I‚Äôm not the one. So after much self-reflection and being a pretty self-aware human I can honestly say I was a gentleman and did nothing out of context. Which brings me to the conclusion that this app is filled with insecure, scammy, and users. I would personally recommend Hinge or even Tinder is better then the experience I had on this one.
title: BEWARE OF FLAKES, INSECURITIES , & USERS!!!

We really appreciate you taking the time to leave us your feedback about this, and we'll be sure to share it with our Product Team.", 'modified': '2022-06-29T22:41:48Z'}
review:
I use bumblebff and overall It‚Äôs a good app and concept and I have met people through it, but at this point in my life (I‚Äôm a lesbian) I‚Äôd really just like to make some male friends specifically and they just don‚Äôt give you that option at all on bumble bff. On dating you can choose to see men or women, but that‚Äôs it. I think that‚Äôs pretty unfair and non inclusive. If a guy goes on bumble bff and tries to come onto women, allow us to report that ONE guy and maybe implement some sorta ‚Äúthree strikes and you‚Äôre banned‚Äù rule or sumn idk, but to just completely cut off our ability to even attempt to befriend the opposite sex is kinda backwards. 

Also, the gender incision is great when it comes to what you can put in your bio, but that‚Äôs where it stops. If I put that I‚Äôm non-binary, I still have to choose to show my profile to people looking for men or women‚Ä¶‚Ä¶.Make it make sense‚Ä¶.
I think filters should be opened up way more, ESPECIALLY on the bff side. Sometimes I specifically want to find more non-binary friends, or trans male friends etc. it‚Äôs a good concept but I‚Äôd like to see a lot of changes too before I could really use it for what I want right now‚Ä¶
title: Ok‚Ä¶

developerResponse: {'id': 24526921, 'body': "Hi there, we really appreciate you sharing your feedback with us. We are always looking for ways to improve our users' experience on the app so we will make sure to pass your input along to our Product Team.", 'modified': '2021-08-16T10:25:48Z'}
review: This app is great in theory, but it literally makes it impossible for you to keep your matches. I love that you can see more detailed bios from potential matches because it gives me a little more to work with when approaching a guy I match with. However, the 24 hr thing is terrible. Yes, it puts the onus on the girl to take a leap and make the first move. But, many articles have shown that most people who use a dating app, don‚Äôt check it regularly and/or have the notifications turned off for the app. So, if you match with a person and take a little while to finally get the courage to send them something, the person may not even be on there within the 24 hrs that you send them the message and your conversation just dies before you even have a chance! Back to square one. And who knows, that person could‚Äôve been a good match. If you‚Äôre going to put a time limit on it, make it something like 72 hrs. If someone doesn‚Äôt answer in 72 hrs, then  they‚Äôre just not interested. I don‚Äôt know, it feels like the opposite of ‚Äú,empowering women,‚Äù to constantly be disappointed and discouraged by having a match go cold before it even has a chance to develop‚Ä¶
title: Great in Theory

developerResponse: {'id': 32484683, 'body': "Hi there! Thanks for sharing your feedback with us. It sounds like your admirers don't fit the Advanced Filters you have set. Try removing all of your filters; these users should show up then. We hate to hear you‚Äôve had a hard time connecting with your matches! We‚Äôd recommend filling out your profile with information about your hobbies as it might help your match feel more comfortable breaking the ice! If you'd like our Profile Assistants to review your account & offer tips to show off your best self, reach out at bumble.com/contact. üíõ", 'modified': '2022-10-10T12:58:58Z'}
review:
Overall, the app interface is fine. It‚Äôs not complicated to understand and set up your preferences. My main issue is that there is barely ANY interaction. Paying for the premium version doesn‚Äôt increase your chances of meeting someone or interacting. Not unless you pay for more views? It‚Äôs odd to think that setting up your profile, verifying it, and paying for premium, results in no return. The likes I did happen to have were only though the unverified profile option. So how do I know these profiles are legitimate? Are these people even on this app anymore? Most of the people I really was hoping to interact with don‚Äôt interact back - even with a match. Extending the time limit for a match hoping to contact you is pointless - they do not respond 99% of the time. It‚Äôs just built up anticipation thinking someone you match with will write to you when you know they will not. Waiting for someone to contact you is not the way to get people to know each other. The ball is always in their court and they obviously aren‚Äôt at the playground.

I honestly can‚Äôt recommend this app for the amount of money you have to pay for nothing in return.
title: Not worth the price

review: Everyone is complaining about the lack of any free filters and no backtrack option now. Let‚Äôs be honest: people don‚Äôt really want to pay for all this crap because paying doesn‚Äôt really make the app better for everyone. You can‚Äôt argue that it‚Äôs overpriced. Also, the notification system on the app is poor. If I didn‚Äôt check it more often I could easily miss some connections and I know some people have missed the match with me because they never got a notification about it. In addition there are too many flaky people on the app which makes it almost worthless. There should be some kind of algorithm on the app that punishes those who are here just to collect matches and who don‚Äôt communicate once matched. But then again, some of that could be due to a poor notification system. Bumble, why don‚Äôt you just use advertising to pay most of the bills? It‚Äôs the perfect platform for it and might actually benefit everybody. Maybe continue with memberships for the people who really want the fancy stuff, but you don‚Äôt have to take away everything from the user base. Otherwise it‚Äôs just another Tinder. As things are now, I really can‚Äôt take take the app seriously at all and am enjoying other apps like Hinge more. Time for real change Bumble.
title: Users are Unhappy

review: This service employs tactics used by other businesses to easily offer a free trial and will refuse any attempts to give a refund by any reasonable request. If you accidentally accept the trial and forget to cancel or literally don‚Äôt have time because you are working all day and forget to cancel or don‚Äôt know how-they are ruthless in acquiring your money. Legal contracts = it‚Äôs ok to take your money and will use the terms and services to your disadvantage. As far the actual value of the app and the premium service, little to zero value if you are not among the rich and beautiful. I‚Äôve emailed several times including the details about how I never wanted the free trial and definitely didn‚Äôt want the subscription all the while not even using the app during such period and they give an automated pretexted response because it is natural to gain revenue upon unfortunate people like myself. Use the app for free but do not accept any trial or subscription if you already have little success to begin with (just saying). I quite literally cancelled and emailed the very night it was deducted from my account and zero F were given. I‚Äôve never left a review on anything before until now. ‚ù§Ô∏è thanks for Absolutely nothing bumble! And for taking precious resources away from with zero shame. Way to go!

If you'd like to chat more about your feedback, email us via bumble.com/contact or DM us on Facebook/Twitter (@BumbleSupport).", 'modified': '2022-08-24T23:22:45Z'}
review:
Bumble has made me hate online dating. I had way better luck and went on actual dates on other dating apps like Hinge. 

As a woman I get to ‚Äúmake the first move‚Äù. I had 1600+ likes in my first couple of weeks and I matched with a handful of them, but then when I make my first move, there‚Äôs only a little small talk and their account gets deleted or they say they are going to meet up or video chat but keep making excuses. I ran into SO MANY catfish accounts of guys who ‚Äúreally want to meet me‚Äù and they‚Äôd make plans with me but keep cancelling because surprise surprise they‚Äôre not real. This whole app is a big scam and a time waster. 

The verified profiles don‚Äôt really mean anything when I‚Äôve disproven many of these accounts. So I don‚Äôt feel safe at all on this app. I had to report a couple of profiles and the bumble team assured me that they are gone. But if that person is a catfish or a fake account and your verification process can‚Äôt be trusted, then how do I know if that person doesn‚Äôt just make a new account. The guys on here don‚Äôt want to date they just swipe right and hope you match with them. Then talk to you for a second and then ghost you for no reason. It‚Äôs ridiculous.
title: Probably the worst dating app here‚Äôs why

developerResponse: {'id': 6208386, 'body': 'Hi! Thank you so much for your feedback. We are so happy you are enjoying our new features! Your suggestions are extremely important to us because they drive innovation at Bumble. We will make sure to pass your feedback to our Product Team!', 'modified': '2018-12-03T08:01:36Z'}
review: I do have a few things to say about Bumble. First, I love that it‚Äôs so female driven. I‚Äôve done a lot of dating apps (and still do!), yet Bumble is by far my favorite. It helps me work up the courage to approach the guy for a change. More than half the time they don‚Äôt answer, but I can‚Äôt do anything about that. That being said, I‚Äôd like to comment on some new features I noticed and give some feedback. I love that you can add like quirks about yourself ie. perfect first date, two truths and a lie, etc. I also love that you can now see what people are looking for, religious preferences, if they want children and the like. What I think would be cool to see is if you could filter people based off these features. I‚Äôm currently looking for someone who wants a relationship, but has no interest in having kids in the future and I find that it‚Äôs a pain to have to sort through all the people who aren‚Äôt looking for the same. It makes the dating process even more of a pain. Just a thought. Everything else about the app is great and hopefully I‚Äôll eventually find someone on it!
title: I don‚Äôt normally review apps, but...

review: Bumble ignores your search/filter preferences for gender, and will show you people (which Bumble allows and is causing to happen) that self-report a ‚Äúgender‚Äù that does not match their actual biological equipment.  When Sexual, Domestic, and Dating Violence is a real, serious concern; upfront honesty is extremely important.  Dishonesty - regardless of the popular politically correct movements - is a major red flag to start any relationship.  For an App that promotes itself all around safety, this is a huge failure in terms of safety, allowing people to misrepresent their actual biological equipment, allowing people to lie and be deceptive about who they are, and ignoring user search-preferences and showing out-of-gender results.  If Bumble needs to politically pander, then Bumble needs to add/create more gender categories and allow users to exclude categories in our preferences.  Domestic Violence, Sexual Violence, and crime can and is committed by all types of people - regardless of their gender identity or sexual orientation - but a red flag to if a person is more like to be Violent or Criminal is how honest they are.  Listing yourself as something you‚Äôre not is dishonest, and Bumble allowing this opens the door to this app being abused by predators.
title: Potentially Dangerous App

developerResponse: {'id': 5543601, 'body': "Your safety on our platform is our top priority which is why we've changed our reporting. We investigate every report launched by our users to ensure that the Hive is a positive place for all! After selecting a reporting reason, the user will be blocked from seeing you. Also, we still have our Backtrack feature for accidental swipes to the left!", 'modified': '2018-10-17T13:47:30Z'}
review:
I took a break from Bumble earlier this year and last night I signed in and reactivated my profile. First, before expressing what REALLY bothered me about the new update, I want to say I was disappointed in the new layout as I think men prefer something less fussy and less complicated, so the theatrics of the new layout could be a turn off or have them engaging less.  Heck, even I think it‚Äôs overkill!  

But what REALLY disappointed me was that the developers took away two key features: shaking to undo a left swipe AND - MORE IMPORTANTLY - the ability to block any profile without reasons of abuse or harassment. If I see an ex-boyfriend, his brother/other relative, his best friend OR I see my neighbor, co-worker - really ANYONE that I just don‚Äôt want knowing my business or that I am trying to date...well, I should be able to block profiles for any reason.  While abuse/harassment is of paramount concern SO IS PRIVACY.  And I don‚Äôt want/need the guy I dated last Summer and it just didn‚Äôt work out, to know I‚Äôm back in the dating game.  It was a great feature (along with the ability to undo a left swipe) and it‚Äôs the change of these two features that made me immediately hide my profile and say, ‚ÄòNo thanks, Bumble‚Äô.
title: New Changes Take Away User Control

Are you please able to send us a DM on Facebook or Twitter @bumblesupport. We‚Äôll happily look into this for you right away.üíõ', 'modified': '2022-05-26T14:46:26Z'}
review: Someone used another person‚Äôs pictures and created a fake account. They really played me, made me buy into their whole story about how they‚Äôre a neuroscience post doc researcher at OSU, naming buildings on campus where they had labs, etc. They were using all the buzzwords and lingo a neuroscientist would and I fact checked everything they were saying, so I wouldn‚Äôt doubt that part is true. It went on for two days until they finally came out and told me they‚Äôre not actually the person in their profile, that they were just trolling me, and calling me gullible for believing them. I cussed them out in literally 6 words and reported them. It was so depressing and I felt like an idiot. Then get this‚Ä¶ Bumble bans ME?! I reached out to customer support and they said they ‚Äúinvestigated‚Äù it but they‚Äôre still going to permanently ban me because the company is ‚Äúrooted in kindness, respect‚Ä¶‚Äù If they actually read through our entire conversation history and did their job right, they would know how royally they messed up and have it completely backwards. I am just appalled by the whole thing. I also paid for the premium membership which I‚Äôm sure they‚Äôre not going to refund me for, so add getting robbed to the list.
title: Horrible!! Please read

review: This past month I‚Äôve swiping left until I came across a really sweet caring genuine honest accepting guy named Levi. We‚Äôve messaged each other for a few hours until the next day we exchanged numbers. He gave me his and I took the risk of calling him and talking over the phone and we suggest to meeting and seeing each other. Couple days of seeing and knowing each other, I‚Äôve experience my first disagreement with a guy that I was falling for and may love in life because I did not like certain action traits he has given me. Then few hours after I calmed from my discussion with him about his action. I‚Äôve apologize and forgave him. I truly care for this guy that I am seeing but we decide to take some time to ourselves for a while, but still keep in touch with each other as friends. When in time he‚Äôs ready to have me back I will grab hold of his caring heart for an actual relationship with me. Moral point to my positive rant is for ladies separate your match options to the right guy just be yourself, honest and trustworthy to him.
title: This app is amazing

review: Like other users, I have to say this is the worst dating app/site I have ever used.  Even though men are swiping right on you, if you message them almost none of them ever respond.  And if they do, it‚Äôs usually just one word answers and then they unmatch you.  I think this concept is flawed.  Men don‚Äôt seem to like having a woman message them first, even though that‚Äôs the concept of the site they signed up for.  And if you do, which you would think was flattering that someone wants to get to know them, they act like you‚Äôre some crazy person bothering them.  I think men see this as revenge for all the other sites where they get ignored by women, because I‚Äôve seen several profiles that say, ‚ÄúCome up with something better than ‚ÄòHi‚Äô or ‚ÄòHow are you?‚Äô‚Äù or ‚ÄúMust be over a 7‚Äù or ‚Äú$100 to any woman who can write a profile without saying ‚Äòtravel‚Äô, ‚Äòwanderlust‚Äô or ‚Äòno hookups‚Äô‚Äù.  I have been using it for months and have not come across any men who actually want to meet someone, I think they just use it as a swiping game to see how many matches they can get, but if you actually try to contact them, they ignore you.  I think the only way to make this app come even close to the already low success rate of other apps/sites is to just let men contact women.
title: Worst dating app ever

review: This has to be one of the worst dating apps on the market, you‚Äôre better to use hook up apps such as Tinder or Grinder. The dev try‚Äôs to curtail people‚Äôs experiences by politely blaming the user or stating that you were simply unmatched when a convo disappears. That there is no way that their ‚Äúflawless‚Äù programming could possibly cause a mistake such as accidentally deleting the conversation without prompts. But I have experienced this not once but twice. The phone vibrates as if I swiped a conversation left but no prompt so I try answered me their message but the app froze so now I assume I have an incoming message. I shutdown the app, no other notifications then I go back and what do you know, convo is gone with no way to recover. At least other apps you just simply block or unblock, Much more logical don‚Äôt you think?  So those reviews who have stated that there are issues, DO NOT disregard them by listening to the developer. The dev is in it to make money, so of course they‚Äôll lie just to ensure a profit.  Here‚Äôs an idea. Create a cache for the user that unmatches another so in the case that it was a mistake, it can happen since it‚Äôs only a 2 layer authentication for deleting a match. Please do not answer this with niceties or excuses, just fix and improve your issues.
title: Massively Flawed, Just Fix the Issues

review: The new updates are terrible! The beeline screen is SO sensitive, it‚Äôs way too easy to accidentally swipe the wrong way while you‚Äôre merely scrolling up and down. (good thing they made the back track option so obvious now bc we definitely need it!) Sometimes when I tap on a profile in the beeline, it won‚Äôt open at all. But I can still swipe left or right on it. Makes no sense. Sometimes the profile tiles do weird movement/suspension things while scrolling, I can‚Äôt even explain it. I pay for premium but I‚Äôm scared to even use the app now, I have to be so careful and slow when I‚Äôm in there and it‚Äôs wasting my time. The whole point of paying is to make all this online dating stuff easier. Will probably cancel the subscription soon but will try to wait to see if they fix things. Also, there‚Äôs a tiny visual design glitch on the beeline ‚Äúheart‚Äù icon. Like a little slice of something else just to the right of it. It‚Äôs so minor, but to me it‚Äôs so obvious. The fact that something like that made it past the checkpoint of such a fancy big company doesn‚Äôt surprise me given how bad the rest of the updates have been. Ugh. Get it together Bumble.
title: So buggy now!

review:
So I pay for bumble. Then I pay for for super swipes. Apparently I am a match with a couple of but it only gives them 24 hours to message back and I just have to wait. I did have the opportunity to extend the time for another 24 hours. But It ran out. For some people finding a match is difficult. I feel like one of the main features is that women have the control over making the first move and also adding an additional time constraint on if unnecessary. To add insult to injury I have to watch the clock count down and really have nothing to do but watch it tick.  From my understanding I have expressed that I like her and she expressed that she like me via the app. For some reason this starts a clock. I am realistic and I know I'm not typically going to be the first choice. But by the time a lady may turn back to to the 2nd or 3rd choice. I have already disappeared. And all I can do is watch the clock.   
Another issue is the so called superswipe. I paid to buy these things and I have literally seen no difference in activity on my account. I don't know what it is supposed to do but it certainly doesn't help me get dates. Now I have used all of them and now they  seem to be more expensive to buy.
title: Watching the clock.

developerResponse: {'id': 25314977, 'body': "Hi there, thank you so much for bringing this to our attention. It's possible your subscription wasn't properly canceled. Please message @BumbleSupport on Twitter or Facebook so we can check on this for you.", 'modified': '2021-09-25T15:41:11Z'}
review:
No way to cancel subscription!

I was traveling for work and thought I would check out the app since when I signed up there were tons of people on the site in the Bay Area. When my contract ended and I headed back north, there was next to no one using the app and I ran through users in a day. The next two months there was maybe one new user every two weeks, but the app still kept sending me random push notifications. I thought, ‚Äúwhatever, I will just let the subscription run out. It was only $67. Low and behold, I have been trying to cancel my subscription so I wouldn‚Äôt renew but there is no way to do it. I was just charged ANOTHER $67. I have gone through the process on the bumble website, tried all of the online walkthroughs both in-app and in Apple settings, none of the walkthroughs work. I do not have an option to cancel my subscription. I can only change my subscription to a different dollar amount after this new pay period ends, a minimum of $8 a month. 

A little reference about me, I am a designer with apps on the Apple store, so I do know how to use my phone. I went through the entire app and all Apple settings. There is no ‚Äúcancel subscription‚Äù option.
title: Do not subscribe to this app!

review: The dating platform itself is fairly well designed and effective, so no complaints there. My complaints are with the business practices Bumble, and unfortunately most dating apps, use. The one that caused me to write this review is this: SuperSwipes and Spotlights expire one week after a membership ends. This is extremely scummy. I got a one week membership and started talking with someone, so I did not use them. After that did not work out, I went to try and use my Spotlight and it was gone. No notification telling me to use it before it expired, nothing. This is beyond unfair as I paid for the week membership, SuperSwipes, and Spotlight, and I had 2/3 of that taken away from me without notice. I tried contacting support, where I found out about this expiration. I got a robotic apology for any ‚Äúinconvenience‚Äù, but that doesn‚Äôt change the fact Bumble took away things I paid for because of an arbitrary and unethical expiration date. I am extremely disappointed in the business practices behind Bumble, and I hope more consumers begin demanding better from these services. As seen here, they are not ethical in the slightest, and Bumble will not be receiving another cent from me until these things change
title: Anti-Consumer Business Practices

We ask all Success Stories to submit theirs at bumble.com/success, and we‚Äôd love to hear yours!  üíõ", 'modified': '2022-05-24T23:23:28Z'}
review: I‚Äôve been online dating for over 10 years using site‚Äôs like Plenty of Fish (crappy format), Tinder (trash!), OK Cupid, and FB Dating, but Bumble seems to work the best. By only allowing women to send the first message they tend to be more serious about their interest in you. It is a numbers game though and you have to swipe like mad to get only a few matches. Don‚Äôt expect every message to go to a date though. The more genuine you are the better results you‚Äôll get. This means guys: quit lying about your age, use YOUR pics and recent ones, quit asking for nudes and sending D-pics. Pro Tip: only pay for a week at a time and swipe like mad. The algorithms on the site tend to give you more matches for a few days and then it fizzles out. Let your ‚Äòlikes‚Äô that you cannot see unless you pay build up, then pay for a week and surf through them. It could be weeks or months but if you stick with it you‚Äôll have some good experiences and great dates. Good luck!
title: Best Success I‚Äôve had‚Ä¶.

review: About 5 years ago this app was pretty great. I was easily finding people with the filters I set and within the area radius I set. It was also half the price! This time around‚Ä¶ha! Good luck. I was constantly getting shown people who were over an hour away even though I checked and double checked my settings and even asked their support if I was doing something wrong. Their reply was that you had to set the distance as a deal breaker‚Ä¶which I did. No help. I don‚Äôt want to toot my own horn, but I‚Äôm a pretty attractive female and after 2 months I ended up with loads of likes from people who lived nearly 2 hours away and only a small handful of likes from locals. I do not live in a small town either. I‚Äôm almost positive this is on purpose. These online dating apps have algorithms for how they show your stack to you depending on paying/nonpaying profiles. The goal is to get you to pay and to keep you paying. I decided to try a different app (the one that‚Äôs meant to be deleted) along side Bumble and within a week I found someone who lives 10 mins from me and we‚Äôre now dating. Sorry Bumble, but you‚Äôve changed and it seems we‚Äôve grown apart‚Ä¶.so I‚Äôm breaking up with you!
title: Bumble is a no thanks for me

review: For a dating app that targets on women making the first move, I like the idea, but women will not make the first move ever since they feel the guy should make it, yet they‚Äôre on a app where they are suppose to make the move and guys just watch the time go from 24hrs to 0 and auto unmatch. I live in a very popular city and having many attractive females around, I have noticed either all the accounts shown are old and inactive with the caption ‚Äúdm me on ig‚Äù or along those lines, just shadow ban those accounts or something and leave the active accounts where people are actually trying to find someone to be with to match with each other. I recently deleted this app since I get maybe 1 like every 2 weeks and the matched girl will unmatch me or leave the timer to unmatch us, I‚Äôm not going to pay an outrageous amount to be noticed when the possibility of being seen by someone real and active on the app is low enough as is. title: Delete inactive accounts please

review: There are people on this app who very clearly are lying about their age. For example a profile will say the person is in their 30‚Äôs but they are very clearly in there 50s or 60s. When those profiles are reported the response is something like ‚Äúif someone else reports the profile as we‚Äôll remove it.‚Äù They have a verification feature, but it is clear no one is actually verifying as I was able to identify someone as being a catfish and it seems this isn‚Äôt uncommon. They allow people to make accounts over and over again. I learned this after repeatedly blocking someone. When I brought this to their attention they initially began to remove the profile, but after the person continued to recreate the same profile at least a dozen times they stopped removing the profile and instead responded with something like ‚Äúif someone else reports the profile we‚Äôll remove it.‚Äù At that point I decided to delete my account. It‚Äôs against the terms and conditions to repeatedly make accounts, and for an app that prides itself in making women feel safe blocking ip addresses of people who do this so frequently in such a short period of time would make women think they take safety seriously.
title: Lies, creeps, & catfishes

developerResponse: {'id': 27584574, 'body': "We appreciate you sharing your feedback with us. We are always looking for ways to improve our users' experience on the app so we will make sure to pass your input along to our Product Team.", 'modified': '2022-01-21T14:43:13Z'}
review: Bumble has the potential ,  it can be positive experience. But overall I‚Äôm disappointed. I think the biggest thing is time limit and women being able to make the first move. Okay first the time limit. I find that most ppl delete the app after few days of use. So matching with someone who might not be on the app during the time limit definitely kills this app. That person might not come on to bumble for another week but they give 24 hours to make a decision. That feature in my opinion is  killing the app the Dramatically. You matched with someone but come to find out you were late cause you didn‚Äôt engage with the app when the app wants you too. I do not  like that it  forces  you to make a move right now. Obviously this is what set bumble and tinder apart is women making the first move. And I can honestly say I met fewer women on this app then tinder due to this feature. I‚Äôm all for the empowerment of women but this ain‚Äôt it. These two things make the app very inconsistent from my experience. You match with few girls in a week. But they never say anything due to time limit and having to make the first move .
title: Why I don‚Äôt like bumble

developerResponse: {'id': 25524250, 'body': "Hi there, thank you so much for giving us this feedback, and we'll be sure to pass it on to our Product Team so we can continue to improve the app. In the meantime our team would love the opportunity to improve your experience in the Hive! review:
UPDATE: What the actual eff! My 30 day Premium Subscription expired yesterday. In 30 days, I probably got no more than 20 Profiles/potential matches populate on my app. This morning, as a non-paying member, I have what appears to be an unlimited stream of Profiles populate. I viewed several, but had to go to work. I just went back on. Now I can‚Äôt see Any of these Profiles unless I re-subscribe. REFUND PLEASE!!! What a total Screw Job. HORRIBLE APP. 

Bumble was a Bust for me. I had a 30 day Premium subscription. Apparently, not many guys subscribed  in my area. Weird, since I live in metro area. Was offered surprisingly few potential Matches, even when Bumble stretched beyond my Preferences. Ones I liked never responded. I didn‚Äôt like that I was held captive to whoever Bumble sent me. Not able to scroll through profiles on my own. What I hated is that once I Liked someone, they disappeared off my app. I wasn‚Äôt able to look back at their profile after swiping Right. The app itself looks Quality. Just not Fruitful. Also, I would have liked the opportunity to write a longer profile. The current character length restriction doesn‚Äôt allow for a very comprehensive profile. Perhaps online dating isn‚Äôt meant for me.
title: Bust

review:
Welp, it happened! 6 months ago I downloaded this app for one whole day, and met the love of my life. It might sound crazy, but it feels exactly like everything that‚Äôs happening is meant to. We connected and started dating during quarantine, and are moving in together next month. When you know, you know! 

I have used other dating apps in the passed, and putting aside the feature of the women starting the conversation, I felt even myself being more authentic and open to possibilities on Bumble than on other apps. Relationships aren‚Äôt always easy, dating isn‚Äôt always easy, and the added quarantine and societal pressures aren‚Äôt helping, but it can still happen. We have lots of mutual friends, and even some of the same hang out spots, and had never come across each other! Who knows how long we could have been together by now, but this app introduced me to people in my world but outside of my circle. He was right there the whole time, and I have Bumble to thank for making the connection. üíö
title: Love of my Life

review: Been on bumble a few times and each time the same thing seems to occur. I will get a few matches over the course of a few weeks. However, I will swipe until my ‚Äúbee line‚Äù runs out, or until there are no more people in my location to pick from. I live in a city with a population of over 100,000 people. My problem with the app is that even when there is no one left to swipe for, it still says there are people that have liked my profile and that I can pay money to get the matches or to see who liked me. I SHOULD HAVE ALREADY SWIPE LEFT OR RIGHT ON THEM. If there is no one left in my location why are you withholding the people that swiped right on? I feel like I‚Äôm never getting matches because the app prevents your pool of applicants from being people that have already liked you. I‚Äôm not paying for another bs dating app. Literally had my heart broken from my last girlfriend that I met on tinder. Point being, don‚Äôt feel bad about not getting matches because the developers are problem just prevents you from matching with people to make money. Hope you all have a better time than I have.
title: Typical cash grab

Such shady advertising! They offered me a ‚Äúdeal‚Äù to pay to unlock unlimited swipes exactly one profile before they told me ‚ÄúThats‚Äôs everyone‚Äù so there are no more profiles to see! What a scam!

I just upgraded to the latest version, and now it pops up an ‚Äúupgrade‚Äù ad that must be dismissed every single time I come back to the app, which is sometimes every 30 seconds! I have a lot going on and can‚Äôt just sit in the app swiping forever, I have to take care of other things. Awful! They also ‚Äúhide‚Äù where people are located/live at the very bottom of people‚Äôs profiles instead of at the top, which is usually the first thing I want to know. So you have to scroll down all the way to the bottom to find out if they live somewhere else, and then have to scroll all the way back up to the top if they actually are local so I can actually look at their profile. So tedious and terrible design! Also, I really hate that it seems like they‚Äôve intentionally designed the app so it is way too easy to accidentally ‚Äúswipe‚Äù to like/dislike someone, and then they disable being able to go back unless you pay! Very shady! Horrible! Wish I hadn‚Äôt upgraded!

review:
I really enjoyed using Bumble for the first year, which is why I‚Äôll still give 2 stars. I got about 5-10 likes per week‚Äîmore if I used a Spotlight. Last month, I started using a VPN to keep myself secure, and all of a sudden I stopped getting likes at all except for when I use a Spotlight (I‚Äôll still get about 10 likes in 2.5 hours). I‚Äôm not saying I‚Äôm the most desirable person ever, but to go from 5-10 likes/week to zero is pretty weird. I did some research and found a lot of people who stopped getting likes after they started using VPNs. The theory is that Bumble‚Äôs algorithm marks VPN users as spammers and keeps them out of others‚Äô feeds. Now my Bumble experience is totally screwed because I chose to protect my privacy online.

Update: I sent Bumble Support a message about this. They responded saying nothing was going on, but also I immediately went back to getting 5-10 likes per week ü§∑. I‚Äôll still give them four stars. Just send support a message if you‚Äôre in my position üòÇ
title: Don‚Äôt use Bumble if you use a VPN

When I joined bumble however with a paid week to see who likes me I received 43 likes from beautiful woman in the first 12 hours, sorry guys that just doesn‚Äôt happen.  For fun I went ahead and matched with all of them and guess what happened?  24 hours later they were all gone because none of these beautiful women ever started a conversation.  It‚Äôs now a week later and not one single other person has liked my profile. It‚Äôs just another dating app tbh except the creators of this one are really proud of it. I can‚Äôt see how they justify $50/month for a subscription. You can use it for free, but you can‚Äôt see who liked you and there‚Äôs limitations to other features. 

The user interface is smooth, easy to use, and looks good, which is nice. There is also some cool features like speed dating, which I haven‚Äôt seen other apps do, but tbh the biggest negative for me is the cost of a subscription. I have the tendency to buy the subscriptions for some apps for like a month at a time once in a while, so I can play with the premium features, but the price is just too much here. It‚Äôs got me double checking sometimes to see if it‚Äôs still that expensive, like maybe I misread it. You‚Äôve got to offer something that stands out from the competition in order to justify a price like that. Not when Hinge or even FB dating has most of the same features like undoing a dislike and seeing who liked you for no cost. 

Just my thoughts though. I‚Äôll still use it, but just nothing premium
title: It‚Äôs okay

We‚Äôd love the opportunity to hear from you! Message us via Facebook or Twitter (@bumble).', 'modified': '2018-09-07T18:42:44Z'}
review: I‚Äôve had this app for a few days now and so far I love it! I‚Äôm finding that the general population of men on this app are actually a lot more frequently guys that I would actually go out with than men on tinder! I also really love that matches disappear after 24 hours if a conversation isn‚Äôt started. It actually makes you engage with other users and helps keep my match feed clean and updated! My biggest request though is that I think it would be really useful to have the option to opt out of the ‚Äúwomen have to send the first message‚Äù thing. I get it, it‚Äôs a great idea, but sometimes I get so busy or I just can‚Äôt think of anything interesting enough to say (I don‚Äôt want to use a generic ‚Äúhey‚Äù) and my match disappears! I end up feeling like I potentially missed out on a really great guy or wondering if they had anything interesting they would have said to me first. Just a suggestion, but I think the ability to opt out would be a great feature! Otherwise I totally love this app! MUCH more worth your time than Tinder.
title: Option to opt out of sending the first message?

If you'd like to chat further, email us at bumble.com/contact.", 'modified': '2022-02-17T21:41:41Z'}
review: I‚Äôve used Bumble on and off since it started years ago, and was excited when they finally added more filters. Now that they put all the useful filters behind a paywall, the app is just like Tinder. I was using the education and relationship type filters to find men with graduate degrees who wanted at least a relationship if not marriage, and found a really decent guy (who ended up getting deployed unfortunately). Now I can‚Äôt find anyone compatible without the filters. Furthermore, you now end up forced to sift through profiles that are far outside what you‚Äôre looking for, which tires you out. I want to delete this app, but I feel like it‚Äôs the only good option compared to the others. Though I‚Äôll never ever pay for the filters or extra filters. I used to love Hinge but I got banned for no reason and created a new profile that never gets any likes or matches. This entire industry of online dating is hopeless and life sucking. Everyone should keep in mind these apps are designed to keep you on there indefinitely - they don‚Äôt have any interest in helping you find a spouse and deleting the app bc then they‚Äôd lose money. Don‚Äôt ever pay for any of the extra features.
title: Crap app

review:
I‚Äôve stayed friends with several of the guys that I‚Äôve met on here - because I can select for education.      But I will echo other reviewers that I haven‚Äôt met a single person on here that does not meet DSM criterial for a mental health disorder. 
The app seems to self select for these folks. 
I‚Äôve meet someone clinically depressed with a Master‚Äôs in his 40s who refuses to treat it. 
I‚Äôve meet multiple codependents and even a sex addict, high functioning otherwise. If they had even once been to the shrink they‚Äôd know it. As a 36 year old former District Attorney who has had to regularly address mental health at my job, the people you will meet on this particular app will typically not be criminals theives wife beaters but the app selects for people who are not well rounded. It seems like nobody on here is just working with a job and ready to date. It seems like everyone on here is looking for a person to fullfil an emptiness that comes from within - hard core on this app it is a real problem.
title: Mental Health

developerResponse: {'id': 12394556, 'body': 'We understand your frustration. If you believe that you were wrongly blocked from the platform, please feel free to private message us @BumbleSupport on Facebook or Twitter so that we can review your case.', 'modified': '2019-12-14T16:44:30Z'}
review:
I‚Äôve used Bumble for about a year ago and then restarted a new account a few months ago. Recently my account was deleted after I went back on app, and I was very surprised knowing that I did not do anything wrong (or perhaps someone might have had reported me? - still surprised me to ask myself ‚Äúwhat just happened?‚Äù). I was agonized about the situation because I had great matches and connections. So later, I made a new account, which had a verified profile, verified phone number and email, with a paid subscription to add further, that it seems Bumble took down my latest account without acknowledgment or reason, again. I reached out to the support team (by several emails sent weekly) and no response. I had to contact Apple to get back all the subscribed refunds since my accounts were blocked or removed from the app. Till this day, I am unsure why Bumble would do such a thing.
Personally, Bumble is careless about loyal customers and brand loyalty. It‚Äôs not fair, especially for me and anyone who deal with this matter, because we want to find connections and dates. I was to believe Bumble would be a great fit for those type of reason to use for dating app, but I was proven wrong.

My name Gretalia.
title: Accounts deleted for no reason

review:
I‚Äôve been on this app on and off for a short while. I consider myself a decent looking guy, at least a 7 on a rating scale looks wise, I work hard to develop good qualities that I would like to see in myself that would make a woman happy and investing there time in me worth while. But I‚Äôve found that I very rarely get any matches on this app,
and when I do it‚Äôs almost always after I‚Äôve uncaringly swiped right for 5-10 minutes consecutively, just to see if this app really does work lol, and then I end up matching with women I don‚Äôt really like... 

I am 5‚Äô5‚Äù, so I don‚Äôt know if that has a huge part in my lack of success, but I can‚Äôt help but feel that dating apps these days are favoring those who invest in the upgraded version of the app. Which makes sense on a business stand point, but makes me feel that these apps are just a wast of time... and I just don‚Äôt feel like throwing $15 away to ‚Äúpotentially‚Äù find a decent woman based off some algorithmic process that is out of my control. Perhaps the old fashion way of just approaching women at group activities, through friend hangouts, and random encounters is the better way to go?
title: Either I‚Äôm Undesirable or this app is Rigged

We really appreciate you taking the time to leave us your feedback about this, and we'll be sure to share it with our Product Team.", 'modified': '2022-07-27T20:58:01Z'}
review: It LACKS ONE great feature. Please for the love of God. It needs to have a ‚Äúsimilar interest‚Äù feature. They have filters that‚Äôs cool, far as relationship wise. But I think it would be amazing if you can filter between people who have your same ‚Äúmy interest.‚Äù So if the both of you are into design, or photography, or both into wine, or cooking, the gym or exploring new cities etc. I feel like if this feature was added it‚Äôll be a better way for people to spark more INTERESTING conversations. Rather than just matching with someone for how they look, & relationship, & religious preference it can create a more in debt conversation because you have similar interest. I‚Äôve run across a few people with the same interest as me & we‚Äôve had some good convos. But it rarely happens so I rarely have matches. Please make this a feature. UGH. Nothing is better to me than running across a girl that‚Äôs into art. But I have to weed through 30 girls to meet with one girl who‚Äôs into the same things as me. Smh
title: Love Bumble but giving 4 stars bc‚Ä¶

review: As a man, Bumble is heavily favored to women. The app is designed well, love the simplicity of how your profile is presented but beside that this app is disappointing. You barely get any likes per day. Probably about 20 or so which you will go through fairly quick but it gets worse. If you swipe right on women you find attractive the algorithm will assume you‚Äôre just mindlessly swiping right for matches and will reduce your available likes even more. The reason is to ‚Äúkeep the connections genuine‚Äù absolutely ridiculous and a greedy ploy to force you to upgrade to their overpriced premium model for unlimited swipes. On top of that when you get a match you have to wait for the women to message you first which hardly ever happens, they just sit there and let the match expire. It‚Äôs nice that you can extend but that hardly ever changes the lack of messages form the women. If you do manage to get a message, it‚Äôs always hey, then you never hear from them again or the conversation expires if you don‚Äôt message them within 24 hours. Overall you‚Äôll have better luck with their competitors on Tinder or Hinge.
title: Lackluster and unfair to the men

Sure it works great and you get like 10 swipes a day... but what it really is doing is turning men and women into literal vending machines where all the adventure is tKen out of spontaneous attraction and dialed down to a measly swipe where we all live on instant gratification and people are LITERALLY shopping for a date. I fall victim of this too and it‚Äôs just toxic for the human soul to shop around everyday for a date and it never gets a real connection. review: They recently changed how people appear in your Beeline. It‚Äôs now based on an algorithm of who they think is your best match. Those ‚Äúbest‚Äù matches will appear at the top of your beeline. The old beeline showed the most recent people that swiped right on you, in that order, which would also be in your vicinity. Lucky for me, I visited Vegas, along with thousands of other people from all over the country, in June. It‚Äôs now October and the Beeline shows that I‚Äôm most compatible with everyone that lives outside of my state. Several people from Nevada, Florida, etc... I‚Äôm in Washington. Now, if I wanted a long distance relationship, that‚Äôd be great, but I don‚Äôt, and Seattle is one of the toughest places to date. I also don‚Äôt have time to endlessly check where people in the Beeline are from and then swipe accordingly. (And I spent a long time trying to clear that out only for it to be an endless endeavor.) Bumble - you have to revert back to the old beeline where you see the recent, local, right-swipes first. Or, give people the option to sort how they want. I can only imagine that this is horrible for people that travel a lot as they‚Äôll never see local, hometown matches at the top.
title: Don‚Äôt pay for it unless you want to endlessly swipe through beeline

Our support team is available 24/7 on Facebook and Twitter (@bumble) and ready to help! We hope to hear from you soon.", 'modified': '2018-08-28T16:28:49Z'}
review:
I really like this app. It‚Äôs got a tinder feel to it with all of the left and right swiping, but I feel like I run across better quality people (for the most part anyway, let‚Äôs be real here lol), and not everyone is wanting just a hookup.
I also love the fact that I have to be the one to initiate the conversation. No more being bombarded with unwanted or creepy messages üòÇ. I didn‚Äôt like this feature at first, but now I‚Äôve come to appreciate it.

One of the major downfalls is even though I said yes to getting notified of new messages, I only get notified about 70% of the time. And other people I‚Äôve talked to have had the same issue. On top of that, there‚Äôs not time stamp on the messages, so you have no idea how long a message has been sitting in your inbox if/when you don‚Äôt get notified and run across it.
And then one improvement to the profile that I‚Äôd love to see, is an area to put what you‚Äôre really there for. A relationship? Hookup? Friends? A serious relationship? Dating? It helps weed out what you don‚Äôt want faster.
title: Almost perfect

review: I initially felt that the good of this app outweighed the bad, and made it a superior choice over other dating apps. I like how the profiles go into more detail, allowing you to know more about users before making your choice, but my favorite thing about the app was the option to filter so that you only saw users with qualities and traits that you are looking for. Being able to filter for height allowed me to narrow the amount of people I saw down to a manageable number. Filtering for what users are looking for prevented me from wasting time swiping through people with different intentions than me. Required profile questions allowed me to learn more about users before I made a decision, which was a big reason that I found bumble the most appealing dating app. Without these features bumble is no better than any of the other apps out there and I might as well switch to other apps that don‚Äôt require women to speak first and let matches expire before a busy person has a chance to reach out if I‚Äôm going to have to swipe through every man in the entire city anyway.
title: Bring back the free advanced filter

review: From what I can tell, the only thing this update did was reduce the number of swipes you get per day from like 100 down to like 20. Why? I‚Äôve probably swiped like 2000 times total and have only ever gotten one match so now it‚Äôs going to take a millennium to get another match. Also, I find it really really really stupid that you only get a certain number of undos before you have to buy more. Like my hand could have slipped or something on a babe and then I have to pay money to go back on it? That‚Äôs ridiculous. Just use tinder. It has way more users and from what I‚Äôve seen from my brothers‚Äô accounts, they‚Äôre generally hotter too. Only reason I‚Äôm not using tinder is because I accidentally put my actual age instead of 18 so... ya. Mistakes have been made since it just locks you out of the app. Also, am I just ugly or is there something else going on with the app that‚Äôs made it so I‚Äôve only ever gotten one match in my 5 months of using it? Like I swipe right on 90% of the girls it recommends but get 0% back even though I‚Äôm basically the all star defender of my lacrosse team.
title: New update is HORRIBLE

review: I‚Äôve been on other dating apps before in the past. I really liked bumble at first because I liked the concept of not getting bombarded by hundreds of messages by creepy men.. I ended up matching with someone and we talked for about a week on the app before we exchanged numbers. Long story short I found out he was a catfish even though he had a blue check mark next to his name meaning he is verified. I thought it was cool that you can verify yourself on this app to try and prevent being catfished but it really didn‚Äôt make a difference. The main thing I also don‚Äôt like is how my location is public. I understand they need my location in order to find local people for me to match with but why does it have to show on my profile for everyone to see? Prior to me finding out that the guy I was taking to was a catfish I noticed one day that he was about 10 miles away from my location even though he lived 60 miles away from me. I don‚Äôt know if this was a coincidence but it was concerning to me. I ended up blocking and reporting him after he finally admitted that he was a catfish and I‚Äôm not sure if bumble did anything or not. As with any other dating app there will be catfish and creeps but just be careful.
title: Not satisfied

review:
In all honesty, Bumble does make a good app. I prefer it Hinge and Match. You can put as much or as little information as you want, but I doubt it matters either way.

I‚Äôve been on this app for a few months and only got two likes from people who didn‚Äôt even match well with me. I ended up paying for Premium to see what likes I got, only to be disappointed. Unfortunately, the advanced filters don‚Äôt help much either. They narrow it down to a few people, but my main issue is that it gives me people WAY too far away for my liking. I have my distance set for 10-12 miles but I repeatedly get people 19-21 miles away, even with no advanced filters.

Bumble puts the right tools in front of you to find different people, but it doesn‚Äôt change the fact that at least half to three quarters of them either aren‚Äôt on the app or don‚Äôt acknowledge likes, which makes it incredibly hard to meet people on these apps. Like I said in the title, it‚Äôs bad, but it‚Äôs not Bumble‚Äôs fault. It‚Äôs the people on Bumble, Tinder, etc. And everyone wonders why they have issues dating‚Ä¶
title: It‚Äôs not good, but it‚Äôs not the app‚Äôs fault.

review: I find it kind of weird that Bumble stresses ‚Äòfeminism‚Äô SO MUCH but I don‚Äôt really understand what‚Äôs feminist about it? Women are the ones in charge of starting conversations, which more often than not feels like a burden rather than a right. It‚Äôs 2019‚Äìactual feminists recognize that men do not need to be doing all of the initiating! Most women are not scared to start a conversation, especially if they‚Äôve matched with someone on their dating app; we don‚Äôt need to be thrust into conversation-starting like that, it feels paternalistic, tbh. And the conversation prompts are stupid, like the ‚ÄúI feel most empowered when...‚Äù ?? It‚Äôs weird to see female empowerment commodified in this way. It cheapens it. Obviously, this isn‚Äôt all bumbles fault: they were trying to solve an epidemic of harassment through dating apps, but the root of the problem is societal gender differences, not the functions of the app itself. Other than that, Bumble is a good app. Gets the job done. I would love if we could delete conversation prompts from our bio if we don‚Äôt want them anymore!!!!
title: Is it really feminist?

This app seems was designed to swindle lonely people. When I had the free version it showed blurry bubbles and a message stating 9 people liked my profile, and I had to get the paid app to find out who. I enrolled for a month which was $22. Then I checked who liked me, there were only 3 people instead of 9, and they were from far away. So I adjusted my distance parameters to 50 miles. This adjustment ended up my options. Since then I‚Äôm getting literally zero, one or luckily two profiles to view per day, and a screen advising me to check later for more. I can‚Äôt even see the people I liked. 
I wrote Bumble various emails to request them to provide me with the service, or to disconnect my account and reimburse the remaining days (which was more than 3 weeks), or to downgrade my service for the weekly rate. 
They apologized they couldn‚Äôt do anything. On top of that, despite I live in a very well populated city, with more than a million inhabitants, they suggested me to extend my searching parameters, and asked me to recommend them to my friends so I could have a ‚Äúbuzzing experience‚Äù.  
This looks like joke, but it isn‚Äôt. Learn from my experience and don‚Äôt waste your money.

review: I just tried sending my 4th message. I have yet to have anyone reach out to help me. This is the worst customer service experience I have ever had. I first messaged on 10/14 and received an automated email telling me someone would reach out to me within 48 hours, nobody ever did. After 48 hours I messaged 3 different times restating my issue and none of these messages even got an automated reply back. Today I received an email from bumble asking to take a short survey and rate how the service I received was, I was never answered by anyone! I tried out the week of premium unaware it was a subscription, it‚Äôs not made very clear. And when it was up on the 13th, the same day I was sedated and wheeled into surgery I was charged for a whole additional week which I absolutely do not want and did not plan to use and did not use because I had surgery and was healing. I wanted a refund for that second week I was charged. That week has already come and gone because nobody at their team is responding. I couldn‚Äôt be more upset and frustrated. I used bumble a few years ago and enjoyed it but this experience has tainted the whole app for me.

review: Bumble says it wants to create more intentional swiping, but then removed users ability to set two filters. I also had education set and now have to swipe through men who don‚Äôt meet that requirement either. How is this more intentional? The location portion is also not helping to create relationships. I don‚Äôt want to match with men who do not live in my area yet this app will show me location only and not where someone actually lives. What is the point of that other than a hookup? The short timeframe of 24 hours to message also has caused me to lose matches I‚Äôm interested in pursuing because I got busy or didn‚Äôt get the notification I have a match. Some men don‚Äôt respond in 24 hours either causing the match to be lost as well. The app also is glitchy when scrolling down sometimes it randomly swipes a profile to the left or right when I‚Äôm scrolling down. In short, this app seems like Tinder in that it‚Äôs for hookups and not for creating a meaningful relationship.

review: So I have been a paying user on Bumble for YEARS, without any issues what so ever. Several months back I meet a woman and we begin a relationship. After a few months I find out she is MARRIED and I break things off with her, naturally. This woman has then proceeded to try and smear my name at every turn. She writes a complaint about me to Bumble who has since shut my account down with no chance of a review. Their customer service just sends me a generic message that all decisions are final. Is there a chance of my profile being restored? How about reimbursements for my paid subscription(s)? Yeah right. This all feels very unfair to me. I‚Äôve not had any issues in years on this application and one complaint made by a motivated individual has me completely blacklisted? I just don‚Äôt understand how the facts point in such a way where I have violated any of Bumbles terms or conditions? I‚Äôve been a model paying user with high engagement and someone who misrepresented themselves through their profile has the ability to get me unilaterally blocked. I am having a hard time wrapping my head around this. All the time and money invested into my profile and they could care less. Just wow.
title: Lack of Transparency

If you ever experience abusive behavior from anyone on Bumble please don't hesitate to contact our team at feedback@team.bumble.com.", 'modified': '2019-04-18T23:28:21Z'}
review: Many use online dating as a way to hookup, and then there are those of us who have demanding jobs and can‚Äôt go out all the time in the hope of meeting someone. I initially tried bumble because I had hoped there‚Äôd be fewer creepy guys here given that it‚Äôs all about woman messaging first, etc. Well, maybe a few years ago that was the case. Nowadays it seems like everyone wants an open relationship/hookup, or you‚Äôre matched with guys way outside your preferences. Even if you make a connection (and are clear you‚Äôre looking for long-term), most of the men will be looking for hookups. Many times messaging will fall flat, or you‚Äôll connect and they‚Äôll never respond to your first message and it will expire. On the brief chance that you do actually go out - 9 times out of 10 they‚Äôll never contact you again despite trying to set up a second date. Dating prior to using apps would always lead to second and third dates, so I learned the hard way that it‚Äôs not me - it‚Äôs the kind of men who use these apps. Be warned. If you‚Äôre looking for a hookup this will work out for you, if not, save yourself trouble and heartache and try meeting someone in person instead.
title: If you like hookups or being ghosted

review: I do like the selection for the most part except it isn‚Äôt geared enough for a relationship. I wish they were more conscientious of people who want a real and serious relationship instead of hookups. You do get a lot of matches but I wish you guys would increase the quality and make this more relationship based. Also, I hate how women need to do the contacting first. It makes men lazy and women do the pursuing, which is weird. It‚Äôs also inconvenient when you have a busy schedule. I can‚Äôt stand how you only have 24 hours to message them and they only have 24 hours to respond. It defeats the whole purpose of matching, and you could miss out on some potentially good people that way. I really wish the developers would take away the whole ‚Äúwomen need to message first‚Äù thing. It feels unnatural and masculine. Maybe they should have it where women who prefer to message first can have it that way and women who don‚Äôt mind being contacted first can have it that way too. Like having different settings for it.
title: Makes men lazy

review:
I get over 200 likes a day, and I pick about 5 to 10 from them to match with, but only 1 out of 10 if non would respond back to my thoughtful message that I spend at least 3-5 mins to think about what to write.
It is so disappointed that a lot of guys there just swipe right on anyone to get as much matches as possible, then to get as much messages as possible without even carrying about responding back! 
I would suggest that you give a few free right- swipe a day to limit this issue and get more serious people that know what they‚Äôre looking for, not only to swipe right on any one.
Also, maybe you can add some rules to lower the right-swipe chances even more for those who don‚Äôt respond to at least 3 messages or something like that.
Other than that, I liked the app and how it‚Äôs designed. I would give 5 starts if you change the right-swipe strategy.
title: Add limited free right-swipe per day

developerResponse: {'id': 31222010, 'body': "We're sorry you didn't enjoy your experience on Bumble. Our team would love the opportunity to improve your experience in the Hive! We're sure we‚Äôll have you up and buzzin' again in no time!", 'modified': '2022-08-02T02:08:59Z'}
review:
I had a bumble all of last year through the pandemic. It was great, I got multiple likes, matches, and dates out of it. I then hit a rough patch and took a break from dating and stopped using my account for a few months. Once I got back on my feet I wanted to put myself
out there and start dating again. I wanted a fresh start so I deleted and recreated my account. Since doing so, I might only get 3-4 likes per a week which is a drastic decrease. I‚Äôm using the exact same profile pictures and prompts that I did last year, only now my profile has almost no activity, and the amount of swipes bumble gives you on a daily basis is now extremely low. This app really fell off. I did some research and found that a lot of other people have had the same issue when deleting and recreating their profiles. Apparently it‚Äôs called ‚Äúshadow banning,‚Äù which either has the app not show your profile, or show it at a minimum. It‚Äôs probably their way of forcing people to buy and pay for their ‚Äúspotlight‚Äù feature so their profiles get more attention. But either way, don‚Äôt bother with this app anymore. Go to hinge instead.
title: Algorithm change or banned

developerResponse: {'id': 29965346, 'body': "Thank you for reaching out about this! We want to assure you that all our core features are free. Please send us a message here: bumble.com/contact. We‚Äôre here for you! üíõ", 'modified': '2022-05-25T15:36:48Z'}
review:
And they've become just as corrupt as every other dating app. The first thing you're met with is a subscription dashboard. They really separate themselves in that sense. They make it clear that the sole purpose of the app is to take money. 

But my main problem was the unexplained censorship. I used a photo that was perfectly fine on match, hinge, and coffee meets bagel but not Bumble. They refused to explain why they were taking the photo down when I messaged them and I looked up the guidelines and my photo was perfectly fine. Bumble must have some Puritan standards because that extremism is the only way the photo could be considered inappropriate. I guess my halloween costume as a vampire bunny from the ribcage up was just too raunchy for their Puritan standards. Must gave been the exposed shoulders and uncovered collar bones. That or the moderation system is a really catty insecure person. 

Online dating should make dating so much easier since the person has a chance to tell you about themselves and you can determine compatibility, but instead it's been ruined by greed. It was much better across the board 6 years ago.
title: Hadn't used this app in 5 years

developerResponse: {'id': 27518889, 'body': "We really appreciate your feedback, and we'll be sure to share it with our Product Team. review:
I don‚Äôt usually leave reviews, but I‚Äôm more than a little irritated by the fact that Bumble decided to remove the 2 free advanced filters. You used to be able to add two advanced filters (religion, politics, whether they smoke, etc) for free before having to pay for premium to use more. Now you can‚Äôt use any filters without paying for premium, which costs way more than it should. Greedy move on Bumble‚Äôs part, and a huge pain for me. Now I have to sort through a bunch of matches with whom I have nothing in common. This change comes after Bumble already removed the three free ‚Äúbacktracks‚Äù in case you accidentally swiped left on someone. 
In addition, Bumble has a clear political ideology they like to push on their users. While this isn‚Äôt shocking as most companies are jumping on the ‚Äúwoke‚Äù politics bandwagon now, it‚Äôs definitely a major annoyance when I‚Äôm just on the app to meet  people. Also rather ironic of Bumble to push a political agenda supposedly about generosity towards those with low-income and then remove a bunch of key free features.
title: The app has gotten greedy and overly political

developerResponse: {'id': 24914353, 'body': "Hi there, we're sorry to hear that you have experienced this issue whilst subscribing for a free trial. review:
Bumble is misleading users with ‚ÄúFree Trials‚Äù and will state that your subscription will renew with a charge once the trial ends unless you cancel it. Okay I get it; but what they don‚Äôt state upfront under that very same statement is that the system automatically charges your card immediately upon hitting that subscribe button without ANY warnings if it senses that you‚Äôve already had a free trial in the past.  Who is keeping up with free trials and how am I suppose to know?! Now they‚Äôve stuck me with $72 for a 3 month subscription that I do not want or need. I want my money back!! 

I know you folks at bumble already know this and this is how you con people into getting their money. But once the ‚Äúsystem senses‚Äù you‚Äôve offered a ‚Äúfree trial‚Äù to a user while they are attempting to subscribe to said ‚Äúfree trial,‚Äù instead of immediately trying to steal their money, an automatic notification window should pop up warning them that they have already used a free trial followed by asking members if they still want to proceed with the transaction. You all know  better. Stop coning/ tricking folks into stealing from them. I have records of paid services, not ‚Äúfree trials.‚Äù
title: Misleading Free Trial

review: The app itself is pretty decent. Cool setup for the profile page, asks lots of cool introductory questions. Not why I‚Äôm writing the review tho. I initially just got the app to get laid but then I met this amazing, intelligent, funny, sweet, easy going, beautiful girl. She‚Äôs like my new best friend and if it wasn‚Äôt for the fact she goes to school so far away I would most definitely ask her to be my girlfriend. My assumptions and ideas I had about the type of people l‚Äôd meet on bumble were definitely very wrong, I met a girl who‚Äôs personality I thought  couldn‚Äôt even be found in my dreams, let alone on bumble, not too long later and she‚Äôs someone I really care about; I love her, she‚Äôs so amazing. I‚Äôve never written any type of review in my life, but she‚Äôs so special I felt I owed bumble a little credit. But anyway, I‚Äôd recommend the app solely on that basis, you never know who you‚Äôll run into, might just meet your best friend. But if ur looking to just get action, tinder is the moveüòÇ

I made an in-app purchase which I truly, truly regret. If you are thinking of paying them, think again before making this error. The app basically does not work, it‚Äôs glitchy and works when it feels like working causing me to be unable to actually speak to my matches. review: I‚Äôve been on a lot of dating apps. This is by far probably the best app. The fact that the women has to message you first means that she‚Äôs already interested in you. It‚Äôs a great boost of confidence to know someone is attracted to you. Anyway I deleted this app a couple months ago because I finally met my dream girl. I‚Äôm writing this review in the off chance it helps someone. I was on this app for probably about 3 years. I‚Äôm not going to say it‚Äôs an easy process. For me there were long periods of time in between when I would actually match with someone and even longer for when the match would send me a message. Anyway don‚Äôt give up hope, keep swiping. Remember that your match might not even be on the app yet and that it‚Äôs a lesson in patience to find her. Be yourself, be honest in your profile, and treat the women on here with respect. You will find someone, there is someone out there for everyone. Just keep searching. And keep your chin up!

I‚Äôve been using bumble for a while now and I love it because I feel like it‚Äôs less for hook-ups and more for actually meeting people and getting to know them. But, I do have some friends who enjoy it so I decided to download it today and give it a try. A few hours later I saw an error message and found out that I was banned. This confused me because I did not have any nudity, hate, violence, etc. In fact, I actually had written ‚Äúno hookups‚Äù in my bio because I‚Äôm not like that. With that being said, I wold recommend getting bumble over tinder any day. I love bumble for MANY reasons:

3) I‚Äôve actually met a lot of cool people and made some really good friends!
4) I‚Äôm glad there are different modes. I like being able to switch between bumble date and bumble bff. My friend Kayla and I met on bumble and went out a couple times and now we‚Äôre like best friends.

review: I have been using bumble for a while and have always really liked it. It‚Äôs easy to use and I find that the people I have to choose from are higher quality. It‚Äôs also very easy to filter people you aren‚Äôt interested in thanks to their preferences feature. Today though, Bumble exceeded my expectations. I reported a profile (first time reporting anyone) because I had met up with him after we agreed to hangout and talk. He was not who his profile said he was and he repeatedly tried to force himself onto me. I said no very clearly a bunch of times until he finally let me leave. After I reported his profile, Bumble immediately emailed me to ask if I was okay and said that they had blocked his profile from Bumble. I was simply reporting it just in case others had the same issue with this guy. Bumble actually listened and their response was really professional and thoughtful. It‚Äôs nice to know that they take safety so seriously! Thanks bumble!
title: Safety is Number 1

review: If I could have given her zero stars I would. I logged on the other day andFound out I had been banned for God only knows what reason. At the very least require some kind of evidence (a screenshot of the alleged ‚Äúrude/threatening messages, or some kind of picture uploaded to show that the complaint is authentic and not based on someone in their feelings cause the did not get a response) to prove the claim against someone is genuine. review: This app used to be of the best quality and I personally thought it was above all the other dating sites. I recently started using the app again and I saw some very subtle but bad changes.. First of all, I‚Äôm pretty sure the pricing for boost was raised, or at least the week trial was, I don‚Äôt remember it being 11 dollars. Second, they made it frustrating to get to the people that liked you (if you aren‚Äôt boost) I remember getting notifications for people liking me and then when I opened the app, they were one of the first cards that appeared in the swipeline and I matched. Now I‚Äôve swiped until I reached my limit and didn‚Äôt find the people who liked me! so I have to wait until the next day. Which brings me to my third point, the limit. For some reason there‚Äôs a limit to how much you can swipe now, that‚Äôs got to be the worst change from this app so far.
