Whatever you are promoting, or maybe it‚Äôs the fact that bumble supports successful women? There are clearly more high quality men here. I don‚Äôt mean men that make bank. I mean educated, thoughtful, POLITE guys that are truly honest about relationship intentions.

Bumble team, 
I want to thank you for creating this amazing platform! This has been a life changing experience for me. Personally, Bumble hasn‚Äôt only served a dating app, but it was a huge support in my liberation process. 
I have grown up in a extremely misogynistic community where I inherited most of the behaviors, self-concept, and everything about ‚Äúlove‚Äù and ‚Äúpartnership.‚Äù Unsurprisingly, this was a miserable time of my life, and after I reflected, it was all connected to my lack self awareness, self love, and boundaries. This process has freed me from my fears, anxieties, and the misogyny that had controlled me for 3 decades. Thank you for being with me on this journey and helping me love life ‚ù§Ô∏è

Just opened my bumble the other day to being logged out and tried to log in and said I was ‚Äúblocked‚Äù I emailed the support team and got a vague ‚Äúafter investigation we decided to permanently ban you‚Äù for what though? They never tell you even if you ask. The best part is that the other users on here who try to speak out against them for banning for no reason get told ‚Äúwe would never do that‚Äù WHAT A JOKE! I‚Äôve done nothing wrong and I‚Äôm SURE most of these people rating you 1 star for banning them really didn‚Äôt do anything wrong either because I‚Äôve now experienced it first hand. I can only assume I was reported for not answering a man or them thinking I was a ‚Äúcatfish‚Äù even though I‚Äôm VERIFIED. developerResponse: {'id': 5472711, 'body': "Hey Kim, we work hard to keep a database of high quality real users, and our moderation team works 24/7 to spot any malicious profiles. Most of our users are really who they say they are! However, if you're still suspicious, we urge you to use the reporting feature to notify our moderators about a potential fake profile.", 'modified': '2018-10-12T09:39:22Z'}
review:
Almost every negative review is correct. I paid (mainly out of curiosity) to see who had already swiped right since there were so many. I reached out to some to which I usually got no response. I started to get suspicious when I‚Äôd see new matches appear in real time so I‚Äôd contact them right away, sometimes just asking ‚ÄúAre you real‚Äù since they literally just ‚Äúalleged‚Äù swiped right and when I automatically messaged them, I got no response. If you pay, test it, you‚Äôll see. It seems as though Bumble ‚Äúentices‚Äù you by telling you you have a million awaiting matches so pay and when you do, almost none are real (or don‚Äôt respond). The odds of that happening are very high, way too high for there not to be something going on with Bumble behind the scenes. 

If you want to play around, as I said, it is user friendly and the recent upgrades that allow you to put height, political affiliations etc. is long overdue, but if you pay for upgrades, don‚Äôt expect much. Lastly, I agree that you should be be allowed to be on the app without a written profile.
title: User friendly but not great and don‚Äôt pay for upgraded features

review: But that‚Äôs mostly due to the fact that apparently all of the girls in my city just want to get drunk, and that‚Äôs not my cup of tea. I‚Äôm not blaming BumbleBFF for uninteresting people. I think my biggest problem with the app is that your matches expire so quickly. My schedule is all over the place, and I often miss out on matches because I didn‚Äôt have time to check it for a couple of days. I don‚Äôt see how that feature is necessary. Another issue is the fact that there doesn‚Äôt seem to be anyone checking the profiles to remove/temporarily disable users that have been inactive for a very long time or have straight-up lied on their profile. I‚Äôve seen several that have an age listed, but in their bio blatantly claim that the age is a lie & they are much younger than they say they are. Maybe, there should also be a reminder that pops up when people use the app in a new physical location to update their bio because I see a TON of profiles where the bio says, ‚ÄúJust moved to (insert place 2,000 miles away) and looking for new friends,‚Äù but the profile says they‚Äôre only like 7 miles away.
title: Months later still haven‚Äôt met anyone

We'd love to help improve your experience, please reach out to us on Facebook or Twitter (@BumbleSupport). üíõ", 'modified': '2022-10-02T13:14:45Z'}
review:
I have to say, I do enjoy the app & am potentially interested in its features. Unfortunately, I find the swipe sensitivity ‚Äútoo sensitive‚Äù. You‚Äôll be swiping & finally come across someone who sparks your interest, but if you‚Äôre too quick and/or trying to view their profile by swiping upwards, it‚Äôll automatically swipe left. I‚Äôve sadly experienced this multiple times when simply trying to view someone‚Äôs profile by swiping up. Of course you have to pay in order to ‚Äúrewind‚Äù the selection. 

Overall, it‚Äôs a great platform for encouraging women to make the first move & hopefully avoid any unwanted male harassment/sexual solicitation. They even (apparently?) donate all women's first moves to charities of their choice (whatever the credits amount to).  

I think if y‚Äôall are truly trying to establish connections via virtual apps, there should be a price reduction/limitation. Especially if people feel they need to establish themselves more than once. We stopped paying for dates after unwanted sexual harassment, PLEASE don‚Äôt make us pay for virtual connections as well!!!!
title: Swipe Sensitivity

developerResponse: {'id': 25061634, 'body': "Hi there, thank you so much for giving us this feedback, and we'll be sure to pass it on to our Product Team so we can continue to improve the app. In the meantime our team would love the opportunity to improve your experience in the Hive! Please message our Support Team on Twitter or Facebook (@bumblesupport) so we can get you back up and buzzin'.", 'modified': '2021-09-13T08:28:13Z'}
review:
Few people that match with you on dating apps these days have any interest in actually meeting in person. Most are just looking for new Instagram followers and many will just constantly insist on engaging in pointless small talk in text and avoid the subject whenever you want to actually meet up in person to get to know each other. LA is already a tough place to find anyone with depth, but apps like these honestly fuel a certain disdain for the opposite sex (on both sides, I know dudes have their problems too). 

Bumble, like Tinder also doesn‚Äôt show your profile barely at all after the first few days. I went from getting 10+ likes every day to barely getting 2 in a week. They just try to encourage you to pay extra for their features that should just be part of the app in general. Dating apps are scams, It would be nice to go on one that was actually interested in getting people to go on dates and not just spend extra time on their phones leading to absolutely nothing but a slightly lowered self esteem and opinion of others.
title: Dating apps are time wasters

review: Matches are not loading in the que. I receive notifications and the message icon at the top blinks as if there is a new match, but the que remains blank. I have tried deleting and re-downloading, but no change. As a guy paying for a premium version this makes me want to delete it. Also the super swipes are too expensive. It is the only direct way to connect with someone and at a dollar each you are practically gambling your money away. There is no guarantee that anything will come of it. The strangest thing and I don‚Äôt know if it‚Äôs just a coincidence or what, but it seems to use the same match logarithm as tinder. I consistently swipe the same people between both apps within the same time period. I don‚Äôt know if they are both using the same third party for the card deck, but it is very strange?!? Maybe someone has more info on this this or has seen the same thing, but I definitely don‚Äôt want to be paying the premium for both apps when they just end up being the same. In a large city like DC I would expect this not to happen even with similar search preferences.
title: Glitchy and Expensive

review: I like the app in general I don‚Äôt think much is wrong with it other than the ‚Äúboost‚Äù. Honestly to me its kind of low to require people to pay 10 dollars a week just to see who matched with you. Also, the app is very sensitive and at least 10-20 times I have accidentally swiped left on people just trying to scroll through their profile and I can‚Äôt get it back without paying. I know at least once I saw a profile and I was really really interested and trying to scroll back to the top of his profile it swiped left and I couldn‚Äôt get it back. Maybe to some people 10 dollars is no big deal but I don‚Äôt have a lot of money to be spending that on a a dating app. If you want to charge a few dollars to see the beeline then fine, but things like going back on someone you accidentally swiped left on or keeping a conversation after 24 hours should be free. Stop trying to profit off of people like that. Im sorry if this sounds mean or cheap but thats just me.
title: I hate the ‚ÄúBoost‚Äù feature

review: I really do love the idea of this app. I think most men in 2022 want women to be more empowered in the dating process. I just wish they took this opportunity. Sadly, the reality is that Bumble exposes womens‚Äô lack of desire or commitment to the idea of being the chaser. I would get several matches a day and 10% would write nothing and 89% would write ‚Äúhey‚Äù or a wave emoji. Only 1% would actually start a conversation. Basically, in my not-so-polically-correct opinion, it seems that women on Bumble would rather pass the onus back onto the man instead of taking the reigns the way the app was designed! As a result, I‚Äôve had far less meaningful conversations compared to Bumble‚Äôs competitors. I‚Äôm sure there must be a way Bumble can address this issue but they have never put any effort into adding prompts or questionnaires or giving women any leg up on the pickup game. After all, they put the ball in womens‚Äô court here. Shouldn‚Äôt they help get things rolling a bit if women won‚Äôt take the initiative? review: Won‚Äôt even lie, after 4+ years on and off on Tinder, Ok Cupid, Plenty of Fish, Hinge and of course, Bumble, I‚Äôd started to lose hope. Fast forward 12+ months, 500+ miles (he moved!) and countless hours of FaceTime later I can confidently say that being on Bumble helped me find one of my soulmates. Our story wasn‚Äôt smooth and seamless, and we‚Äôre still working toward that apartment in the city where we can see each other every day, but as clich√© as this is: it sure was worth it. If you‚Äôre reading this and you‚Äôre losing hope, just know that there are things being orchestrated behind the scenes that you have no idea about. I inquired further and got a message from a woman named sarah who told me that since 3 girls reported me as fake i was permanently banned and it was irreversible. She told me that all bans are looked through thoroughly and would never be overturned. I had my account for less than 24 hours and only had 4 matches.. they didn‚Äôt review anything at all. So if you‚Äôre a guy on bumble and 3 girls report you for any reason at all or just to troll you, then you are instantly and permanently banned no questions asked. I give the app 0 stars and the employees -5 stars. Moral of the story, if you‚Äôre a guy don‚Äôt bother wasting your time. Go to tinder or hinge or any other dating app but bumble.

review: So i‚Äôve had this app for a couple months now. It great really, i‚Äôve meet some really cool people. I bought a one week trail back in September or so to see what it was all about. A had over 90+ people in my beeline each day and usually whittled it down throughout the day. My week ended and I kept using the app, matched with people regularly and everything was fine. A month or so went by and I bought a whole month of bumble boost. I then discovered that you can use filters to filter out anything, say you only wanted to look for people that prefer dogs, you can filter out people who only like cats, or lots of animals, ect. Well, i‚Äôm not sure if turning on the filters hides your profile from others with those selections, but i have only had like 9 people in total in my beeline since i bought the month boost. I don‚Äôt know if something is up with the algorithm or if it‚Äôs just a gimmick. It would be a great marketing scam if you made the first time customer rich with people in their beeline. Then when they come back to repurchase you starve them. Not saying that‚Äôs what happened, but something is up.
title: Bost is Dry

review:
I‚Äôve used the Major Three apps on and off for two years. Bumble has been the worst of the three. Lot of old, abandoned profiles. Also noticing more and more bots. Not as bad as Tinder but pretty bad.

In general, this feels more like a ‚ÄúLonely Single Ladies Chat App‚Äù than a dating app where the expectation is to actually meet up. Also Bumble has leaned pretty hard into ‚Äúwoke‚Äù ‚Ä¶ so now every single woman is neurodivergent, non-binary, with whatever hashtag cause Bumble is giving out badges for ‚Ä¶ I don‚Äôt necessarily have a problem with any of that, but it clearly creates a sort of trend surfing that more closely resembles TikTok. Just makes it that much harder to figure out how genuine people are.

On top of it ‚Äî the premium version has gotten more and more expensive, and the value is a lot less. I don‚Äôt mind dropping whatever a month if I am getting quality matches and going on dates pretty frequently. But don‚Äôt see the value when the matches aren‚Äôt there and every conversion either trails off or you get unmatched because you asked someone out instead of just ‚Ä¶ chatting.

review: I am just divorced and moving to a new, unfamiliar location. I thought this app would be a way to make new connections and start building a new circle of friends. I had to make a choice of what I was after to start the process of joining. There is no way to change that choice once you give them your money. I chose BFF because I don‚Äôt want a relationship yet. I chose BFF thinking this was co-ed. I want friends - both sexes and maybe some casual dating with the opposite sex. BFF is same sex only - that was never mentioned and I am locked into BFF. If I wanted to date I needed to select relationship before buying the 3 month premium. It will also only connect you with people in your physical location using your phone‚Äôs location services. I want to make connections in the new location which I will only be in a few days at a time for the next couple months. You can only message customer service and you get an auto reply explaining how busy they are and they will try to get back to you in 48 hrs. I feel very ripped off. I should have read the reviews first. I am not alone in my complaints.
title: Waste of money - 3 mo premium

developerResponse: {'id': 31242490, 'body': 'Thanks for letting us know we‚Äôre on the right track. Our team is constantly working hard to improve Bumble for our customers, so that means so much. We‚Äôll make sure your positive feedback is heard by the rest of the team! üíõ', 'modified': '2022-08-02T22:38:30Z'}
review:
In my experience Bumble has been pleasant. 
Not matching with someone; or them not matching you goes widely unnoticed on both ends, taking out a percentage of the rejection/rejecting factors, and enhances user experience. As there is no way for someone to see if they have been matched until they have been. 
Females get to message first after both parties have matched, this is done with in a 24 hour time period which can be extended by either party. Message prompts for matches with bumble interest options in common for those who may have a timid side to use. 
I highly suggest the lifetime membership as there is a sense of relief for those of us experienced enough to know it is best to take the time and not rush into a match. With a lifetime membership I have the availability to be particular, and to feel out bumble one day at a time with no time constrictions. ‚ÄúBumble, the way relationships are found online‚Äù. ‚ÄúSafe and discreet‚Äù -winter p.
title: 10 weeks of Bumble

review: So far Bumble is the best dating app Ive used. Ive met a lot of real women and had a lot of great dates. However, my biggest complaint is that you cant set a permanent city where you live. Which is so frustrating because I travel a lot for work as well as go to a lot of sporting events, concerts, and conferences in various cities. And each time I do so, I match with a TON of women from those cities where Im visiting then when I get home, they're like wait you don't live here?!  (in the city where we match) and Im like no I live such and such place and they're like I don't want a long distance relationship (even though Im always less than 3 hours away from where they live) and they say I deceived them or wasn't honest about where I live. And Im like, no the app stalked me and said my current city was Orlando or wherever I was that day, but I really live in Ft Meyers sorry about that. So it would be helpful if you allowed us to set our home city instead of changing it every time we get in our car and go somewhere. Thanks!

review: It amazes me how difficult it‚Äôs been after having my heart shattered. Driven to pure motivation, wanting to prove to myself that I am capable of finding love again. Even as much as to pour an excessive amount of money into an app that is no more than a front to make you think it‚Äôs working. I won‚Äôt say the embarrassing amount of money I‚Äôve spent this past year but what I will say it doesn‚Äôt work. Being in the spotlight for days at a time (all day) and not getting one match. And when I do I swear on my life it‚Äôs with people I never swiped right on or someone who lives a few states away. Like genuinely what the heck man? Spend so much money and time, the definition of investment and seeing the very little amount this app has done for me in one year is more than disappointing. I feel stupid now and you have 100% better chances of meeting someone in the real world. I‚Äôm a good person, just heartbroken and the app takes nothing but advantage of that. It‚Äôs unrewarding, unforgiving, equivalent to some of the biggest scams out there. Welcome to bumble, only use for it is getting stung. Such irony.
title: One year in, one year regretted

developerResponse: {'id': 27510700, 'body': "We're sorry you didn't enjoy your experience on Bumble. Our team would love the opportunity to improve your experience in the Hive! Please message our Support Team on Twitter or Facebook (@BumbleSupport) and we'd be happy to help.", 'modified': '2022-01-18T11:19:42Z'}
review: I‚Äôve tried half a dozen dating apps and bumble used to be the best in my opinion. But with increasingly busier schedules, it‚Äôs ridiculous you only have 24 hours to match and get a reply with someone before they disappear forever. And with some of the updates I‚Äôm very frustrated that the two free ‚Äúadvanced‚Äù filters have been completely taken away leaving you to have to pay for their premium options to get anything close to what you‚Äôre looking for without spending countless hours weeding through people. For certain things that can be dealbreakers for people, it was great to already be able have those taken off the table. I also don‚Äôt like that they have now put a cap on how many people you can see a day. And it would be nice if they would not show people‚Äôs profiles if they have no pictures and no prompts or bio: profile quality has really gone down hill.  Let‚Äôs face it, no one really likes dating apps, this one used to be the least painful, but now I will probably be deleting this like the rest.
title: Progressively Getting Worse

developerResponse: {'id': 7141389, 'body': "We're sorry this happened. Inclusivity is always a priority for our team, and we want everyone to always feel comfortable, confident, and empowered in the Hive. We are actively working on some key initiatives in terms of making our app inclusive for people across all spectrums of sexual orientation & gender identity. Please DM us on Twitter or FB!", 'modified': '2019-02-04T07:05:11Z'}
review:
I‚Äôd love to give it more than 1 star, but I am forced to give it only 1 based on what I am about to say. I am a female-born NCAA athlete in a women‚Äôs sport who first used Bumble Dating in 2017 and made my profile under the gender option of ‚ÄúWoman‚Äù and used it for a bit. I recently downloaded Bumble again for the BFF mode. Being ‚Äúout‚Äù as a trans athlete has been risky but I wanted to change my gender to male because that is how I have always identified and I now feel more comfortable being out.

You‚Äôd think, okay, that should be easy enough. Nope. My profile has been ‚Äúphoto-verified‚Äù for the previous gender of ‚Äúwoman‚Äù, so I have to contact support in order to change it now. Besides the fact that it‚Äôs VERY exclusive to trans people, who may identify as non-binary or something outside the man/woman binary, it‚Äôs ridiculously dumb. I should be able to change my gender to match how I identify without the hassle of contacting support. This app should be more inclusive for those who may have atypical life experiences and who aren‚Äôt just ‚Äúmen‚Äù or ‚Äúwomen‚Äù. Unless there was some sort of adjustment for that, I will always see this as a 1 star app and I‚Äôll make it known that I believe it to be unfair.
title: Excludes Trans People

developerResponse: {'id': 33905223, 'body': "We're sorry you didn't enjoy your experience on Bumble. We are always looking for ways to improve our users' experience on the app so we will make sure to pass your input along to our Product Team.", 'modified': '2022-12-23T19:23:43Z'}
review:
I‚Äôve had my Bumble account for about three years now, and I have had some success in reaching men (as a woman) who were moderately active in their account. Unfortunately, like many apps, it has its downsides. 

The first of them being that the advertised pictures to coax you into downloading the app are nowhere near close to the photos you actually see, in terms of quality. You‚Äôll have very pixelated photos and the accuracy of the size(of the actually photo versus the size you are shown) is misleading. I like to see high quality pictures, but I understand now everyone has a high quality camera. When I see low quality, I think low interest in the actual usage/goal of the app and it‚Äôs user.

Secondly, you should not have to pay to have unlimited swipes. The point of a dating app is to see who you like based off their profile, not to ‚Äòsave‚Äô your likes for just the ones who really stand out. Same reason for advanced filters. 

The more positive note I have is that I have gotten more replies on here than anywhere else (by just a couple people), and some conversations have moved into different methods like texting or Snapchat. If anyone is downloading this for the first time, it may take a while to find someone you match with. I‚Äôd also recommend downloading other apps as well because, of course, Bumble isn‚Äôt the only dating app out there. 

Good luck finding your person!
title: Could be better, but also could be worse

developerResponse: {'id': 12850678, 'body': "You're correct that the Beeline (user who already liked your profile) is only available with a premium subscription, but you can still make matches without making a purchase. Please keep in mind expired matches are put back into the swipe deck so you have another chance to match. DM us on Facebook or Twitter so we can improve your experience!", 'modified': '2020-01-10T19:53:50Z'}
review:
I used this app for a couple of months and the few matches I got ended up timing out, so not once did I have a conversation with someone. Matches only last 24 hours and people don‚Äôt want to check Bumble BFF every day. I had tons of hidden matches that I could only unlock if I paid, so I ended up deleting the app because I‚Äôm not willing to pay for just being able to chat with someone who has similar interests. It may have worked out eventually but it shouldn‚Äôt take months to be able to find one or two people to communicate with, so not worth the space on my phone.

Update: the developer response I received is misleading, perhaps because I worded my complaint poorly. You DO have to pay to unlock the people who have swiped right on you. You‚Äôll see a bunch of these blurry faces up top but you won‚Äôt be able to see who they are, swipe right on them or message them unless you pay for premium. That is what I meant to convey. The people I matched with (we both swiped right on each other) I never once got to communicate with because the chats expire after 24 hours and not everyone can respond that quickly.
title: Pointless Unless You Pay

developerResponse: {'id': 10639398, 'body': 'We block users based on our Community Guidelines and would never penalize anyone for reasons outside those guidelines. If you think your account was blocked by mistake, send us a message on Facebook or Twitter (@BumbleSupport) so we can take another look.', 'modified': '2019-09-12T00:29:53Z'}
review: I read through all of Bumble‚Äôs terms and conditions after they blocked my account. It states specific reasons an account would be blocked and none of them are anything I did. hopefully they aren‚Äôt just blocking people‚Äôs account based on overly emotional men who can‚Äôt handle rejection without actually reviewing the content. Which is obviously what occurred in my case. I did contact bumble the next day after my account was blocked, Before I even wrote this review And like I said I read through EVERYTHING and nothing mentioned was anything I did. I did say things back to people who insulted me but I never insulted anyone without blatantly being insulted because they weren‚Äôt happy with what I was looking for which is a TRADITIONAL man most of the time I laughed it off or ignored the comments. So obviously Bumble doesn‚Äôt review their own terms and conditions or they need to be updated because I didn‚Äôt do anything outside of the guidelines. But then again they do require women to Message first so maybe they have a problem with women who still like the way things were done when relationships and marriages actually lasted and I don‚Äôt like beta men.
title: Blocked my account

developerResponse: {'id': 4862231, 'body': "Hi! We're sorry you're experiencing issues with your location! Shoot us a message via Facebook or Twitter (@bumble) and we can help troubleshoot with you! We're here to help! Don't hesitate to reach out to us anytime-- we have your back!", 'modified': '2018-09-11T20:55:08Z'}
review: I used to really like the ‚Äúbeeline‚Äù feature on the paid version of this app. Beeline basically shows you people who have already swiped right on you. Used to be great because it wouldn‚Äôt show people outside of your search radius. Now, if you have beeline, it just shows you everyone who‚Äôs ever swiped right on you regardless of your location. I have people on my beeline who live in other states and the majority of them live way too far for me to want to invest in talking to them and meeting them. The worst part is beeline doesn‚Äôt even organize your bees in geographical order so I have to basically sift through bees until I find one that I am also interested in who also lives close enough to me to invest some time in. When I wrote bumble about this they told me this was helping people find better dates. For someone like me who works a lot and doesn‚Äôt have a lot of free time, I‚Äôd much prefer to be able to set a radius on potential matches. At least organize bees in geographical order! I definitely won‚Äôt be renewing my subscription unless something is done about this.
title: Used to love paid version

developerResponse: {'id': 3732461, 'body': "Hi there! We believe you're experiencing a bug and would like to look into this. Could you please message us on Facebook (@bumbleapp) or Twitter (@bumble) so our Support Team can get in touch with you? We look forward to hearing from you.", 'modified': '2018-06-05T19:02:36Z'}
review: I‚Äôm not one to write reviews, but I‚Äôve been disappointed by the fact that I paid for the app in order to be able to ‚Äúbeeline‚Äù to the guys who‚Äôve swiped right to get them at the front of the queue. However, I‚Äôve noticed that when I‚Äôve had several guys in the queue with the green circle around them, they‚Äôll all disappear out of nowhere, and several times when I‚Äôve pushed ‚Äúnot interested‚Äù in one guy who‚Äôs swiped right, it‚Äôll make all of the green circled guys go away (before I even got to look at their profiles, and they were all from the same city...not all traveling out of the city at the exact same time).  I downloaded Hinge 3 or 4 days ago and already have so many more matches and likes than Bumble, and what finally made me write this review is that a guy messaged me that he had swiped right on me on Bumble (only to go into Bumble to prove my theory that the beeline doesn‚Äôt work properly). Not sure what‚Äôs going on with the Bumble app, but have been highly disappointed that I paid for it and don‚Äôt get the benefits that come with paying for it. :(
title: Paid for it and don‚Äôt get the features...

developerResponse: {'id': 30241043, 'body': "We appreciate you sharing your feedback with us. We are always looking for ways to improve our users' experience on the app so we will make sure to pass your input along to our Product Team.", 'modified': '2022-06-08T12:59:53Z'}
review: I love bumble BFF but I would say that the dating mode is geared toward women who like to be in the driving seat, the more aggressive types. I have found a lot of men who date on bumble a little entitled passive lazy mamas boys and are used to dating women who do all the work. They typically enjoy the female attention.  (The dating mode puts women in the driving seat where they have to be the one to pursue and initiate conversation with men). I am old fashioned and have feminine energy rather than masculine so I don‚Äôt feel comfortable approaching men I might like and am used to being pursued, and the man doing all the work. So if you are that type of woman, bumble date may not be for you. If you‚Äôre a feminine type woman, you may prefer an app like hinge, where men pursue you and you have the option to decline any advances if you do wish. You also have the option on hinge to pursue men if you wish but there is more mutuality there than Bumble date.
title: Interesting Dynamic

developerResponse: {'id': 25324661, 'body': "Hi there, thank you so much for giving us this feedback, and we'll be sure to pass it on to our Product Team so we can continue to improve the app. In the meantime our team would love the opportunity to improve your experience in the Hive! Please message our Support Team on Twitter or Facebook (@bumblesupport) so we can get you back up and buzzin'.", 'modified': '2021-09-26T15:09:18Z'}
review:
Pros: 

-Easy to use

-I like the layout of the profiles, the ability to add 3 answered questions (profile prompts), COVID preferences are easy to see

-One customer service inquiry was answered in a timely fashion (direct via FB messenger)

-Weekly subscription option that not all services offer 

-Several other nice little options, like the ability to expand your search by 2 miles (should be able to choose 5mi IMO)

Cons: 

-There‚Äôs an apparent issue that happens when you‚Äôre viewing/reading a profile, it randomly and inexplicably changes to a different profile without warning. Sometimes you don‚Äôt see that other profile again. Happens with potential matches also, and the like can disappear as if you swiped left (happened to me, missed that match). This means the app is pretty much making it so you can‚Äôt potentially match with people, which is rather counterproductive. 

-Can‚Äôt reset & view profiles that were already seen, only the last 3 viewed and only if you have the right sub; much like Tinder

-Can‚Äôt delete profile prompts (questions) once one is used

-Premium is pricy for the current state of the app but to be fair I think they‚Äôre all a bit overpriced

-No adding custom interests, prompts etc 

All in all... I‚Äôd definitely rank it above Tinder, but it‚Äôs not as wide sweeping as other services. There is definite need for improvement, particularly in functionality/stability.
title: Not too bad.. if it‚Äôll show you profiles long enough

developerResponse: {'id': 26969863, 'body': 'Thanks for updating your review.\nWe always appreciate feedback from our users.', 'modified': '2021-12-21T11:45:50Z'}
review: It appears the devs have made advanced filters a premium option in order to compete with other dating apps. However, this makes no sense at all given that swiping left/rejecting people actually counts toward your daily swipe limit. As a straight guy who is 5‚Äô5‚Äù and resides in California, 70% of the women I see on this app are at least 5‚Äô7‚Äù or above. For the most part, women are completely uninterested in dating guys shorter than them. Heck, I know girls who are 5‚Äô2‚Äù that won‚Äôt settle for a guy unless they are at least 6‚Äô (which is honestly probably 5‚Äô10‚Äù, but still I‚Äôm way shorter than that). Thus, I feel it is UNJUST that Bumble forces me to waste swipes on girls who are taller than me whereas this would not be an issue for tall guys. This action to remove the advanced filters as a free option (at least the one for height) is borderline discrimination and is something that Bumble devs will not understand unless they talk to other short guys. I hope Bumble is willing to reconsider this decision so that short guys like me no longer feel discriminated against. Thank you.
title: Bring back Advanced Filters, or at least the filter for height

developerResponse: {'id': 24914033, 'body': "Hi there, we really appreciate you sharing your feedback with us. Your safety is our number one priority and we are always looking for ways to improve our users' experience on the app, so we will make sure to pass your input along to our Product Team.", 'modified': '2021-09-05T08:48:25Z'}
review:
I just started using Bumble again (I tried it briefly once before,) and I cannot figure out a way to hide my location! Are you guys insane!? It's one thing to give the information, "She's 10 miles away." It's a whole other thing to tell anyone and everyone where I am, where I live. I really do enjoy the app otherwise, and I've paid for the premium, but I don't know how often I can use it. I really feel unsafe. This is supposed to be the "safer" choice, but it isn't. For the sake of someone else's convenience, I'm giving up personal information and photographs about myself. No! Collect my data, but give me the option of exposing my location. This morning I read an article that someone collected a $2k bounty for finding EXACT locations for your app and see? There you go. Right there. Stalker City.

Five stars if you fix that one super weird choice.
title: Huge Security Risk

developerResponse: {'id': 22370515, 'body': "We're sorry this happened! Please send a screenshot of your receipt to support@team.bumble.com so we can credit your account with your purchase right away.", 'modified': '2021-04-21T08:49:47Z'}

title: SCAM YOU OUT OF MONEY

developerResponse: {'id': 8192829, 'body': 'Thank you for your review.\nWe have acknowledged your query and we will get back to you soon.\nThank you for your patience.', 'modified': '2019-04-14T03:40:20Z'}
review:
The app itself is fairly stable and easy to use, albeit limited.
Unfortunately, that‚Äôs overshadowed by the complete lack of actual human beings. I‚Äôve matched with dozens of women in the last month in my rural area, but only 4 of them ever texted in the first 24 hours; i often use up my extends and still hear nothing. Their locations almost never change which is indicative of old inactive accounts. The few who do text me usually only do so once, often in broken english to tell me all about fun singles in my area, or they go ‚Äúhi‚Äù then ghost. I‚Äôm like 90% sure it‚Äôs not my openings, because they seem to work fairly well on other dating apps.
This has been an ongoing trend for the last 9 months that I‚Äôve been using bumble. I‚Äôve not had this trouble on Tinder or others, i can usually get a date or two a week there if i‚Äôm staying active. I‚Äôve only been on 2 bumble dates in the time i‚Äôve been using it.

Really very disappointing how much of a failure this app has turned out to be. I was really tired of the rifraf on tinder and had heard great things about Bumble being more serious but tbh it feels like i‚Äôm browsing Backpage.
title: Mostly fake/inactive profiles

review: I really like that women have to make the first move. However you want to look at it they ultimately own the decision on if there will be any first contact. There are two important downsides though. First a lot of women just put their insta names in their profile. This gave me the impression that they‚Äôre lazy and have no sincere interest to engage via the app. They will just wait for men to inundate their insta with messages and make decisions based on your insta life. If you don‚Äôt have a fabulous an well manicured life on insta then you‚Äôre screwed. The second issue is a majority of women will never actually message you or they will just abruptly cancel the match. This gave me the impression that most users just swipe fast through their daily limit and only bother to review profiles if there is a match. If you want to get your money‚Äôs worth perhaps drop $20 with a bottle of scotch and play the odds, swipe fast through a thousand women in one night and take it from there.
title: Great concept but with downsides

developerResponse: {'id': 29621478, 'body': 'Hi WesleyG92. Currently, users can only match with those of the same gender on Bumble BFF but we totally hear you and we‚Äôll be sharing your feedback with our Product Team to advocate for this update in the future. Thanks for taking the time to let us know this is important to you. üíõ', 'modified': '2022-05-08T15:43:26Z'}
review:
Bumble BFF inherently recognizes that people need to make friends, new friends. This is especially crucial when for example you move or enter a period of new growth. And BFF inherently recognizes that people sometimes are solely looking for friends where sex can never be an option and harassment is a nonstarter, hence it limits matches only to the same gender. That only works for heterosexual people, and there is no way to change that setting. Cis-identifying queer people have no way of seeking platonic friendships safe from the risk of harassment or sexual pressure. And the utilization of the binary completely removes choice and sense of belonging for trans and non-binary folx for whom harassment and sexual pressure are never off the table anyways.

In short, why is the platonic side of this app geared first and foremost with cis-hets in mind, with virtually no liberty for queer people? Do we not deserve friends of our own choosing? Are we inherently incapable of making lasting and deep friendships with others of different gender identities?? Bumble BFF answers the latter two questions with a resounding YES. Shameful.
title: Bumble BFF is Homophobic

developerResponse: {'id': 21956606, 'body': "For the safety of our users, we can never provide any details about why a user was blocked. However, if you feel you have been blocked incorrectly, we're always happy to take a second look at what's occurred. DM us on Facebook or Twitter (@BumbleSupport) anytime.", 'modified': '2021-03-30T19:52:42Z'}
review: ABSOLUTELY DO NOT RECOMMEND! The app is garbage. I used it to make friends and improve my mental health. I opened the app one day and I was logged out. I tried to log in and it told me I was permanently blocked from the app. I read over all the guidelines trying to figure out what I possibly could have violated. I did not violate a single thing. I never argued with anyone on the app. I never had a bad conversation. I never sent or received pictures. I never advertised anything. I never even spoke politics. I emailed the company asking to know what complaint was filed against me. They promised ‚Äúno automated responses‚Äù and I received an automated response just saying I‚Äôm permanently blocked. I responded asking just to know what I violated and they sent me another automated response. I am honestly just hurt by this. I only used the app because I thought it would help improve my mental health and instead I‚Äôm left feeling even more depressed. I have lost contact with many friends I was chatting with on the app now and I don‚Äôt believe there is any way I can get back in contact with them. This app and the entire company are a disappointment.
title: I wish I could give negative stars.

review:
Bumble BFF coolest idea. I re-found/ reconnected with my current boyfriend on bumble so all good stuff. BFF though on the other hand needs work because there isn‚Äôt a lot of traffic (especially in my exact town) which clearly cannot be fixed without marketing and demand. Buuuuuuut for BFF the setting should be different where one doesn‚Äôt have to talk first or the expiring after 24 hours thing could just not happen. For the dating portion it‚Äôs perfect because there would be enough
 people for me to be active on it to see within the time frame and it‚Äôs a way to only message the people you‚Äôre actually interested in. So amazing. But when on BFF it‚Äôs usually days before someone actually matches (because there‚Äôs no one around not because I‚Äôm not dopeaf) so I don‚Äôt check the app every day and when I match with someone it‚Äôs 9/10 blocked because it‚Äôs past the 24 hours. Sooo asking for a friend to help me out because I‚Äôm literally asking for a friend. Thanks.
title: Bumble BFF

review: I deleted my profile after about a month when suddenly I was flooded with profiles of very undesirable men. It is very hard to match with people and when you do almost 100% of the time the conversations never go anywhere and people don‚Äôt respond. I really don‚Äôt get what the point is but then again I guess this is just another hook up app. There really seems to be no true real answer for those of us looking to find committed relationships and not hook up with people. It really should not be allowed for people to be on here with no written profile - all they do is have their name, age, and a photo. You shouldn‚Äôt be allowed to be on the app if you‚Äôre not going to make a profile and at least put some effort into it. There‚Äôs very little barrier to entry on this app so it‚Äôs very easy for people to join and be a part of it without having to fill out anything. Hence tons of people you will waste time swiping through and never really finding what you‚Äôre looking for, most likely. If you‚Äôre looking for Friday night versus forever, then this app is for you.
title: Waste of Time

developerResponse: {'id': 25048938, 'body': "Hi there, I'm sorry to hear that we have not been able to help you with this technical issue. Please message our Support Team on Facebook or Twitter (@bumblesupport), or at support@team.bumble.com so we can get you back up and buzzin'. review: This is the second time in four days this has happened with no help from the Bumble support team whatsoever. Which is super convenient given the fact that you have 24 hours to respond to a match‚Äôs message before you are unmatched from them. Quite a catastrophic flaw when it‚Äôs physically impossible to communicate with your matches on a dating app. I followed the instructions on bumble‚Äôs website that is supposed to solve any technical issues. This solved absolutely nothing so I contacted their support team. Their response was to link me to the very same instructions listed on their website. So all in all this app has a fatal flaw that makes it completely useless, and support has shown no urgency to help resolve the issue with their only response being to follow the instructions already listed on their website. title: App Frequently Gets Stuck Loading

title: The worst. However their is always app in the future

developerResponse: {'id': 6309395, 'body': "Thank you so much for updating your review! If there's anything we can do to help improve your experience on Bumble, please let us know. We're here for you!", 'modified': '2018-12-10T03:38:58Z'}
review:
I was having some issues with the Bumble app loading today so I did a quick ‚Äúrestart‚Äù by deleting the app and then re-downloading it. Just deleted the app, NOT my profile. Tried to log back in. At first I didn‚Äôt remember my password so I used the text option for recovery. Tried 3 times and none of the numbers I was texted work. Tried the phone call recovery. Same result. When I thought I recalled my password, The app took my # and PW but has completely blank pages that won‚Äôt load. I can‚Äôt tell if my profile has been deleted or if just nothing will load (not the profile, not other profiles, not even settings!). This bug came out of nowhere and is immensely frustrating. Not happy that the password recovery protocols are not working at all.
Update: this did clear up after a few hours. No idea what the issue was. Now that the app is functional again, some stars returned. But seems a concerning bug.
title: App suddenly bugged out

developerResponse: {'id': 30054213, 'body': "Hi DoogieWayne. We're sorry you didn't enjoy your experience on Bumble. We are always looking for ways to improve our users' experience so we will make sure to pass your input along to our Product Team. While this is the way our app works now, if we can help your experience further right now, please send us a message at bumble.com/contact. üíõ", 'modified': '2022-05-30T14:28:47Z'}
review:
This app has some ups and downs. Biggest complaint is the swipe reset timer. Rather than resetting at a set time (i.e. midnight), you have to wait a full 24 hours from the time you ran out of swipes until you can resume. The fact that this hasn‚Äôt been addressed tells me it‚Äôs deliberate so that users are inconvenienced into paying for an upgrade.

The women choose format is kind of refreshing but it seems like a lot of women either don‚Äôt know how the app works, are too timid to actually ‚Äúmake the first move‚Äù (a.k.a. literally type/send one letter or more to enable a conversation) or just swiped for kicks thinking it wouldn‚Äôt actually match. So, as refreshing as the different approach may be, it leaves a bit to be desired in practice.

There a decent amount of active users in most areas, which is essential. Unfortunately, you have to pay to see if anyone is interested. That might not be so bad if it was a reasonable price but $30/mo  to find out a bunch of people you weren‚Äôt interested in liked you is a total ripoff.

Overall, I‚Äôd recommend Hinge over Bumble or Tinder. Other services claim to care about your experience but monetize the crap out of critical features. Hinge, on the other hand, gives you all of that stuff for free. Yes, you read that correctly; they don‚Äôt make you pay to see who ‚Äúlikes you‚Äù. There may not be as many users but matching is far more effective.

Do better Bumble. ‚úåüèº
title: Honest review

review:
Though my time on the dating app scene was short lived and had its ups and downs, I owe a debt of gratitude to Bumble. 

Two months was all it took. 

One day I matched with this cute, green-eyed boy and we immediately clicked. It felt like reconnecting with an old friend from the very first messages we sent. We had our first date the following day because I was leaving on an international trip and had limited time to meet this guy. My ‚Äúeasy out‚Äù plan was happy hour at a brew house right across the street from my night job. I figured I could escape if things didn‚Äôt go well. Our 2pm-4pm date lasted until 7pm when I finally had to sprint to work, 30 min late ü§£

I flew to Italy with my mom the following day and immediately texted him a pic of the Roman Forum so he‚Äôd know I wasn‚Äôt just pretending to travel to get rid of him. We texted the whole two weeks and I made a cheesy wish at the Trevi Fountain right before mom and I left to come back home. 

A little over one year later my green-eyed guy and I went to Italy together and he proposed to me in front of the Trevi Fountain. I‚Äôm not the kind of girl that cheesy rom-com things happen to except for this one instance. Thank God for Bumble.

Nearly four years after I swiped right we are happily married with a baby on the way. 

I was always afraid of online dating. I am so so so happy I took the plunge.
title: Bumble Changed My Life

review:
I would never desire to have the app for anything other than free. I CANCELLED the free subscription and was still charged $50 for an additional 3 months. I immediately reached out to Bumble the same day and they told me to reach out to Apple. I did and Apple told me that bumble would need to refund my purchase. They refused to do so and pretended that the email I got was just a notice of renewal but not the actual thing. The money was clearly taken out of my account and the purchase is still ‚Äúpending‚Äù in my subscriptions because it‚Äôs so recent. 

I will never promote this app and be sure to tell everyone I know how they are scammers and not concerned about the consumer at all. Disgusting. They ask for receipts via email as if they can help with the situation and then want to turn around and blame Apple and say that there‚Äôs nothing they can do and that Apple needs to be contacted. If there‚Äôs noting bumble can do then asking for receipts makes no sense at all. They choose not to help and to keep the money and to point the blame at Apple (who gives them a platform).
title: Beware of disgusting customer service

review: I‚Äôve used this app and never paid for it, and didn‚Äôt like the results because they limit you on everything. So I said let‚Äôs give a try and paid for 1 month‚Ä¶ all of a sudden all these profile opened up. Got lots of likes and a got lots of ‚Äúhi‚Äù and never and thing said after that‚Ä¶ after my experiences on this app‚Ä¶ I‚Äôve come to this conclusion. The app is full of lots of fake accts. I feel that this company has algorithms that will give you likes and will open with hi to make you feel like you‚Äôre getting some activity. Once you really start using the app, all of a sudden there is never anyone in the local area. Everyone is always 20-30 miles a way and I live in a very populated city in Florida. I find this to be suspect. That‚Äôs not to that there are real people on here‚Ä¶ but there are more fake profiles then real and the distance feature on the filter does nothing cause it‚Äôs either no one in the area(live in large city) or they only show people that live no where around you‚Ä¶ enjoy the free app just don‚Äôt pay for anything!!
title: 2 thumbs down  do not waste time or money

review:
So I had the app for just under two weeks- actively used it for less than one (I did pay for boost that one week). I love that as a woman I have a bit more control. I also love that instead of just matching by location, all these variables are taken into consideration.

I started talking to someone who has a lot in common with me. I was surprised because it isn‚Äôt a big place that I live, but had I not used this app I may not have either met this person or hit it off with them. It might not be exactly the same experience for everyone (I think it‚Äôs great especially for those who need an intellectual connection and have common ground). We stepped off the app though after a few days, and are planning to meet up. I don‚Äôt know what will happen, but I am hopeful and at least happy that I gave a dating app a chance finally and put myself out there again.
title: Definitely worth a shot

We would be happy to personally review your account; you can contact our Support Team at feedback@team.bumble.com.', 'modified': '2019-03-19T16:41:09Z'}
review:
I‚Äôve been using Bumble for at least a year if not longer. I loved it, I‚Äôve met many wonderful people on it. I met my last partner off of it-and we were together for 5 months. I‚Äôve recommended Bumble to several of my friends and even to my mom for the BFF side of it-she thinks it‚Äôs great. I was banned yesterday. I contacted support to figure out what happened and I received two emails one minute apart. The first one stated that they couldn‚Äôt find an account linked to my email and the second said that due to ‚Äúseveral complaints‚Äù I would be blocked permanently with no chance of reactivation and with no explanation. I have never behaved inappropriately or been unnecessarily rude to people who were not rude to me. I have not been contacted again and I expect they won‚Äôt respond to my most recent email inquiring about the block. 
I‚Äôve read several other complaints about scamming and difficulty canceling paid subscriptions. I was never a paying consumer because I didn‚Äôt care enough for that and I had plenty of matches without boosts. Don‚Äôt use this app. The people who run it are incompetent.
title: Longtime user banned without explanation

developerResponse: {'id': 27955540, 'body': "Thanks for taking the time to share your candid feedback. We understand the changes and testing with recent features have caused some significant changes to our members' experiences. We'll share all of this with our Product Team. If you'd like to chat more, feel free to message us at: bumble.com/contact.", 'modified': '2022-02-10T01:17:22Z'}
review:
As a dating service you would think a company would want to make sure their users felt they could trust the platform they on. But I guess Bumble‚Äôs priorities are more in getting money from people than providing a good customer experience. 

Taking away features without any warning at all and the only way you find out is when you start getting matched with people that are outside of what you‚Äôre comfortable with sounds so bizarre to me. Especially from a company that uses the platform of making it feel safer for women. 

Bumble changed the game and I guess hoped we wouldn‚Äôt notice. Then they go on to try to charge you almost $18 a month to get those features back!!!!!! Why would I give that much money to a company that obviously doesn‚Äôt care about their customers. What would be the benefit in me now paying for something I was told was free up until a couple weeks ago. Sad. And not worth the subscription. Time to move on to better dating platforms that care about their customers needs and feelings of security.
title: Focused more on profit than customer trust.

review: Created a profile and started swiping. Had a few conversations going and everything was smooth. Did my swipes for the next day then continued my conversations. This time did my swipes and got one and I mean ONE conversation started. Kept it very very casual. Wake up the next morning and boom blocked again. One of the reasons provided, without needing to talk to the person, is ‚Äúinappropriate or abusive behavior‚Äù. I literally was talking to one person and was having a good convo so I know it didn‚Äôt come from that person. Only explanation would be I guess I swiped right on some people out there that are but hurt they can‚Äôt get a good match üòÇ but instead of using their free time to go to a different site they choose to spend it on Bumble to burn peoples accounts. Fix this. It is not ok.

title: Bad service and careless attitude

developerResponse: {'id': 8921263, 'body': 'Thank you for your review.\nWe have acknowledged your query and we will get back to you soon.\nThank you for your patience.', 'modified': '2019-05-29T15:39:59Z'}
review:
Men have every incentive to swipe on as many profiles as they can. I paid to see matches and got well over a hundred. (I‚Äôm decent looking for my age but definitely not young and hot. I‚Äôm also a professional with an awesome career.) I matched with a few and immediately sent a short message to start the clock. The matches either expired or both the match and my message (short with a mention of something in their profile) disappeared in less than twenty-four hours (so...unmatched?) I have to think that I have a bunch of swipes from men who want to make Bumble think they are active users. Or, they swipe on everyone and THEN decide who they actually want to match with. It‚Äôs also possible that they‚Äôd already matched with someone they liked and didn‚Äôt have a way to change their status to unavailable (and didn‚Äôt bother to message back to say which would‚Äôve been cool.)

A truly modern app would allow users of any sex to decide who makes the first move. I don‚Äôt care that the men who swiped weren‚Äôt actually interested. I don‚Äôt know them. I felt like I was wasting my time, though. 

I really don‚Äôt think I can fault Bumble. Trying to get rid of users like that must be like pulling weeds. In the end, I wound up leaving at least a hundred potential matches because, other than working my way through all of them, there was no way of knowing if ANY of those people swiped because they were actually interested. 

Ah well, back to hanging with my girls.
title: Not for me

review: I like that women make the first move for comfort reasons, I don‚Äôt love the swiping in general as I‚Äôve accidentally swiped the wrong direction a few times. I hate that I don‚Äôt get like at least one free undo press a day like Hinge. I don‚Äôt like that I can‚Äôt even LOOK at guys who liked me one at a time (like on Hinge) without paying money. I‚Äôm a broke college grad, I can‚Äôt afford the Starbucks I buy lol. I prefer Hinge to Bumble but prefer Bumble‚Äôs ladies first mentality. OH and the filters on Bumble don‚Äôt work. I shouldn‚Äôt be seeing other religions if I put Christian as a dealbreaker. And if I put ‚Äúseeking men‚Äù I shouldn‚Äôt be getting ‚Äúthey/them‚Äù people. I wish you could filter by pronouns in that case so at least there‚Äôs a 50/50 shot it‚Äôs a cis-male I‚Äôm talking to. I love everyone as a friend but dating wise, I‚Äôm traditional.
title: Decent but not great.

review:
The only reason I give 2 instead of 1 is because I‚Äôve used Bumble on and off since like 2017 and can count on one hand the couple connections made.
I have tried to reach out on numerous occasions to better understand why my account feels blocked but I‚Äôve received no answer from Customer service. 
I have paid and trialed here and there in the past and I just paid for a month now FEB 2022. I‚Äôve seen people and friends with weak profiles make way more connections. 2 random individuals came up in my ‚Äúbeeline‚Äù Within the month- no action besides that and the SAME day my Month ended, I got 2 women in my beeline that I couldn‚Äôt see üòÇ greedy and awful 

Every dating app has its flaws, but look elsewhere. Go to hinge or Feeld.

review: I‚Äôve been a user of this app since 2017. I liked the concept of how you can shake your phone up to 3 times before it reset after a few hours. Because of this change, I have to drop my initial 5 star rating down a few levels üòû. I would gladly revise my review should you put back those features that were never broken to begin with. Our support team is available 24/7 on Facebook and Twitter (@bumble) and ready to help! We hope to hear from you soon.", 'modified': '2018-08-30T23:04:43Z'}
review:
I don‚Äôt think this app  at all appealing, And it requires a huge waste of time. 
There‚Äôs too little information allowed to be posted in order to be able to assess real compatibility or interest ‚Äì so you have to go through the labor of writing to people and talking to people that end up being not at all of interest or compatible. For me, the benefit of meeting people online is the ability to sift through people to find the qualities and interests that are compatible. That isn‚Äôt possible here, and The methodology reflects and enforces pure superficiality.
I think it‚Äôs also ridiculous to require a response in 24 hours. I‚Äôm a busy person, With a very full life, often traveling ‚Äì and I may not have the time or inclination to check the app every day to make sure I don‚Äôt lose forever some potential gem.
There is no support, no one answers correspondence, so like it or lump it. If there‚Äôs something that‚Äôs not working, or that you don‚Äôt understand, too bad.
title: To little information, very superficial, and no support

Our support team is available 24/7 on Facebook and Twitter (@bumble) and ready to help! We hope to hear from you soon.', 'modified': '2018-07-13T18:09:53Z'}
review: So I really liked the concept of being able to message someone if there was a match and not having to receive tons of unsolicited and sleazy messages from random ‚Äúmen‚Äù. I‚Äôve had the app for a couple months now and figured I just wasn‚Äôt matching with anyone because I have received absolutely no notifications whatsoever. Even in the app there is no notification marker on the chat bubble icon. Yesterday I happened to make a match. I sent a message to my match to get a conversation started. A couple hours later I checked the app again and tapped on the chat bubble icon. It had no record of a message sent to my match from earlier AND was showing two matches that I had missed out on because 24 hours had passed. Then, Bumble wants a ridiculous amount of money to rematch. I think this is completely wrong and unfair to want to charge for a rematch when there was never even any notification of the matches in the first place. I‚Äôm ok with the 24 hour window, but only if notifications would actually be sent. But at this point I am extremely disappointed with this app.
title: Great Concept...But...

review: When this app first came out, it was different and a welcome change. Being a guy it was sort of nice to see that the ladies would make the first move if they were interested. Having said that, there is no real incentive for men to use this app period! First are the ‚Äúfree swipes‚Äù, they used to be unlimited but now limit you to maybe 10-12 per 24hr period unless you‚Äôre willing to pay. Secondly, the price for this app makes no sense for men to pay for. It is already set up so men cannot contact women first and now they want you to pay $40+ a month for what, to look at pictures?!? Last but not least, women do not traditionally reach out first when it comes to dating, so even if she were interested, she‚Äôs not going to make first contact so this app is counterintuitive. Being of the male half of this equation, there are better apps for the money. All you get is a picture of you pay, you can‚Äôt message and there is no guarantee that the women will even respond if you do swipe right, so why are you paying for???

Send our Support Team a message via Facebook or Twitter (@bumblesupport) anytime for help.", 'modified': '2021-05-25T18:37:53Z'}
review: Bumble used to be my favorite dating app by far. It‚Äôs layout was intuitive and it‚Äôs features were extensive. Most importantly, though, it‚Äôs recommendation algorithm was straightforward and geared towards getting users matches as quick as possible. I am not particularly deluged by likes on the app, but when I did have likes, those who liked me appeared at the beginning of the feed before anyone else. This was in stark contrast to tinder, where you can have many likes and have little idea where they will show up in your feed. Now, bumble is worse than tinder in this regard. I recently redownloaded and got around 20 likes in the first 48 hours or so but was only shown maybe 5 of them. This was far worse than tinder, which I recently redownloded as well. I‚Äôm very disappointed with bumbles decision to jump on the bandwagon and gone against its ethos of being the more ethical, user conscious app. This decision may make bumble more profitable, but it will come at the cost of user wellbeingüòî
title: Recent update takes bumble from being one the best dating apps to one of the worst

developerResponse: {'id': 11538101, 'body': 'We really appreciate you sharing your feedback with us, Olivia. This will allow you to extend one match for an additional 24 hours!', 'modified': '2019-10-29T17:51:29Z'}
review:
I‚Äôve (26F) used Bumble for a long while now amongst other dating apps. I actually get plenty of matches, so that‚Äôs really great, but the only serious problem I‚Äôve had is the 24 hour time limit on replies/reaching out. I had 17 matches yesterday, messaged all of them, and received only one reply. And I honestly don‚Äôt blame them for not checking the app/replying to my original message - it was a Saturday, and I would hope they would be hanging up and hanging out, as I was for most of my day. I also wouldn‚Äôt be writing this review if it wasn‚Äôt a consistent problem. This sort of thing happens all the time, no matter what time or day of the week. 
So I think extending the time limit to 48 or even 72 hours would seriously increase user response and the likelihood of people‚Äôs ability to talk to/meet someone. There are some solid guys I‚Äôve matched with, but will never get the chance to meet because of the 24 hour time limit. Bumble 2020 needs to step this up.
title: The 24 hrs to reply is really a *buzz*kill

Ended up choosing boost to undo a skip.. then after that got advertised what premium was (was more than the promo I had been advertised all morning lol..?) and that it was only $12 more than boost. so I said fine I‚Äôll do it for a week.. ended up getting charged for both! title: Good! But..

developerResponse: {'id': 22222787, 'body': "We're sorry you didn't enjoy your experience on Bumble. Our team would love the opportunity to improve your experience in the Hive! Please message our Support Team on Twitter or Facebook (@BumbleSupport) and we'd be happy to help.", 'modified': '2021-04-13T16:59:47Z'}
review:
Gives you 1 million genders to choose from then proceeds to make you choose the man or woman section so you can only be matched with people who chose the same in BFF mode. Weird. There‚Äôs a lot to unpack there. But mainly, why they think you shouldn‚Äôt be allowed to be friends with the opposite sex? I‚Äôm not sure. Users should be able to toggle that themselves. 

Matches expire in 24 hours if you don‚Äôt message. I doubt this will ever change since it makes you open the app more often so that‚Äôs obviously beneficial to the company. It‚Äôs very annoying though. I don‚Äôt want to have to check the app every day and I didn‚Äôt, so I always was losing matches. Big reason I stopped using this 

Women are required to message first when matching with men in the dating mode. Yeah I get it, guys usually message first, but, they‚Äôve never been required to. It seems they think it‚Äôs some sort of activism breaking gender norms, but all that does is reverse it. Not getting the goal there. This feature is similar to the being forced to only make friends with the same-sex feature. This along with my next critique ruined the dating mode for me

Firstly, I‚Äôm bi. Bumble is surprisingly not queer friendly. It seems like it would be, since it gives you 1 million gender options, but if you‚Äôre searching for same-gender matches in the dating section, it shows you people from the friends section also, who are evidently looking for friends, not dates. Very weird and again, annoying.
title: Great concept, annoying to use

Send us a message on Facebook or Twitter (@bumblesupport) so we can help!", 'modified': '2020-08-31T17:10:03Z'}

I‚Äôm not sure how the algorithms work for Bumble but mines need to be reset. I‚Äôve used Bumble off and on for sometime. Recently, I decided to pay the monthly subscription to see who swiped right on me before they appear in my timeline. After I made the purchase, I noticed that no new people swiped right on me. I know I‚Äôm not a bad looking women. No one that I‚Äôve swipe right on appeared in my feed. Again, I know that I‚Äôm not a bad looking women. I googled to see if I was missing anything and I saw plenty of reviews stating the same thing was happening to them. 
I updated my profile thinking it would help but nothing. 
I noticed that if I purchased spotlight coins (addition to the monthly subscription), my profiles would get viewed. When I first created my profile, I was meeting people but not sure what is going on now ¬Ø\_(„ÉÑ)_/¬Ø 
Also, I don‚Äôt like the 24 hour window for initiating first communication. If that 24 hour window is missed, the match/message disappears. Not sure about you but sometimes my life take over and I don‚Äôt check bumble every day.
title: Waste of time

There are a lot of attractive users, however even if you match with them the chances that they message you within the 24 hours is slim. If girls are not using this app/not checking it, then there must be some flaw with it and it is not worth their time to check it. I‚Äôm not sure how to fix this but it is highly frustrating to sit there as a guy on this app and be constantly matching but 80% of the matches just expire after 24 or dont progress beyond a ‚Äúhey‚Äù. I‚Äôve tried restarting from scratch and deleting my account. More matches but still the same issue. Tinder matches are overall more responsive than Bumble ones. title: No Conversations

review:
I love this app. I love how it is set up to be so friendly and I appreciate the app makers so much for their intentions. I just have one minor criticism. 

I understand where you‚Äôre coming from with the ‚Äúonly women can make the first move‚Äù rule. And I‚Äôm sure a lot of people love that idea. But for me personally, it‚Äôs a problem. Because of certain anxieties, I have a problem with being the first one to send a message. I like to know that there are guys out there who want to take the time to reach out to me. If the dude gets to be too much, all I have to do is block him. I just think that the app would be a much better experience if everyone got the opportunity to message first, no matter the gender. If you‚Äôre worried about guys being jerks to women, just make it easier to block people. 

That is all, over all I do really love this app and will continue to use it.
title: Just one thought...

review: First off... for all the girls out there reading this‚Äî I have seen that a lot of you think it‚Äôs like Tinder and we can start the conversation... we can‚Äôt. We don‚Äôt have the ability to message first. You have to message first, then we can reply. Unfortunately that‚Äôs how it works... It‚Äôs not bad... I do like it, I don‚Äôt like the fact that girls have to message first, and the match expires in 24 hours but it‚Äôs a cool concept I guess. I just wish matches didn‚Äôt expire. The only other thing I wish it had was a setting in BFF mode to find girl-friends. I don‚Äôt need any more guy friends. So I wish that would change. But overall I like it a lot better than Tinder, you can learn a little more about who someone is before swiping. And the only thing I do like about girls messaging first is that if they aren‚Äôt interested they don‚Äôt have to message at all, which means they can‚Äôt ghost you after three messages.
title: Not bad

review:
This app could be very good, but I refuse to use it because it requires you to display your current location to EVERYONE at all times in order to even use the app. Seriously??? What century are the developers living in??? This is beyond a HUGE safety issue. I‚Äôve had enough online dating stalkers over the years, the last thing I want to do is show my current location to people I don‚Äôt even know. Several times I‚Äôve begun chatting with a match, just to have them question why I‚Äôm currently in a different part of town than I live‚Ä¶.umm, no thanks!! I can‚Äôt believe they haven‚Äôt been sued over this major safety issue. Or maybe they have and just don‚Äôt care. 
There is absolutely NO benefit from giving everyone your current location, only potential problems. I urge everyone to think long and hard before signing up on here. Developers, get a clue and get in the 21st century. The world is dangerous enough without a bunch of strangers knowing where you are at all times  And people get possessively weird when it comes to dating.
title: üö©üö©üö©MAJOR SAFETY WARNING!!!üö©üö©üö©

review: This app is worthless. If you're a male, Bumble hides all of your likes so that you're forced to pay 17 dollars or more just to see them. On top of that, Bumble recycles all of the same profiles so it doesn't matter if you swipe left or right or if you're a paying member, those profiles will eventually cycle thru your feed again so that you're only swiping on new people less than 50% of the time. I'm also sick and tired of swiping on people that live nowhere near my state even with my location turned on. Connecticut, the Yukon, California, New York and Boston are NOWHERE near me, but no matter what I set my radius to (always between 10-25 miles) all I get is out of staters with a few locals peppered in. The absolute worst part of Bumble is that they do nothing to ban anti-vaxxers or white supremacists. Seriously, there are tons of women on Bumble that use their profile to go on ignorant diatribes about politics and vaccines and Bumble has done nothing to stop them. I've already wasted enough money on this poor excuse of a dating app, don't waste yours!
title: A Waste of Time and Money

developerResponse: {'id': 10512337, 'body': 'Our team moderates based solely on our Community Guidelines. We would never ban someone for any reason outside of those guidelines. We would be happy to personally review your account; you can contact our Support Team at feedback@team.bumble.com.', 'modified': '2019-09-04T10:53:41Z'}
review: I was blocked because they claim I violated guidelines. Initially they told me it was due to my account being fake. When I explained that it clearly wasn‚Äôt fake because my Facebook and IG were connected to my account they changed their reason to receiving several complaints about guidelines. I read through the guidelines once again to ensure I hadn‚Äôt violated anything. As I suspected, I was 100% within the guidelines. I have been nothing but polite and respectful toward everyone on the app and in person. The feedback team claims that the block is irreversible which is completely unreasonable considering I did not violate their guidelines. I explained that I had a jealous ex that was most likely responsible for the complaints and even attached a copy of the restraining order I have filed against her but they refused to confirm or deny whether it was in fact her who had complained. Long story short, this company is completely incompetent in regards to customer service and their investigative procedure. I do not recommend the app purely because the company is unreasonable and extremely difficult to contact.
title: Horrible customer service.

developerResponse: {'id': 26196637, 'body': "Our team is continually working to improve our platform, and we're so thankful for your feedback. If you ever have any questions or additional feedback, feel free to contact us directly via Facebook or Twitter (@BumbleSupport)‚Äîwe're here for you!", 'modified': '2021-11-10T15:30:29Z'}
review:
You are *REQUIRED* to profess your support for one of 3 women‚Äôs rights issues on the app. It is impossible to continue using it without saying you support 1 of 3 causes they force you to support, whether or not you do. I obviously care about women‚Äôs rights and equality, but I don‚Äôt see these issues the same way the Bumble team does. They give you various profile options to show your support for progressive social causes. I can say I support Black Lives Matter, or Stop Asian Hate, etc. but I can‚Äôt say I support privacy, guns, lower taxes, small government, etc. You can say you‚Äôre ‚Äúout and proud!!!‚Äù, but can‚Äôt just say for example that you happen to be bisexual. It‚Äôs truly not an inclusive place. You can say you‚Äôre ‚Äúconservative, liberal, or moderate‚Äù but not green or libertarian, etc. (which are neither). Either you‚Äôre part of the progressive woke mob, or you‚Äôre not welcome on bumble. Let people express themselves, even if you disagree with their ideology.

Additionally, privacy is abysmal, requiring location to be on at all times.
title: Forces You to Adopt Bumble Team‚Äôs Activist Causes and Moral Positions

review: After using this app several times, I was losing interest in it. Until I decided to use it one more time, the best decision I have ever made. I met a wonderful woman who completely changed my life. We were hundreds of miles away from one another, she had changed her location to my area and I‚Äôm so thankful that she did. We had great conversations, and then eventually began FaceTiming many nights, and finally we began traveling together to see one another. We had spent so much time together, and created many memories before we knew it! We are engaged now, and starting our lives together. Yes at first using this app felt like and endless inbox of boring conversations and connections that lead to nowhere, but you never know what could happen when you take another chance and end up meeting ‚Äúyour‚Äù person. I‚Äôm glad I did.

review:
I will be deleting my account and advising others not to use if this is not rectified: 

Back story: In September I matched with this guy, talked to him for a little. When I did not feel a connection I told him I was not interested and it wasn‚Äôt going to work out. Since then he had began to harass me with texts, I blocked him on all social media‚Äôs and he created multiple new accounts to get in contact with me. I have not answered him since early October. I am still receiving texts from him every other week. 

THE MAIN REASON for this review is because he constantly keeps coming up as he super-liked me or just for me to swipe right or left. I have blocked and reported him on multiple occasions on bumble, I believe it might be around 7 times. I thought if I blocked/reported him he would stop popping up on my bumble. I really wish I did not have to see him anymore. The constant texts that are still being sent since October is enough. review: Dating as a 30+ working professional is rough, but dating apps should make it easier, correct? Well, sort of, for Bumble. I love the idea of an app where women get to message first, as they often are faced with a deluge of garbage of bad puns/jokes/explicit messages. Enter Bumble. Cool concept, but your matches only last for 24 hours. I get a lot of matches but a good majority of them expire, as what busy person checks the app every single day? Want to increase the time? Pay. Daily you get to swipe less than other online dating apps. Want more? Pay. And the prices? Hah. Might as well be paying a $40+ a month subscription or opt for the lifetime pass. Bumble is the only online dating app that I‚Äôve seen so far where it would be better for my wallet to buy random ladies drinks at the local bar than attempt to use the app to its fullest through a subscription. Anyway, this close to uninstalling this thing and just spending time on alternatives to Bumble. Which is too bad, really, as I like the idea of it.
title: Good app idea with terrible, predatory monetization.
