review:
The app isn‚Äôt just a pay to win, it‚Äôs a pay to play. On average, people can net around 10 or so likes in one day. However, I‚Äôve found that over the course of 72 hours, I‚Äôve only gotten 3 likes, 1 of which I‚Äôm pretty sure is a fake account judging by how I haven‚Äôt even seen them yet. This isn‚Äôt even from me having high standards, as I‚Äôve swiped on pretty, good, and average looking people, especially those with a bio, and I‚Äôm an average looking guy.

To get any sort of attention on the app, you need to pay up, which I wouldn‚Äôt mind if it was fair, but it‚Äôs not fair at all. Even after rearranging my photos, listing my hobbies, or doing a complete overhaul to my bio, I have had not a single like or match following Day 1 of using it.

Tips? Fix the algorithm so that your likes show up more often, reduce the cost of Premium, Boost, and Spotlight, and make spotlight last longer than 30 minutes. And if you‚Äôre a guy or queer, save your money and go elsewhere, because apparently even genderfluid people can‚Äôt message first.

review:
Stepped away from the app for a while and came back to find that they have instituted a ‚Äúfeature‚Äù that will lock out swiping for the male users for literally 24 hours after a set number of swipes unless you cough up the dough for premium features. Not sure if this includes combined left and right swipes or only right swipes. This app used to not do this. Tinder at least limits the lockout to 12 hours unless they‚Äôve changed that too. A 24 hour lockout is overly excessive and really dampers the user experience. At the very least add a stupid countdown timer so users don‚Äôt have to guess how long they have until they can swipe again.

Update in response to the developers reply:

I understand the intention of the ‚Äúyes‚Äù swipe limit and it has been successful in its intended function. I have been more discrete with my yes swipes but that was never the issue for me. The issue was that the swipe limit lockout was excessive at a literal 24 hours before I could continue swiping. That was very excessive compared to the other major dating apps available.

However, I will say that I have noticed that the swipe lockout has significantly decreased since I posted my review. I don‚Äôt know if that is a fluke or by design because my first few days were literally 24 hours from the last yes swipe to the moment that I could begin swiping again.
title: Updated: Poor user experience due to 24 hour swipe lockout

I understand that ‚Äòwomen message first‚Äô is a very important part of the company‚Äôs appeal and philosophy, but that philosophy just doesn‚Äôt play as well when you don‚Äôt view yourself as a woman but also don‚Äôt not view yourself as a woman. review: After two months of being on this app, pretty much just seeing profiles of people 500 miles away who obviously weren‚Äôt a right fit for me, Bumble gives me a notification that they‚Äôre ‚Äútemporarily expanding your preferences.‚Äù After that about every other profile was someone in the same city, who was right up my alley, and who had already swiped right on me. I guess they had to expand my preferences for that ü§∑üèº‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è Seems like Bumble was holding out on me until the last of the three months I bought. I‚Äôm guessing it‚Äôs because their hopes are that I would get excited and I‚Äôd buy another three months if I didn‚Äôt become official with someone in this next month. Less likely you‚Äôll become official with someone in one month rather than three. Seems a little dishonest to me. It‚Äôs otherwise a decent app, which is why it doesn‚Äôt get a one star. DM us on Facebook or Twitter @BumbleSupport for any support!", 'modified': '2020-08-16T23:57:42Z'}
review:
Recently, I started using bumble date and bumble bff. A few days ago I tried to switch modes and hit the ‚Äúdate mode‚Äù button by accident. I lost all of my matches and conversations from bumble date. 

I have multiple issues with the ‚Äúdate mode‚Äù feature. For one, why permanently delete the matches? If anything just give people the option to temporarily hide the matches/conversations when you turn date mode off. Two, if you‚Äôre going to have a feature that deletes all of a person‚Äôs conversations you should make sure that feature has some sort of warning message. Putting that info in small font under the button doesn‚Äôt help. For example, y‚Äôall could implement a trigger/warning message to be sent once someone hits the button. Finally, the placement of the button is awful. It‚Äôs right below the option to change modes and above the snooze option. I personally found it confusing. 

Overall, this is a social media app so the focus should be on making it easier for people to connect not harder.
title: Move the Date Mode Button

developerResponse: {'id': 19071338, 'body': "Hi there, we really appreciate you sharing your thoughtful feedback with us. We are always looking for ways to improve our users' experience on the app so we will make sure to pass your input along to our Product Team :)", 'modified': '2020-11-12T16:11:23Z'}
review:
Compared to many other dating apps, Bumble stands out. There‚Äôs plenty of people to connect with, and the 24 hour limit really encourages actually talking to your matches instead of just collecting them. That being said, I have noticed a couple problems. There‚Äôs an audio messaging feature, but when you try to listen to the messages, they constantly freeze and start over. So those are essentially useless. 

What bothers me the most, however, is the beeline. It‚Äôs way too easy to accidentally swipe left or right when scrolling up and down. Since it‚Äôs a premium feature, I would really love to see this mechanic to change or for there to be an undo button so if you accidentally swipe left on someone, they‚Äôre not lost to the void forever. 

If these small things were fixed, my rating would absolutely go up to 5 stars. I hope the developers can take some time to make these improvements!
title: Great app, needs some tweaks.

review: I used to absolutely love Bumble and recommend it to anyone who was interested in trying online dating. Within the last year everything is behind a paywall. They also set a limit on how many people you can swipe on a day, but have no fear because behind a paywall you can have unlimited swipes. I loved using bumble when I first moved because it gave me opportunities to meet someone while busy in my graduate program. I‚Äôm a broke student so I can‚Äôt justify the cost but Bumble used to be waaaay better before paywalling everything. Customer service people are nice and all, but you simply can‚Äôt get anyone to respond to you in a timely manner. They tell you ‚Äú48 hours‚Äù but it is not true. Not true at all. Additionally, I haven‚Äôt had trouble getting likes, matches, messages, and dates from people on other apps, but bumble was extremely disappointing.

review: If you are looking for something serious, go to Hinge. If you are looking for something casual, go to Tinder. Hinge does that and their range setting actually works. Out of likes and want to know when you‚Äôll get more? Tinder will show you a countdown, Bumble just says ‚Äúsoon!‚Äù. The only thing this app does to try and differentiate is allow women to message first. A value proposition that doesn‚Äôt really provide any value? Also the ‚Äúyou missed a match‚Äù feature is questionable since you can only rewind to previous profiles if you pay (another thing hinge does for free). Seriously everyone, just get Hinge

review: The application itself functions well for the most part. The people are good and creating matches of mutual attraction works as well if not better than other apps. That being said, there are bugs, one of which has logged me out and locked me from the account and there is absolutely no way to contact/involve support staff. The issue has occurred on multiple occasions, after the first I had to just make a completely new account. I went through every avenue to try to contact support but doing so is a huge hassle and have never received any contact back from their staff. My overarching advice is just not even to download this app. It‚Äôs not even close to worth the headache it puts you through. If you do download it DO NOT spend money becoming a member or adding the in-app purchase features. You will lose what you paid for when you‚Äôre inevitably locked out for no reason and there‚Äôs no way to get a hold of anyone.
title: Will log you out, keep you from logging in and no support infrastructure

review: I would have given Bumble 1 star, but I am willing to admit the problem could be me. What I do know is the following. I have been on Bumble for over 3 years, and I have gone on dates with only TWO women, neither of which worked out to anything long term. There were another 2 that I exchanged some in-app messages with, and probably another 8 to 10 that indicated matches (the ‚ÄúBoom‚Äù message that Bumble gives you), but the women never bothered to send the first message. Keep in mind that this is the sum total of my interactions after THREE years. I use the app almost daily, which is supposed to get your profile out there more, but still nothing. I have a good job, a college education, and am at least average looking. I would have expected the number of interactions that I have had in 3 months, not 3 years. I am convinced that one has to pay money to really get their profile out there, so if you are unwilling to pay, then don‚Äôt expect a lot from this app.
title: Disappointing Lack of Connections

developerResponse: {'id': 10894689, 'body': 'Our Support Team is always here to help you with any issue that you encounter on the app. Feel free to contact us anytime at feedback@team.bumble.com, or on Facebook or Twitter (@bumblesupport) so we can help troubleshoot and improve your experience!', 'modified': '2019-09-25T19:57:25Z'}
review: First dating app I tried after wanting to get back to dating. The concept seemed fun, as it seemed that Bumble would match me with people that had swiped right. Then ‚ÄòBOOM‚Äô we would start chatting! However, a majority if not all but two, from my queue were actually interested/responded. Throughout the day, I‚Äôd get notifications that guys were interested but when I‚Äôd check, no one was actually there. I‚Äôd get notifications that someone ‚Äòsuperswiped‚Äô but no one was there either. -so sad- Generally it got boring after a while to swipe endlessly. When I did get a response, it was hard to carry a conversation. I‚Äôm considering just saying ‚Äòhi‚Äô just to see if a guy actually swiped right! I know some criticisms from men were women just would say ‚Äòhi.‚Äô It‚Äôs tiring saying something substantial when no one responds! üòÄ Anyways, I‚Äôve come to the conclusion that if you have mainstream looks you would have a better chance at Bumble. Maybe to help narrow down want others want in a partner, try a different dating app.
title: Meh

developerResponse: {'id': 4032970, 'body': "Hi there, we're so sorry you are feeling this way. We know you're amazing, and we truly believe you can find success on Bumble! We hope you don't undervalue yourself- you deserve the best! We'd love to keep working together to help you have success on Bumble- we're here for you and we have your back!", 'modified': '2018-06-29T20:39:27Z'}
review:
On the one hand, the customer service is great. On more than one occasion the good people at Bumble helped me tweak my profile, be it rewording stuff or rearranging pictures. And they were always super quick about replying to my inquiries, as well (as opposed to places like OkCupid, that never replied at all). 
On the other hand, I‚Äôve had zero success here. After a couple of months without matches, I signed up for the paid-membership so I could at least see who was swiping right on me (and try to figure out where the disconnect was). But, as it turns out, no one had swiped right on me at all.  And now, a few months later, that no-match trend has continued. But I guess I can‚Äôt be too upset or surprised. I wouldn‚Äôt swipe right on an ugly loser like me, either. I guess not everyone deserves companionship or happiness. 
Bottom line, Bumble will probably work for you for two reasons:  1) Their employees legitimately care, and 2) You‚Äôre not me.
title: Mixed bag

review: So I had someone recommend this app to me since I‚Äôm new to town and looking for some new friends to hang out with. I live in a pretty populated area and felt encouraged by that fact with the filters I have in place. I definitely swiped right for people, but unfortunately didn‚Äôt make any connections. Everyday I open the app and see that there are so many people that have swiped right for me but I can‚Äôt see them or hope to connect without being rich I guess? And I don‚Äôt have any new people that come up for me to swipe through since I‚Äôm looking to be friends with people who are actually within an hours driving distance from me. I don‚Äôt know how to describe how demoralizing it is to see these people that want to be friends with me, but unable to do anything about it because I can‚Äôt pay to upgrade my profile. Anyway, I‚Äôm sure some people have success with this app, but for me I just feel more depressed than when I started out. Probably will try a different app?
title: Made me more depressed

developerResponse: {'id': 30050862, 'body': "Hi ReAndreRe. We're sorry you didn't enjoy your experience on Bumble. Our team would love the opportunity to improve your experience in the Hive! Please message our Support Team on Twitter or Facebook (@BumbleSupport) and we'd be happy to help.", 'modified': '2022-05-30T12:28:13Z'}
review:
According to the stats of early 2021, it was almost 70% of men and 30% women using this app in the us. Now it feels like it‚Äôs 90% to 10% at least in nyc. 
I decided to give this app another chance. First day I got 30 likes, the 2nd - 2, and then nothing. Out of 30 people there were mostly 4/10 girls (either obese or unattractive), who I didn‚Äôt feel like matching with. The only 2 girls who were around my level of attractiveness (7/10) didn‚Äôt want to match with me. 
At the same time my female friend (around 5/10) got 2400+ likes since February and 400+ matches. She goes out with guys who are 7/10 or even 8/10, who are by far more attractive than her. 
Is that fair? There‚Äôs more women than men in NYC. By at least 250k ppl. 
This app doesn‚Äôt care about guys at all. It spoils women by providing them an unfair advantage. Which consequently spoils their offline behavior. Why does a guy, who is 7/10 or 8/10 has to date some 5/10 girl? Why do we have to settle for unattractive girls?
title: This app hugely disadvantages men and makes them feel ugly

developerResponse: {'id': 24657561, 'body': "Hi there! We appreciate you sharing your feedback with us. We are always looking for ways to improve our users' experience on the app so we will make sure to pass your input along to our Product Team. If you have other suggestions or need help, please message our Support Team on Twitter or Facebook (@BumbleSupport) and we'd be happy to assist you.", 'modified': '2021-08-23T07:41:09Z'}
review:
I think Bumble is a great app that does something rare which is putting the beginning of an interaction in the hands of the women which is great! 

But there are a few tiny things that could be done to make this app even better which in my eyes would warrant a 5/5 star. 

1. Please remove the feature of swiping left to right for replying to a message. This may be exclusive to iPhone users but I cannot count how many times i have tried to use the iPhone‚Äôs ‚Äúback‚Äù feature of swiping left to right like on every single other app to go to the previous page but I and prompted with the reply where I must cancel then hit the back arrow. Plus if you press and hold a message you already have reply amongst other things as and option.

2. Allow us to control when the 24hr countdown until unmatch begins. Alot of people do not have access to their phones every single day and or are able to check the app to see if you have matched. It would be great if the 24hr timer starts after you view the matched person‚Äôs profile. Because who knows you could match with youre true soulmate but didnt know it because your phone was broke or you were out camping or on a business trip without access to your phone ect.
title: Almost a great dating app

developerResponse: {'id': 24758584, 'body': 'Hi there! Thanks for letting us know we‚Äôre on the right track. Our team is constantly working hard to improve Bumble for our customers, so that means so much. We‚Äôll make sure your positive feedback is heard by the rest of the team! üíõ', 'modified': '2021-08-27T12:38:19Z'}
review: The whole aura you get from bumble is kind of mixed at first. It has a very tinderish feel to it but not as sexually forward or aggressive. I‚Äôve actually come across real people in it that I know in real life and some I haven‚Äôt seen in years so you don‚Äôt get those stupid sex bot or cam not requests or Snapchat hookers. So that‚Äôs always a plus, unless you‚Äôre into that I guess. What put it at a 5 star for me was they actually have a section to guide people on dating and what to look out for for harassment and other unwanted/inappropriate behaviors by potential suitors, and it just makes the environment seem that much more comforting.  Of all the apps I‚Äôve used for dating, bumble is probably the most trusted for authentic connections in a comfortable atmosphere of the electronic world.
title: Exceeded what I thought

review: Love the app and, as a woman, I‚Äôm totally fine with sending the first message, so no complaints there. My only annoyance is that the messaging needs to be improved. First, please add a time stamp to the messages sent/received. I‚Äôve often missed messages and was left wondering what time they were sent and why I missed them. It‚Äôs not a huge deal, but it seems like it‚Äôs an extremely easy add, so why not do it? Another annoyance is the lack of having some kind of indicator on the conversations screen of who sent the last message. Then I can easily scan the page to see who I still need to respond to. Both of these are features on another popular dating app (that will not be named here) but when using both, the lack of these two features are very apparent and it‚Äôs annoying when you look for it, expecting it to be there, and it‚Äôs not.
title: Could Use A Couple Tweaks

review: Caution: the profile questions are a trap! They cannot be deleted. So if your preference for having children falls somewhere in between don't want and do want (AKA undecided), NEVER answer their profile prompt or you will be pressured into putting out the wrong vibe into the world forever. Answers to the profile prompts can be changed but not deleted. Maybe you don't wanna tell the whole entire dating pool about your "vices". Be careful, because if you do, you can never delete that info without deleting your entire profile.  This is outrageous and easily fixable, except support at Bumble does not even acknowledge this as a problem. There is no space for somebody who is unsure if they want kids!? So you force them to lie about such a critical issue?! The closest thing to a solution is to completely delete my Bumble account and start a new one, but the more likely outcome will be me deleting bumble altogether.
title: Profile questions can't be deleted l, only changed

developerResponse: {'id': 16962552, 'body': 'Go to the in-app settings, scroll to the very bottom, and then tap on "Notification settings." De-select everything except what you want (new messages, new admirers, matches, etc.). Send us a message on Facebook or Twitter @BumbleSupport if you can\'t seem to get rid of the notifications you don\'t like.', 'modified': '2020-07-29T19:56:57Z'}
review:
Look, Bumble... it‚Äôs cute what you do by promoting the importance of getting to know a person first and foremost by allowing your users to answer some pretty important questions so they can establish a relationship of any kind with other Bumble users. I respect that. What I don‚Äôt find cute tho, is the constant reminder to utilize your app through ‚Äòquirky‚Äô feel-good statements that pops up randomly throughout the day. I genuinely do not know how to turn off these types of notifications without just putting the app on mute causing me to miss messages and matches because the notification options descriptions are also ‚Äòquirky‚Äô... 
Maybe I‚Äôm just too frustrated and a bit of a cynic to actually see what I‚Äôm looking at and it‚Äôs right there in front of my face and if that is the case, awesome! Can someone tell me how to stop receiving these types of notifications? I‚Äôd super appreciate it. Otherwise, pretty decent app that updates regularly.
title: I am begging you

review: I‚Äôve been using the app for over 2 years now, and have only received a single match. The rest of my matches have been locked behind a paywall for $25 a month. I‚Äôve attempted multiple times for the company to address how potential matches aren‚Äôt shown in my feed unless I pay for them, and they refuse to acknowledge my problem. Instead, they send scripted emails explaining to me the features of their service and how to set up my profile to increase matches. Completely ignoring my direct question of ‚Äúwhy are my Beeline matches not showing up in my feed after almost a year of them sitting there?‚Äù It wreaks of a money scheme/prostitution service where you have to pay in order to connect with potential matches. Insane. Tinder is cheaper, and they offer more benefits, and don‚Äôt paywall your matches. I was looking forward to this service to get away from the sex focused apps, and try to find quality relationship material. But instead, after 2 years, I‚Äôm still met with the same paywall structure that is ridiculous to have. What a joke.
title: Scam

review:
I do not see any purpose behind having a time-limit for women to make the first move. It actually can be very unfair for the male, when someone who liked them has a busy life.

If a woman doesn‚Äôt like a match, then she can simply unmatch w/o making any first move- but, let‚Äôs say she liked him first, and then *a long while later* he likes her back and they match. What if they match at a time she is away from her phone/very busy? In such a case she might never see it, before the hours run out- while the guy sees it, excited to chat, and regardless of extending it another day it still disappears before she opens the app again. For all we know, that prospect could have gone somewhere if they‚Äôd entered conversation.
Having no time-limit would fully eliminate this issue - I‚Äôm assuming Bumble Boost doesn‚Äôt allow more than one timed rematch per person.
title: Great! But something‚Äôs unfair

developerResponse: {'id': 34070103, 'body': "Hi there. We're sorry you didn't enjoy your experience on Bumble. While we continue to work hard to improve this, if we can help your experience further right now, please send us a message at bumble.com/contact. üíõ", 'modified': '2023-01-03T16:42:49Z'}
review:
it‚Äôs a decent dating app, definitely a top 5, however it‚Äôs got some issues. 

UI: 
awful. it‚Äôs been clunky for years and nothing has changed. you‚Äôre required to scroll down to view profiles but the app sometimes reads a down scroll (no matter how careful you are) as a left or right swipe. and now all the sudden you‚Äôve matched without someone you didn‚Äôt want to and they‚Äôre messaging you and you feel bad. this isn‚Äôt even a once in a while thing, this happens all the time. 

time limits: i like the idea of having women make the first move. makes the app feel more safe i guess. less chance of weirdos and unwanted dms. however the limit is 24 hours and then if you haven‚Äôt reached out or vice versa (depending on who‚Äôs turn it is) then you loose the match unless you pay money to get it back. I just wish that it was like 48 hours at least or even 36. it‚Äôs definitely not uncommon for me to forget to check the app for a day. and then anything that may have happened during that time is gone. i think alternatively having the timer start once the other person opens the app would be fine. because if i match and they don‚Äôt open the app for 24hrs then it‚Äôs gone. 

otherwise a decent dating app. not complaints with anything else really. it‚Äôs just overdue for an update
title: fine

developerResponse: {'id': 31153230, 'body': "Thanks for reaching out to us and sharing your feedback with us, Quana! Bumble is always looking for new ways to improve the experience of our members. We really appreciate you taking the time to leave us your feedback about this, and we'll be sure to share it with our Product Team.", 'modified': '2022-07-28T23:16:59Z'}
review:
As far as apps go I will say bumble is one of the better apps I have used. To me, it is a safe as it can be.I love the fact that I have to start the conversation. Absolutely love the travel option. And the boost don‚Äôt hurt to have when its ‚Äúslim pickings‚Äù for a while. 
I think the only thing I wish that they did/ would add is once that person has open the message change delivered to read or opened. It bugs me to no end that I don‚Äôt know if this person is just not getting on the app (because let‚Äôs be honest, life gets busy and for some one us lol we forget to hop on and you have like 4 Messages sitting there from days ago) or if they read it and then just decided not to respond. That‚Äôs the only thing I would change about bumble.
title: Really good app

developerResponse: {'id': 27398104, 'body': 'We‚Äôre thrilled you made such a special connection in the Hive! Please tell us more about your story at bumble.com/success. üíõ', 'modified': '2022-01-12T12:24:22Z'}
review: I swore I‚Äôd never get married again after divorce from my husband of 25 years. I am 50 and a professional woman‚Ä¶and just didn‚Äôt think I needed a man in my life.  But my kids (16,18) pushed me to start dating again and went to the trouble to add Bumble to my phone, set up my profile and swipe away. (They had a ball doing all of that!)   With much encouragement from my sons, I messaged three people and ultimately went on two dates.  I ended up meeting the love of my life on date #2!!! He lived in a city 600 miles from me‚Ä¶so we would otherwise have never met!  (He was in town visiting a family member when we connected on Bumble). We‚Äôve been together three years and got married recently.  He is truly the most special man and perfect for me in every way!!!  Thank you Bumble!!!!
title: Works!!!

developerResponse: {'id': 22302924, 'body': 'Hi there, our team would love the opportunity to improve your experience in the Hive! Please message our Support Team on Twitter or Facebook (@bumblesupport).', 'modified': '2021-04-18T09:10:50Z'}
review: This is both a pro and a con. It takes almost no effort to set up but there just is not enough stuff to add to your profile to really give someone an idea of it would be a good match. For one, they could really use a sexuality filter. Secondly, it would help if it forced you to actually fill out your profile and verify yourself at the start instead of randomly after you are allowed to start swiping. I find a ton of people who have just joined the app and only have their one selfie shown on their profile and that‚Äôs it, and the verification is just an extra safety measure. Third, I have noticed the app sends me message notifications way after I actually receive a notification and end up missing out when the person messaging is actually on the app. Simply, its too simple, which makes it both great and terrible at the same time.
title: Its very simple

review:
So I loved bumble because it seemed easier to talk to genuine people than tinder. I had several connections that had potential to go somewhere. Then about a month ago I randomly got a message saying I‚Äôm blocked from bumble for trying to solicit / sell something. I was really confused because none of my conversations had anything to do with that. I figured it was an accident so I messaged bumble customer service several times in the last month and they never got back to me. I‚Äôm still blocked for something I never did it was weird but luckily I ended up downloading hinge and found it a way better way to weed out people I wouldn‚Äôt want to be on a date with and find better connections. In just 3 weeks I‚Äôve been on 4 hinge dates (I consider myself pretty picky) that went really well. I‚Äôm not trying to knock down bumble and advertise for hinge I just am really disappointed they didn‚Äôt get back to me a month later when it was clearly a mistake and I never tried to sell anything 

Thanks for reading !!
title: Very disappointed but glad I found hinge

developerResponse: {'id': 27804084, 'body': "We appreciate you sharing your feedback with us. We are always looking for ways to improve our users' experience on the app so we will make sure to pass your input along to our Product Team.", 'modified': '2022-02-02T11:46:19Z'}
review: I have used Bumble for a few years now and even though I haven‚Äôt found a match, I like the little reminders when I don‚Äôt check in after a few days. I really like that you can confirm in real time using pictures that the person your talking to matches there pictures and are not a cat fish (the blue shield). I also like and don‚Äôt mind the tracking of my location and find it very helpful when seeing other matches locations to know about how many miles away they are from me ( especially when I don‚Äôt recognize some smaller towns or county‚Äôs). I do think that part of the app needs an update because my home location isn‚Äôt listed as an option and it doesn‚Äôt differentiate between different county‚Äôs very well ( like my locations of Summerfield, Belleview, Ocala or Wildwood FL).

So I am writing a review here and it is typing it up however, I cannot see what I‚Äôm writing because the writing is in white. developerResponse: {'id': 27514695, 'body': "All of our core features are free to use. You don't have to pay to swipe, make matches, or send messages. We offer a few paid options to access additional features, but they're totally optional. You don't have to pay to make authentic connections in the Hive. If you have any questions, definitely reach out to our Support Team at bumble.com/contact", 'modified': '2022-01-18T14:10:42Z'}
review: Even though I'm a woman I can clearly see how the devs try and make dating a pay-to-win with their app. There's inconsistency in the premium pricing between genders, making it way more expensive for men than women to have a good experience. You limit the swipes a day in ANY direction (iirc tinder only limits right swipes), and then you take away the 2 free filters and hiding them behind a paywall, so now I have to swipe through all of these people that just don't meet my personal requirements because you're trying to milk some more money out of your user base? If the filters were only available to paying users from the beginning it wouldn't even be an issue, but to have the 2 filters as an option for free users for YEARS and then take them away without a single word? Not even a tiny mention in the patch notes? Alrightly. I'd rather be stuck using my vibrator for the rest of my life than paying for your services.
title: Too expensive, and taking away all features worth using.

review: I‚Äôm a male and let me direct you guys to tinder. This is why. Dating is dangerous for women no matter what app you use or who makes the first move. But you have women who want to be approached so this puts women in a weird position especially if they like the traditional male approach. Now for men since we have to sit and wait for a response, we should see who likes us males for free so we can swipe or not swipe and women can make their first move and keep the flow going. But that‚Äôs not going happen so for an easier flow of online dating tinder would be more ideal. Yes I know people will say it‚Äôs for sex but that‚Äôs every app. If you like to play the gen z game of who messages first, you‚Äôre in the right place. Tinder is a quick swipe and y‚Äôall start talking immediately. No issues with that. No sitting around waiting. Just two people who swiped on each other and work from there.

review: Bought the month upgrade to see my ‚Äòlikes‚Äô for easier swiping since in my area, there never seemed to be a ton of matches. In the month I had purchased it, there were a total of 10 likes that I could see. The DAY my membership ended and I could no longer see potential matches, 50+ likes appeared. Not only that, but suddenly there were hundreds more potential people to see and swipe through. It was like I was hidden (which I was wasnt) until the day I stopped paying. What an absolute scam to take your money, then a con-job to get you to re-up for another month. It was like they loaded up on hidden matches just to get you to pay for a membership again. I matched with 10 people alone the day after but not one of them initiated a conversation and they all expired so who knows when, over the course of the previous month that my profile was limited to others, that they swiped right on me. Chances are they weren‚Äôt active active. Kudos to you Bumble on preying on peoples feelings to make a profit.
title: Scam- DO NOT PAY FOR A MEMBERSHIP

review: While using the app I have encountered multiple men who are simply looking for escorts much of them being extremely older than me, they will ask for sex in exchange for money, they will ask to pay you to do sexual things with them and if you refuse or tell them sorry you are not interested they will report your account. This app is extremely disrespectful towards women, not only do we have to reach out to the men first but as we reach out to these men we do not know their real intentions for using the app so when we reach out to these men and we are met with disgusting offers and are reported for declining these offers it‚Äôs a real slap in the face. review:

review:
I‚Äôve used the free version of Bumble on and off for the past few years and like its simplicity and efficiency.

However, I just purchased the premium version and am so annoyed by the layout/design of viewing the ‚ÄúBeehive‚Äù feature where you are allowed to see people who have already swiped right on you. It is cumbersome, inefficient, and not very user-friendly. It would be nice to be able to interact with Beehive just like you do with the free version of viewing matches one at a time and moving through the profiles by swiping left or right. The way it is currently set up makes me feel a bit overwhelmed and it takes too much time to interact with. It‚Äôs also way too easy to accidentally swipe left or right on someone you weren‚Äôt meaning to and that‚Äôs super annoying.

review: So as someone who has signed up for dating apps and had a very hit or miss experience and later signed up just to see what was out there I didn‚Äôt know what would happen but I am happy to say because of this app I had meet my current girlfriend of almost six months. When you compare Bumble and other dating apps there is a larger pool of people who are looking for a serious relationship and not wanting to bang. I would recommend this app to anyone who wants to try online dating for two reasons one because of the people who use this app which for me resulted in more meaningful conversations and two you also don‚Äôt have to play what are these persons true motives. For any person who wants a relationship and is patient and has an idea of what they want this is the app best designed for you.

review: Again, I got accused of promoting social media and I don‚Äôt defend for myself. They literally just blocked me completely because they ‚Äúreceived reports‚Äù I had been so frustrated with the app. This time around when I made another account when they eventually let me back on, I literally wrote on my profile ‚ÄúI don‚Äôt have social media‚Äù so how could people say that I was trying to promote my social media account when there was no social media provided on my profile!? review:
Before you try this dating site, I‚Äôd like to give you a heads up....what‚Äôs the old adage again?....oh, ‚Äúyou don‚Äôt get something for nothing‚Äù remember that. You know that likes are far and few between for most of us, right?
So, I‚Äôve had a couple of likes that didn‚Äôt work out... ok, that‚Äôs expected. But when you finally see someone that is nice looking and is within a reasonable geographical position, you take your time and make sure that you swipe right... what happened???! Nothing there. It all went away and there is no one to contact. You know it wasn‚Äôt your fault! Ok now what? You see that ‚Äòs their trick... what is there to do but sign up for the ‚Äúpremium‚Äù option so that you can go back and review the matches and try to find ‚Äúthat guy‚Äù or ‚Äúgal‚Äù as the case may be. Click the little open app button in the email, the app opens, absolutely nothing in the app. The whole thing is just an absolute mess of an app, and obviously doesn‚Äôt work. I‚Äôm an IT lead, with a newer iPhone, who had the most updated app as of the time I downloaded it. Don‚Äôt waste your time, or your money. review: I had an account and mid conversation I was kicked out, tried to log back in and was told I am banned for trying to ‚Äúinappropriate buy or sell‚Äù. My account was falsely reported and I am not even given any kind of warning or chance to defend myself. So I lost connections that I have no chance to get back. I am very sad with my experience on bumble and I wouldn‚Äôt recommend it to others. developerResponse: {'id': 3857240, 'body': "Hey there, thank you for your feedback! I'm sorry to hear of your technical issues, please can you DM us on Facebook or Twitter so we can look into this further?", 'modified': '2018-06-15T15:50:12Z'}
review: There are a couple bugs in this app that make it tricky to use. First and foremost, message timestamps are often wrong. You can receive a message and when you go to view it it‚Äôll show as sent ‚Äúyesterday,‚Äù for example. Second, the app‚Äôs 24 hour countdown timers for first messages don‚Äôt update accurately, so you don‚Äôt know how much time you have left to message someone or extend a match unless you tap into someone‚Äôs profile. For an app that‚Äôs updated seemingly every week, it‚Äôs amazing these basic bugs haven‚Äôt been worked out. Lastly it does seem weird and a bit lecherous (as many others have noted) that the app throws a mountain of implausibly good-looking people at you in between the regular people who have swiped right on you... it‚Äôs gross but doesn‚Äôt change the eventual matches you make. As for the ‚Äúquality of the people on here‚Äù or whatever... this is a review of the app, not a review of dating!
title: Weird display bugs

developerResponse: {'id': 16990541, 'body': 'Thanks for updating your review.\nWe always appreciate feedback from our users.', 'modified': '2020-07-31T00:37:06Z'}
review:
I definitely like the new Bumble Boost format and how you can see everyone who has swiped right in one comprehensive page.

The only true quirk that does become quite annoying lies with your location.
I traveled back home for two weeks in which case my location updated. I opened the app at the time because I was responding back to a person I had started a connection a few days prior. When I came back home I had to sift through a load of potential matches that were still showing up from the city I had just left.
I know this sounds like a petty grievance but it has caused quite a bit of confusion when matching and messaging. Truly wish the travel mode feature worked the way it sounds like it‚Äôs intended to and actually removes those that matched on you when you‚Äôre no longer in that location.
title: Love the Bumble Boost update

developerResponse: {'id': 16864008, 'body': 'Thanks for updating your review.\nWe always appreciate feedback from our users.', 'modified': '2022-02-05T10:45:36Z'}
review:
BFF mode only allows females to match with other females and males to match with males. Can women not be friends with men? I don‚Äôt understand. What about non-binary pals? Why don‚Äôt they show up in my feed? I‚Äôm very disappointed in this aspect of the app. It‚Äôs always bothered me because while it is one of the only apps to make platonic relationships, it does not allow you to be friends with the gender spectrum. This seems so closed minded for such an inclusive and seemingly progressive app. 
I‚Äôm already in a committed relationship and I want to make more friends. I get along with people all over the gender spectrum and it hurts me to see this app excluding so many diverse and interesting people from my friend scope. I deleted the app after getting frustrated by this. 
There‚Äôs many other flaws as well, but to me this one was glaringly obvious and I only saw one other review addressing the issue. I don‚Äôt think this app was intended to be exclusively for dating so neglecting a huge portion of the draw is disappointing.
title: A gender exclusive app

review:
Had several technical issues through the entirety of having the app.
(Messages, matches, etc) 
I had befriended one on Instagram who told me my messages was not going through to them on Bumble Business.

I decided to upgrade and get the life membership. (To save money long term)
And to be able to connect with more people.

They advertise and suggest these features are truly unlimited when it‚Äôs not.

If you are on the free version they cap you on daily activity.

If you use the premium they see doing too much activity as spam. And can block you from the app  at any time without warning.

Due to all the technical issues I was having and people not getting my messages on the app.
I suggested people could reach out to me on Instagram or continue to speak here within the app.
(You can have your Instagram attached to your profile. Which would mean anyone could see your Instagram if they desired to.)
Which is why I ONLY shared a partnered app as an additional means of communication due to Bumbles technical issues.
I would of been more patient, however connections do expire if you do not message them promptly.

In all if I did it all over I would of stuck with the free version and only reach out to 5-10 people daily. And would of asked the other person their desired means of communication and not directly giving my own. 

Hope this review helps.
title: WARNING: Read Before Paying For Upgrade.

review: Let me just say, there is absolutely no way I‚Äôd sock money into this app when you have a competitor that legitimately supports equality among all groups, and has a name more widely known than this one. Tinder lets you express yourself, and doesn‚Äôt feel the need to moderate accounts for random reasons, which I figure is kind of ridiculous. Why does a report button exist if you‚Äôre constantly surveilling accounts for every little thing? No bathroom selfies? What kind of rule is that? Bikini pics allowed outside, but you better be wearing a shirt in that pool if you‚Äôre a man? Nice double standard. You‚Äôve gotta pay for unlimited likes and travel mode, features that come with the free version of Tinder? Yea, right, decisions decisions, so many things going for this app that makes me want to keep it over going back to Tinder. Good luck running a successful dating app that favors one gender over another, you‚Äôre bound to have many success stories, at least from the LGBT community.

If you have other suggestions or need help, please message our Support Team on Twitter or Facebook (@BumbleSupport) and we'd be happy to assist you.", 'modified': '2021-10-11T06:39:49Z'}
review:
Girlfriend convinced me to download Bumble to meet friends at the start of the COVID pandemic. I was reluctant at first and even upon first using the app, did not feel inclined to continue. But, after giving it a second shot, I‚Äôve been able to meet so many cool dudes in just a year while working from home. 

Apart from the success I‚Äôve found within the app, I‚Äôve never had any UI or bug issues. Everything is simple and straightforward. 

The only issue I‚Äôve had is accidental swiping. Now I understand this might be a tactic to get people to upgrade their subscription, but it is too easy to accidentally swipe left or right. There have been some cool people that I would‚Äôve loved to meet but I accidentally lost the connection by mis-swiping; for that, I give it 4 stars instead of 5.
title: Bumble BFF has been life changing

review: YES YOU READ THAT RIGHT. I‚Äôm extremely happy with my precious girlfriend all because of this here app. When downloading Bumble, I had low, low... low... expectations. We all go through Tinder for a few months and lose hope in love, AM I RIGHT LADIES? However, I did not expect for the stars to allign and me to meet the girl I treaure today. The app is very friendly, slow and steady, and allows time for you to focus on each match. It reminds me of having a picnic in a feild of flowers. Other dating apps I‚Äôve used, however, are more like cheap car hookups that you kind of regret but at least they made you feel something. This is not a hookup app - ITS AN APP FOR LOVE AND DEVOTION. Bascially, this app is bliss, and it gave me a loving girlfriend, so I‚Äôm giving a glowing review. Its perfect for mellow college kids who just want some loveeeeeee in their life.

You can email us at bumble.com/help/#contact-us", 'modified': '2021-04-01T10:06:46Z'}
review:
I‚Äôve had this now for a few weeks and so far this is my takeaway: 
It‚Äôs honestly no different from Tinder. The only difference between Bumble and Tinder is a tag that says if you‚Äôre looking for casual or relationship, a friendship/business connection option and you can‚Äôt play music on the profiles. I‚Äôve used numerous apps over the years and decided to try Bumble because of the success stories of heard from it but it‚Äôs still the same problem; you match, message first, wait, and match/message expires. There are empty profiles still and overall just isn‚Äôt doing it for me (for reference, I literally live in a Metropolis so keep this in mind). My advice? If you want to invest the time, try it out but I‚Äôd just stick with Tinder since it produces the same results but without the match expiring. I‚Äôll be keep the app still to see if anything changes but I‚Äôm not holding my breath.
title: Tinder with a different look

developerResponse: {'id': 16342310, 'body': "We certainly understand having a distance preferences. Currently, this only applies to the users you see in your Swipe Deck. Admirers using Travel, traveling or the Whole Country Distance filter will show up in your Beeline with a message about their location. We're available via DMs on Facebook or Twitter @BumbleSupport if you'd to chat further!", 'modified': '2020-07-01T16:40:46Z'}
review:
** Update** Stop touting this as an improvement! It is clearly a shady way to keep users on your app instead of actually meeting someone. If I have X miles set, that means I only want to see users within that distance. I should, therefore, only be shown to users within that distance as well. But, no, you'd rather show my profile almost exclusively to users further away so there will never be a chance of a mutual "right swipe." This is irresponsible and misleading.

While this app used to be a good one, that's not the case anymore. I'm a paid user, where I can see everyone who has swiped right on me. And it's very concerning that they are almost exclusively form further away that I have set in my app settings, easily >80%. This tells me that the algorithm is showing my profile more to people I see as too far away and will never swipe on than to people within a reasonable distance that I could have a chance to match with. Seems like they've tweaked the coding in a very shady to keep users on their app.
title: Developers became shady

developerResponse: {'id': 30418674, 'body': "We appreciate you sharing your feedback with us. We are always looking for ways to improve our users' experience on the app so we will make sure to pass your input along to our Product Team.", 'modified': '2022-06-17T17:31:30Z'}
review:
I like it, it‚Äôs not hard to use and the app has features that are different than other dating platforms which I appreciate.
The only thing I‚Äôd change is to allow us to use whatever picture we want for our main photo. I have a picture of myself that shows my face very clearly, but the app can‚Äôt recognize my face and actually auto-replaces the picture with a different one that doesn‚Äôt show my face as clearly as the one I want as my main. I think getting rid of that feature entirely would be a safe bet, let us use whatever photo we would like as our main. We do have 5 other picture slots that can show our face if the first isn‚Äôt clear.
Apart from this, it‚Äôs a solid dating platform. A little pricey, but as far as I‚Äôm seeing it‚Äôs worth it.

review: Used to use Bumble a few years ago and it was a great app both from a tech perspective and also the quantity and quality of people available. You also used to get to use 2 free filters. They took that away. It also used to be a reasonable price if you felt like paying for a few months. They took that away too. Now it‚Äôs $40/month. Seems like Bumble has come down with a severe case of the greeds. This app isn‚Äôt for me anymore so I just deleted it.

developerResponse: {'id': 19703864, 'body': 'Hi there, thank you so much for your thoughtful feedback. Backtrack is now a part of Bumble Boost. We know this is different than how things worked in the past so we would love to help ease the transition. Please message @BumbleSupport on Twitter or Facebook.', 'modified': '2020-12-11T18:54:04Z'}
review:
For all of the ‚Äúempowering‚Äù and user commitment Bumble has espoused itself to over the years, I can‚Äôt help but feel their latest move to drastically raise their prices on  paid features via their latest new tier of ‚Äúpremium‚Äù features is quite disenfranchising. (Not to mention reducing the features formerly offered in the more affordable Bumble Boost...)

The pandemic has hit Bumble‚Äôs core users hard. 

Not only are Millennials especially scrapping by financially due to COVID (and even before COVID due to a dismal financial outlook bc of student debt, lack of affordable housing, health insurance costs, and the like) loneliness and lack of connection has become a devastating byproduct of this ongoing crisis. Was now the time to higher prices and reduce access to meeting people via swipe limits and once free features like backtrack? There are certainly bigger injustices than Bumbles choice to do this now but it‚Äôs definitely disappointing. 

This move feels like yet another company not doing right by their customers, despite what they claim. Bumble is valued in the billions, already raking in millions of dollars in revenues, and looking at an IPO as the average customer gets less for more money. The rich always seem to get richer, it seems even during a historic crisis. Story as old as time ‚Äî I thought Bumble was better than this.
title: A price hike at the height of COVID? The rich get richer...

developerResponse: {'id': 17632832, 'body': 'Hi, there! We truly appreciate your feedback. review:
Stop sending me marketing notifications to get me to go back to the app. Not only does this violate Apple‚Äôs Terms of Service that you signed as a developer, but you also send deceptive messages like ‚ÄúYou‚Äôre one half of a great match! Go meet the other!‚Äù to make me think I got liked by someone, when in fact there was no like at all.  These kinds of messages reduce trust on the platform and create an antagonistic relationship between users and you.

Other reasons for lowering your rating: constantly running out of the pool of women in my area (one of the largest cities in the U.S., how is this possible), no ability to filter by vegan/vegetarian (although with the pool size might be pointless), and the intense nickel and diming you do for every action. The fact that I can‚Äôt even SEE who likes me without paying is pure greed. 

I like the concept of empowering women and appreciate the verified badges that reduces fake profiles, but you have a lot of work to do.
title: Trust issues

Ever since I‚Äôve gone through all of those profiles, I haven‚Äôt gotten a single one again. review:
I paid for premium for one month to see why this app had editor‚Äôs choice. That was a waste. I paid for super swipes - a waste of money. I paid for spotlight - a waste of money. 

I‚Äôm a woman seeking a woman, and nearly every day there‚Äôs several men that show up. This should be so basic! Make your search do what it says it‚Äôs going to do?! 

I reported the first one that clearly said ‚Äúmale‚Äù on their profile, and I got an educational email about gender expression that wasn‚Äôt needed because the guy‚Äôs profile said he was a guy and I searched women seeking women... Maybe they should‚Äôve looked at the profile I reported before they sent me the email? Obviously, they didn‚Äôt. 

I should be able to distinguish whoever on the gender spectrum that I want to date. Give me a list of all the expression types and let me check the ones I am comfortable with off.  Clearly lumping the search algorithm to only women for women, women seeking men, or everyone is not working correctly. 

Next, TONS of poly or unicorn hunters. There needs to be a setting to choose for poly or monogamous people. Poly people will rejoice if there‚Äôs a way to filter for their tribe. Monogamous people will rejoice because they‚Äôre not getting sucked into poly situations. 

Now I am running out the month of premium and reporting every single man that shows in the feed. I don‚Äôt care that I am increasing someone‚Äôs workload at Bumble - their moderators aren‚Äôt paying any attention anyways.
title: Their algorithm is broken

review: For an app that tried to differentiate itself by allowing women more agency within online dating, I find there are few safeguards to verify the identity of the users who are matching with you and allow a comfortable experience once engagement transitions off of Bumble. I matched with someone who pretended to have one persona within the app, then immediately harassed and insulted me using racial slurs while attempting to coerce me into a situation I was uncomfortable with. This experience has opened my eyes to how dangerous online dating can be and I feel very unsafe now that these types of platforms offer us little to no guarantees of who we are connecting with, yet exist to promote the maximum amount of visibility, matches and engagement. review:
Bumble is definitely erring on the side of misandry (the opposite of misogyny). Women have to begin the conversations, but I‚Äôm not sure how many women realize that. The number of times women will swipe right on you and never message you is staggeringly high. They would never let a man undo his right swipe because ‚Äúwe‚Äôve already told them you like and that would be rude!‚Äù But women can right swipe, see the match and immediately delete the match. 

You know how women on most sites will say ‚Äúdon‚Äôt start the conversation with just a ‚Äúhey‚Äù ‚Äúhi‚Äù ‚Äúsup‚Äù‚Äù? Well that‚Äôs exactly what women do on here. And the profiles that say ‚ÄúI‚Äôm looking for someone who can actually hold a conversation‚Äù are the worst at it. Like the actual worst. It would be laughable if it weren‚Äôt so frustrating. 

Also, they don‚Äôt have a specific trans section. So don‚Äôt be surprised if you swipe right on someone only to find out they are trans. It‚Äôs fine to be trans, but the section is looking for women not looking for trans women. Maybe the devs could make a separate area for that, but no, you just have to hope they are being honest before you ask them out. And watch out for the girls just advertising for their only fans. 

I get what devs want to accomplish by setting it up differently, but they have basically failed and made it a place where women can swipe and flake out with zero consideration for others.
title: Not the worst thing ever

It‚Äôs a good app that kind of echos Tinder with left and white swiping and info/ pic display. It‚Äôs interesting that the lady starts conversation before the gentleman, which is kinda nice. I agree with the other reviewers, they upgrade to paid membership is dwindling the appeal, especially when it restricts access to basic features like, ‚ÄúSee who likes you.‚Äù Or the ability to superlike somebody, at least Tinder allowed limited free superlikes. 

Perhaps instead of having Bumble Boost and Bumble Coins to be paid separately, maybe combine the two, where depending on the users rate of app activity, they get some rate of free coins everyday they open the app. The more they use the app and the more they swipe right or make with matches, the higher their score and the more bumble coins they can earn per day upon opening the app.

We hope that clears things up a bit.", 'modified': '2019-05-30T18:41:00Z'}
review:
I used to prefer bumble to tinder or any other dating app. In fact, it was the only one I had on my phone and the only one I considered legitimate. But these days, it‚Äôs all about making money and just keeping people on the app indefinitely. 

At one point, I had 36 matches sitting in my queue (I am not trying to brag in any way shape or form, this is just an example), and I started swiping through the people that show up for me to swipe on. I say yes or no (that part doesn‚Äôt matter) to more than to 50 people. I go back and check my queue and it is still at 36 people... exactly the same as when I started. Zero matches. But that‚Äôs not what I‚Äôm complaining about. Not even one person that said yes to me, that I said no to. So your app didn‚Äôt even show me one of the 36 people that like me in the more than 50 people I went through. 

So what‚Äôs the point? Swiping just cause. If your app doesn‚Äôt show me the people that like me ever, or show me to them, we‚Äôll never match and it‚Äôs basically pointless in terms of actual dating. 

It didn‚Äôt used to be like this. I did download tinder and hinge and it‚Äôs not like that on their apps. I‚Äôm guessing it‚Äôs still skewed to keep me on the app, but nowhere near the way bumble is. 

To sum it up, I‚Äôve been a long time fan of bumble, I like the message and empowering women, but it‚Äôs not a worthwhile dating app anymore and I‚Äôm going elsewhere.
title: Going downhill

review: So I really do like this app, the quality of people seem better. Although I‚Äôm indifferent about the time frame of when you match with someone and have to write a message. I think it should just be a tad bit longer than 24 hours each. What if you swipe right on someone and they don‚Äôt match with you until weeks later and you‚Äôre on vacation or something and aren‚Äôt on apps during this time? You completely miss out! Unless of course you pay for certain features. Also, being that I am a female, it gets tiring having to be the first to strike up a conversation every. single. match. I understand the concept of it, but it gets old thinking of clever witty things to say as a first message. I mean, no one really likes to receive ‚Äúhey‚Äù I don‚Äôt anyways. All in all though, I would say I am a fan.

developerResponse: {'id': 31153266, 'body': "Thanks so much for reaching out and sharing your suggestions with us. Bumble is always looking for new ways to improve the experience of our members, and we'll be sure to share your thoughts with our Product Team.", 'modified': '2022-07-28T23:22:19Z'}
review:
Overall, the app is easy, intuitive, designed well, and I love the idea of women making the first move. However, I have some suggestions.

1) PLEASE add options for ethical non-monogamy. OkCupid has this in spades and I see where some people have wasted their time on a match that doesn‚Äôt actually match with them. It‚Äôs simply because the question was never asked and it takes up real estate in the limited profile space.

2) The profile is very limiting. There‚Äôs something to be said for ‚Äúless is more‚Äù, but when all you get is three pictures and two sentences, it‚Äôs just not much to go off of. We only get to list five interests? I have DOZENS. I understand not wanting things to get too cluttered, but please give me more room to work with.

3) I would love an option to rate profiles, especially when I‚Äôm swiping left. I don‚Äôt need to be able to send more than one message. But sometimes I wanna say, ‚ÄúHey, I‚Äôm swiping left because I don‚Äôt meet your boundaries, but thank you for being so honest and clear about those boundaries. I wish you luck.‚Äù Or sometimes, ‚ÄúHey, I like you, but I‚Äôm swiping left because your profile is super unclear and I couldn‚Äôt tell anything about your interests or your boundaries. Just a tip.‚Äù
title: Good app, needs improvements

review: In an electronic age as much as I despise technology I can respect the value of finding your person whom we may not bump into at the grocery store. I also appreciate the feature of hiding people you simply do not want to pop up again in swipes as well as the opportunity to report unacceptable behavior! Bumble listens! title: Incognito mode flaw?

review: Absolutely abhorrent customer service. The app had some glitch where it wouldn‚Äôt let me cancel the daily subscription. Emailed ‚Äúcustomer service ‚Äú repeatedly until some mouthy rep finally responded and said they‚Äôd sent multiple responses and suggested I check my spam folder. Um‚Ä¶ no. It might be your first day on the internet but it‚Äôs not mine. That experience paired with an earlier billing issue means I won‚Äôt return to this app. The app itself is okay. As others have noted, a 24 hour match window is too short but the overall idea of women messaging first, is good. Also, one of the weirdest things about this platform is that the pricing is different depending on whether you‚Äôre on the app or on desktop, which makes zero sense to me. Also, a 300 character limit for a profile to try and describe yourself, is absurd. Overall, with my experience with them ending up with disputing their charges through my bank, I cannot recommend this app.
title: Beware their billing

developerResponse: {'id': 25998778, 'body': "Hi there. Thank you so much for raising this to us. We are always looking for ways to improve our users' experience on the app so we'll definitely pass your input along to our Product Team.", 'modified': '2021-11-01T03:51:44Z'}
review: Dating apps; Yes it‚Äôs easy to cast a wide net for some but for others It helps soothe the initial sense of inadequacy for many people. (Maybe we can include a filter to help identify narcissists and sociopaths). So yes, many people that struggle with mental illness prefer dating apps most of the time. I understand why others would want a mental health filter but I personally am not going to sign a HIPPA release just because someone thinks they have the right to know privileged information.  Now put me on a compare chart like I‚Äôm a credit card. If I had the best apr, cash back bonuses and miles‚Ä¶‚Ä¶ I wouldn‚Äôt be on a dating app. Don't be lazy. Just tell people that you aren‚Äôt prepared to support someone that isn‚Äôt at least high functioning in their mental health struggle. That is what you are saying, you just don‚Äôt want people to think poorly of you for saying so.
title: re: mental health filter.

developerResponse: {'id': 24091169, 'body': "Hi there! We appreciate you sharing your feedback with us. We are always looking for ways to improve our users' experience on the app so we will make sure to pass your input along to our Product Team. If you have other suggestions or need help, please message our Support Team on Twitter or Facebook (@BumbleSupport) and we'd be happy to assist you.", 'modified': '2021-07-23T11:43:12Z'}
review: The app is a great way of meeting others although there should be a more refined way to get choices. I also think there should be an option whether or not the women wants to initiate the conversation. If someone matches with 20 or more people having to do most of the work gets frustrating.  The notifications don‚Äôt come through half the time and unless I open the app I wouldn‚Äôt know if I had a message or not. Also my mileage is set to 35 miles and I keep getting people that live in a city that is 200 miles away. There should be an option not to see someone who is on travel mode unless that is wanted bc why would someone want that unless they are aware. There are major bugs that need to be fixed to allow real connections. I think adding a stats icon for how many people each profile has either liked or disliked is important as well!
title: Needs improvement

developerResponse: {'id': 22333961, 'body': 'Hi there, our team would love the opportunity to improve your experience in the Hive! Please message our Support Team on Twitter or Facebook (@bumblesupport).', 'modified': '2021-04-19T18:17:54Z'}
review: As a woman on this app, I just can‚Äôt shake the unnatural feeling I have being the first to make the ‚Äúmove‚Äù on a man. Would I do this in any other situation in life? No. I pay for my subscription because I want to see who swiped on me. The problem I seem to run into is a plethora of men in my ‚ÄúBeeline‚Äù of whom might just be furiously swiping right - they may not being paying and are simply playing hit or miss. It‚Äôs a real shoot down when I as the woman take my time to compose a thoughtful message to a man who I‚Äôm thinking swiped on me only to be left hanging - they don‚Äôt respond to my message....this is where my feminine energy is depleted and confused. Unless you were/are an aggressive woman in the world of dating and you like to be the risk taker in the realms of dating as a woman; this app may not be for you my lady friends. Im thinking I need to join a dating app where men are the pursuers. Positive comment on this app: ease of use.
title: Something is off

developerResponse: {'id': 5176102, 'body': "Hello! Bumble is a free app ‚Äì you are able to slide, match, & message other users, free of charge! Bumble Boost is a paid feature that users can opt into, but it's never required! Many of our bees make successful connections on Bumble without paying for additional features.", 'modified': '2018-09-22T20:29:04Z'}
review:
The app has the basic concept down pat, swiping through singles in your area, and upswipe for a nominal fee. The people I meet seem to be tailored closer to my personal type of woman that I prefer to talk to, but the cash-grap probability of the app is just too high for me. I almost feel obligated to pay for the Bumble+(or whatever it‚Äôs called) if I even want to match with people. For instance, 4 people already like me(the app claims) but I cannot see those people even after swiping through each of the profiles and get a ‚ÄúLooks like you‚Äôre out of people‚Äù. Whether this is poor software design or an aspect of a cash-grabbing app, it‚Äôs poorly done IMO.

If the app could give detail on why I‚Äôm not seeing people that liked me, or at least explain why I can‚Äôt see them or vice-versa I would keep going, but until then it‚Äôs almost a complete waste of time.
title: Good basic concept - fair to poor execution

developerResponse: {'id': 24662239, 'body': "Hi there! We appreciate you sharing your feedback with us. We are always looking for ways to improve our users' experience on the app so we will make sure to pass your input along to our Product Team.", 'modified': '2021-08-23T09:47:21Z'}
review: As a man who wears his heart on his sleeve, it‚Äôs way easier to allow a woman to make the first move. The filters are helpful to streamline things, I wish I could search for keywords on their bio though so I spend less hours reading profiles. Eg: cat, dog, god; these are all things that can be dealbreakers if they are not instrumental to a person‚Äôs life, conversely, if one is allergic to animals, a filter against said animal or blacklist words when swiping would make the app 10x better. Make it a premium feature and everyone wins. I‚Äôve found myself using almost an unhealthy amount of time reading bios for people before deciding if they are a match for me, tweak this and I‚Äôm 100% sure my lifetime membership will pay for itself. üòÑ
title: Great concept

developerResponse: {'id': 34147450, 'body': "Hi Frequensea. We're sorry you didn't enjoy your experience on Bumble. Our team would love the opportunity to improve your experience in the Hive! Please message our Support Team on Twitter or Facebook (@BumbleSupport) and we'd be happy to help.", 'modified': '2023-01-07T21:41:01Z'}
review:
Over the past week I have gotten and reported NUMEROUS amounts of MEN when my filters CLEARLY state I am searching for females!

What the app does when you don‚Äôt pay for the service is only allow you to see a certain number of users each day/week to encourage you to pay for the service to find matches. 

Since I am using it as a free service I don‚Äôt go swipe crazy because I know that the females have to message first and I can‚Äôt keep 20 conversations going so it‚Äôs actually kind of nice to only scroll on it for a few people a day to see if there is mutual connection. 

However what I‚Äôm NOT ok with is when I put my preference as MALE SEARCHING FEMALE. I get multiple men in my feed and it wastes my swipes for the day (usually 3-5).

I‚Äôm legitimately using the app to search for someone and not some booty call and I have reported 5 accounts this week alone. I told them in my last report that I would delete my account and leave a negative review if another MAN shows up in my list.

BYE! There‚Äôs fake accounts everywhere that ‚Äúlike‚Äù you and you NEVER find them because they want you to pay for the service. 

I‚Äôm in Okinawa Japan where it‚Äôs literally a 65 mile Long Island yet i run out of searches each day using make KM radius. 

This app is a scam and it‚Äôs unfortunate that they do this to people who are genuinely looking for a future partner.
title: No longer a straight male app!

review:
Even though the app says it has a free tier, free accounts (at least on the guy side) are pretty much pay-to-match. Was on bumble for about 3 months, and the only people that I matched with either let the match expire or were people I swiped the wrong way on. Not to mention that they have very few features in the paid version when compared with pretty much any other competitor. Bumble‚Äôs competition has better features regardless of whether you‚Äôre a free or paying user. I‚Äôve seen much better results on Tinder and Hinge with pretty much identical profiles to what I put on Bumble.

TLDR: The best way to use Bumble is to do research on other dating apps and use the best of those instead. Men need not apply.
title: Skip for guys

developerResponse: {'id': 11313951, 'body': 'We really appreciate you taking the time to share your experience, and would love to take a closer look at this with you. Please contact our Support Team at feedback@team.bumble.com, or on Facebook or Twitter (@bumblesupport) so we can help troubleshoot and improve your experience! We hope to hear from you soon.', 'modified': '2019-10-17T19:45:26Z'}
review:
Bumble recently made a change in which your list of people who have swiped on you is no longer in chronological order. Instead they use some algorithm to order the list to put the ‚Äúmost compatible‚Äù on top.  In other words, someone who swipes on you today my be buried at the end of the list while someone who swiped a month ago is on top. Additionally, the order changes every time you look, making it impossible to see who is most recent, thus most likely to write back.

Bumble team- either reverse this awful change or better yet have a ‚Äúorganize by‚Äù button with date/distance/compatibility as options.

This latest change has seriously degraded the user experience.  I‚Äôve seen other bugs lately too, such as matches showing up days or weeks after the fact. For example: you live in LA. You visit Phoenix. A week later, back in LA, random Phoenix matches are popping up in your list.
title: Awful update!

review: Had this app for virtually a year. I think maybe even longer. I‚Äôm starting to suspect that this app just doesn‚Äôt function right reading other reviews. Also seeing a lot of ladies here saying the guys are lazy stuff like that. I don‚Äôt think that‚Äôs the case. I think we‚Äôre in the same boat. I‚Äôm not bad looking or anything. Was looking for something sincere and mature not to waste my time. I don‚Äôt hold a standard that I can‚Äôt uphold myself. That being said, out of frustration I would use this daily and go through hundreds of profiles a day.  Several thousand in total. After 18 months I finally got one with a message. We talked for a bit and it was going well. A day later *poof* her account doesn‚Äôt exist suddenly. I don‚Äôt recommend this app, it‚Äôll really mess with your self esteem if you‚Äôre a guy just like any other dating app where the ladies get dozens or hundreds of ‚Äúmatches‚Äù and messages every day while you‚Äôre lucky to get 2 in a year. You‚Äôre just another dude in line. Nothing special.
title: Unreliable

developerResponse: {'id': 8304198, 'body': "Hi there! Thanks for your feedback. We are currently working on a new feature that will help with this problem that users are experiencing who live by airports. We hope to see you back in the Hive again in the future! Feel free to DM us on Facebook or Twitter (@bumblesupport) if there's anything else we can do to improve your experience!", 'modified': '2019-04-21T23:34:53Z'}
review:
The app is good - does what it‚Äôs suppose to, but a major flaw in the location services!! 
1. It tracks you as you move around the city, country or wherever! Im female and have had a couple of stalking problems.... guys who i had communicated with by phone checking where I was in town and waiting in their cars somewhere close in hopes of meeting - scary!!!
2. App matches you with anyone who is close in your geographic area, NOT in everyone‚Äôs home location. So, I live within 15 miles of LAX.... app matches me with EVERY GUY of a certain age range that comes through Los Angeles airport and uses the app - enormously time consuming and completely useless!! If a guy even has a connecting flight in LA we get matched and then you end up have to message back and forth just to find out that you don‚Äôt even live in the same state! So annoying, won‚Äôt be renewing my subscription.
title: Location Services Major Flaw

review:
When asked about all the fake profiles (including verified), Bumble support told me to just report them, and insinuated that it is our responsibility to maintain the authenticity of the users, all while ignoring the other actual complaints I brought to them.

So hold on‚Ä¶ we have to pay to do YOUR job for you? Where has our money been going if you‚Äôre letting anyone on, let alone having the nerve of having a ‚Äúverified feature‚Äù? Everyone should be verified and locked to a device/phone number. The fact that even these verified profiles can be faked shows that you don‚Äôt care, or just want the money. Don‚Äôt tell me to ‚Äújust report the profile‚Äù. I have reported several hundred profiles. Know why I stopped? I‚Äôm not just wasting money, I‚Äôm wasting more of my time on a company that cares more about the number of ‚Äúusers‚Äù it has than creating meaningful user experiences. Congratulations on becoming Tinder 2.0.
title: Pay Bumble to do their job for them

developerResponse: {'id': 30109295, 'body': 'Thanks for updating your review.\nWe always appreciate feedback from our users.', 'modified': '2022-06-02T01:47:35Z'}
review:
...may as well put the final nail in bumbles coffin then. I had mostly enjoyed dating on Bumble over the past few years. However, it was already the least used of the major dating apps meaning you got higher quality but fewer dates than hinge or tinder. But now, when you can only like a few people every 24 hours unless you pay, people are going to get even fewer dates if any at all, ...so, they are going to shed users like mad ...making it far less interesting to pay...leading to a downward cycle out of the market. Not smart. Bummer as it was a good concept.

Update:  Bumbles response below is a lie - you get about 10-20 swipes for free which makes Bumble useless in any town above 2000 people; i.e. you have to pay.  This lie/corporate buttsaving response makes me wonder what happened since the days of this company's awesome response to tinder
title: you now HAVE to pay to make it worthwhile

We would never arbitrarily block someone from our platform. If you would like our team to review your case, message @BumbleSupport on Twitter or Facebook.', 'modified': '2022-04-06T01:47:23Z'}
review: I‚Äôve been using the app for several years. On this account specifically, over a year. I‚Äôve really had no complaints until now. The other morning I woke up to find myself blocked from the app. I used my phone to log in, so I never received an email, never a text or warning screen or anything, that I was blocked. I had to find out from screen recording my screen to just barely catch a red box of text that says ‚Äú..een blocked‚Äù. I got a better view eventually that said ‚Äúyou have been blocked.‚Äù Nice. Turns out I had a subscription renewal coming up, and guess what? Yup, it renewed. For an account that‚Äôs blocked, they still take your money though! Blocked for no reason, I‚Äôve never broken a guideline or done anything wrong on the app. I don‚Äôt advertise a snap or Instagram, my pictures are of just me, and I‚Äôm respectful to my matches. Not recommending at this moment until this is resolved.
title: Banned for no reason, still took my membership $$
