review: üòÅSo I was always tired of using bunch of apps like tinder, meet meüòî there was guys always looking for a hook upüòí But I had other plans at first I was like that in a second I just felt like I wanted to find someone you knowü•∫ but when I use the bumble I was kind of skeptical because I was like you know what bumble is gonna be the same thing like the other ones but to be honest it‚Äôs actually notü§î I actually found my boyfriend who I‚Äôve been dating for two years ever since I met him on bumbleü•∞ I truly recommend it to anybody who is just trying to find someone special because I just found out a couple of days ago his manager met his girlfriend on bumble so like that gotta mean something rightttt!!!
title: Found it!!!

review: Bumble might just me the most hypocritical dating, relationship, and business app there is, while I was using the business networking part of the app, I was reported for trying to grow my business, just simply connecting with people asking if they had any interest in the field of working my business deals with, which is foreign exchange, did not try to sell them anything on my page until they had interest where I would then get their phone number to get in contact. My account was blocked, bumble did not tell me why after I repeatedly asked for a reason for the block, my theory is because I was network marketing which is what there business is for, but they are allowed to try to sell you an additions to their app with every tap of a button. Constantly teasing you to get more upgrades. Much better apps out there for marketing and dating, don‚Äôt suggest this one, this is just my opinion with the app tho, you may not have to same experience, hope you don‚Äôt.
title: DONT GET BUMBLE

review: I‚Äôve been on and off Bumble for about 2 1/2 years. And all I‚Äôve gotten out of it is literally nothing but wasted time and money. Yes I was stupid enough to buy the premium. For one, they give the girls an advantage over the guys and what that honestly does it make it more difficult for us men to find that special someone. Second there is NO ONE on here. Throughout my time of being on this app, I‚Äôve gotten maybe 5 likes in 2 1/2 years! Which is honestly shocking, three of which were bots. And if you‚Äôre wondering, no I‚Äôm not ugly. I‚Äôve had girls come up to me before in real life so I can‚Äôt be that bad. As I mentioned before, giving the girls the upper hand makes it more difficult for us men to find a match. Another flaw I noticed is you can only upload 6 pictures in total, which makes it easier for catfishes to use the app and scam people. Over all a very poorly executed app and design. So with all that said, stay away from bumble! It‚Äôs not worth it!
title: One of the worst dating apps I‚Äôve used!

review:
I do like the Bumble app - it‚Äôs design and ease of use is top line. HOWEVER... one of the main features of the site is so incredibly aggravating and antithetical to Bumble‚Äôs stated purpose that I just can‚Äôt anymore. 

I listened to a podcast where the Bumble founder, Whitney, talked about designing the app for women to make the first move - fantastic! I‚Äôm a woman with a successful career and busy life and don‚Äôt have the time to navigate poorly designed apps and crappy matches. 

And so when the rare unicorn of a gent with an inspiring profile shows up and I swipe right, only to have my excitement go through the roof when I discover he too swiped right and it‚Äôs a match! Oh happy day! But, then for that empowered female to then be dependent on waiting for a gent to write a message within 24 hours or the match disappears?!? Come on Bumble! There are plenty of days when I‚Äôm too busy to pick up my device and check Bumble, and I‚Äôd imagine the same is true for most people on the site. So to make a match disappear just because the 24 hour timer went off is INSANE and frustrating. IT‚ÄôS A MATCH after all! 

What‚Äôs the real purpose of this - advertising? Furthering the epidemic of online addictions? Keeping users coming back hoping the disappeared match resurfaces? Seriously, please reconsider this feature and let love have allllll the possibility, and time, it needs. Get rid of the 24 hour timeline.
title: Bumble - not actually about empowering women

developerResponse: {'id': 8159795, 'body': "Thank you for sharing your feedback with us. We hate to hear that you've had such a negative experience in the Hive. Helping our users form connections is what it's all about for us. We'd love to try to improve your experience. Please contact our team at feedback@team.bumble.com, or DM us on Facebook or Twitter.", 'modified': '2019-04-11T00:13:21Z'}
review:
Statistical studies of dating apps find that 80% of right swipes by women are for the top 20% of men. Bumble assigns you an artificially high ELO rating so that you get some right swipes when you first download the app. Over time your ranking drops until you don‚Äôt get any connections anymore (unless you are in the top 20% of men that women who use this app are actually interested in talking to).

I bought the premium Bumble for 6 months and have stopped receiving any right swipes from women over the last two months. My ELO rating has dropped to the point where I could have deleted the app, which resets my ELO and makes my profile visible again, if I hadn‚Äôt gotten the premium service.

Don‚Äôt use Bumble unless you are already extremely popular with the ladies IRL and want to expand your harem. The science shows that Bumble doesn‚Äôt work for the average man and will deflate your self esteem.
title: Read up on ‚ÄúGini coefficient‚Äù of dating apps before using the paid service

developerResponse: {'id': 7141131, 'body': "Hi there! We're sorry this happened. Please message our Support Team on Facebook or Twitter (@bumblesupport), or at feedback@team.bumble.com so we can help! We look forward to hearing from you!", 'modified': '2019-02-04T06:38:39Z'}
review: I saw this app being used on riverdale so I decided to give it a try (also because I‚Äôve been single for 4 years) anyways, it‚Äôs the basic fill in your info and write some stuff about yourself. I like the fact that you can connect it to your instagram and Facebook. I also like the whole verified thing so you know you‚Äôre talking to the same person you see in the pictures. What I hated though was that you couldn‚Äôt see who ‚Äúliked‚Äù you unless you subscribe and I scrolled down and clicked what I thought was cancel but it was continue and I accidentally bought a $79 a month subscription with bumble JUST TO SEE WHO LIKE ME -_- of course I ran to iTunes on my settings and canceled it but I had already taken the money out of my card and when I contacted customer service they told me their terms and services says no refunds üôÉ I only gave them 2 stars because the app is simple and easy to use otherwise they‚Äôd get 1
title: Bad experience

developerResponse: {'id': 4126058, 'body': "Hello there! Thank you so much for your feedback. Your input is valuable to us and helps drive the innovation of Bumble. We will definitely pass along your feedback to our product team to consider for future updates. If there's anything our Support Team can do to improve your experience at Bumble, please message us on Facebook or Twitter!", 'modified': '2018-07-06T18:44:45Z'}
review:
It takes a lot for me to write a review, but there is so much wrong with Bumble I don‚Äôt know where to begin. I live in a major city that is inundated with guys just passing through for the weekend for some drunken rowdiness with their friends. Why would anyone ever create an app that matches people based on their physical location at even given point in time? I did not sign up for one-night stands with random strangers, nor do I want to waste time chatting with great guys only to find out they don‚Äôt live here. If this is supposed to be a hookup app, just call a spade a spade and advertise it that way. 

Second, I‚Äôm a paying member and yet there are NO options to sort by education level, height, ethnicity, religion, attractiveness, etc. So I‚Äôm basically forced to wade through men I would never be interested in to hopefully find a diamond in the rough. 

Third, what is up with the 24-hour limits on messaging back? This incentivizes people to spend way more time than they‚Äôd otherwise like on the app just to avoid missing a potentially promising match. Do you not realize lots of your customers are professionals who don‚Äôt have that kind of time to dedicate? 

Finally, I second all the other users that have complained about the green circles appearing and then disappearing. Pretty sure this is just a ploy to keep people using the app, not a technical glitch. Super bummed that I wasted the money on this one.
title: Sick of matching with vacationers

Bumble had me living out a telenovela! ‚ù§Ô∏è 
We both swiped right and the rest was history. I got to message him first on the app, which was super cool. We decided to meet up for what we thought was just a casual hang out! Long story short- I ended up pregnant! üòÇ We decided to keep talking about how to work through things and found out we had been living in the same neighborhood our entire lives. Even had gone to the same martial arts studio and had probably bumped into each other at our work places. Going through parenthood and realizing how fate (and Bumble) brought us together helped us fall in love. We now are raising one beautiful son together and couldn‚Äôt be happier. Thanks Bumble!!! üêùüíõ
title: Met the love of my life on Bumble!

developerResponse: {'id': 25617378, 'body': "On Bumble we empower women to make the first move in their relationships to shift old-fashioned power dynamics and encourage equality from the start. If you have any other suggestions feel free to contact our team at bumble.com/contact.", 'modified': '2021-10-11T14:45:08Z'}
review: This app is decent. The most annoying thing is that guys cannot message girls first on the dating setting. That is super annoying because statistically, guys make the first move. And what‚Äôs worse is that the app doesn‚Äôt tell the girls that they have to make the first move so they don‚Äôt even know that they have to. So you can match with so many people but nothing happens because the girls don‚Äôt message first and you‚Äôre stuck. This setting is sexist if I‚Äôm being honest. 9 times out of 10, guys make the first move when it comes to flirting. So the fact that as a guy you can‚Äôt message first is really annoying. You end up losing the match for good after 24 hours so what‚Äôs the point. Most of the girls profiles that I see all say for the guys to message first! Bumble needs to fix that because it doesn‚Äôt benefit anyone.
title: Sexist!

review: For a company that runs on empowerment of women they show it in an idiotic way. For starters, this app started off as a fun way to meet new people but they do an awful job at replying back to commentary on the lack of background checks, feedback on certain men on the app, and they also changed a lot in their app which calls forth having to pay to unlock certain features. They have features to report but never get back to you, there is also the ability to remove the people who are weird but again it would be great and helpful if those who worked in the company came up with a strategy to get rid of the creeps. I also don‚Äôt condone supporting apps who don‚Äôt speak about crimes done to women from meeting on their apps. I feel like there‚Äôs a lot of corruption not only in the app but with the ones who oversee it as well. Just a heads up and be safe when being on dating apps that lack security :-)
title: lack of security/ support

developerResponse: {'id': 24598618, 'body': "Hi there! Bumble is a platform rooted in kindness and respect and any rude or inappropriate behavior is not welcome on our platform. If you ever encounter this, please report the user in-app or reach out to our Support team at bumble.com/contact. We've got your back. üíõ", 'modified': '2021-08-19T11:00:37Z'}
review:
I don‚Äôt really have a complaint with the app other than there needs to be a filter that gauges mental stability/readiness. The people I have met on here are on another level of pretentiousness coupled with some hardcore ‚Äúwokeness‚Äù. That or just straight up in need on counseling and a dating app shouldn‚Äôt be it. 

Have talked with 20 or so women on here and couldn‚Äôt say 90% of them are mental stable human beings. No normal person would sent you a 2-3 paragraph text telling you how complementing them is wrong and they didn‚Äôt ask for it. Am I just out of touch or is calling someone cute you matched with on a dating app and have been chatting with for hours offensive now? 

I‚Äôve met more functioning people on Tinder whom I can at least consider friends. In my experience, if you are looking for a meaningful connection look elsewhere :/
title: Solid app, horrible people

developerResponse: {'id': 22333986, 'body': "Hi there, we're sorry to hear you haven't had the best experience on Bumble. Please message us at support@team.bumble.com so we can look in to this for you :)", 'modified': '2021-04-19T18:19:30Z'}
review:
You don‚Äôt get much for what you pay for. I have better luck meeting people in pretty much every other dating app, or in person. I‚Äôve used thousands of apps on iOS since it‚Äôs inception and I can honestly say this is the worst value of any app I‚Äôve used from the App Store. I‚Äôm not just saying this because I can‚Äôt ‚Äòget a date‚Äô, I‚Äôm happily talking to multiple people outside of this app. It‚Äôs just a terrible value all around in my opinion.

You will constantly see matches in your ‚ÄòBee line‚Äô, which is supposed to show you people who have liked you before you have swiped left on them. The problem is people just swipe left on everyone and by the time you look at the ‚Äòbee line‚Äô they have already deleted you from their queue. This was a feature that convinced me to try premium and it‚Äôs completely useless as such.

The app is constantly pushing you to use its premium features,  and things like ‚Äòsuper swipes‚Äô are too easy to accidentally engage with no way of reversing it. I found myself using up premium things like ‚Äòboost‚Äô and ‚Äòsuper swipes‚Äô by accident and no way to restore or undo it. Support from the company is severely lacking considering the premium cost is a whopping $32 a month.

The app renewed yesterday and even though it charged me another $32, I‚Äôll be removing it. It‚Äôs just not good for me. Perhaps you‚Äôll have better luck with it.
title: Feel ripped off

developerResponse: {'id': 13971083, 'body': 'Thank you so much for your feedback. We really appreciate it and will definitely pass this along to our Product Team. We know users are busy, which is why we offer Bumble Boost. With Bumble Boost, you can extend expiring connections and rematch with expired connections. Users also get one free daily extend per day!', 'modified': '2020-03-10T19:39:02Z'}
review:
Life doesn‚Äôt always happen on a strict schedule, so how can something as organic as love? I made a match, we needed extra time to work through some communication issues, and it timed out on our connection, even after we had been messaging for a long time. The program said we could ‚Äúmatch again‚Äù but our conversation was completely wiped off the record, I can‚Äôt even look back to see where we left things, or if I made a terrible autocorrect typo that they may have misconstrued, and our shot together is ruined.  There‚Äôs no way to know! What if this app is just further alienating people by not giving them a chance to correct a misunderstanding or miscommunication?

Or are you saying that only wealthy people (who can afford to pay for the option to fix mistakes, like running out of time) deserve a second chance? 

This is only the most recent problem caused by this app.
title: Time limits too restrictive, and rules too convoluted

review:
I‚Äôve only used Bumble and Tinder, but I prefer Bumble. It seems like on Tinder you match with 100+ women, but a 25% are fake profiles, and 74% won‚Äôt actually respond when you try to start a conversation with them. Where‚Äôs as with Bumble, you may match with a 10 women, talk to 5 women and actually meet one or two for a date.
     I also think it‚Äôs kinda funny, because on Tinder women will write in their profiles ‚ÄúDon‚Äôt just say ‚ÄòHi‚Äô or ‚ÄòHey‚Äô, I won‚Äôt respond.‚Äù But then on Bumble women will say ‚ÄòHi‚Äô and ‚ÄòHey‚Äô when you match. All that aside I do do prefer Bumble because when a women actually shows enough interest to message you first it actually results in a real conversations.
      I can say I‚Äôve had far far more matches on Tinder, but more first and second Dates on Bumble. The last two women I dated for 6+ months were through Bumble.
title: I like it.

developerResponse: {'id': 30058166, 'body': 'Thanks for updating your review.\nWe always appreciate feedback from our users.', 'modified': '2022-05-30T17:44:14Z'}
review: I get plenty of matches, but I‚Äôm picky and haven‚Äôt found a good fit yet. The swiping takes time I don‚Äôt always have and I was drawn in when Bumble kept saying I had over 50 people in my beeline ‚Äî a shortcut. I bought into the marketing, and paid for 1 month of premium to see my beeline. Literally EVERY person in my beeline was from OUTSIDE MY FILTER SETTINGS, often more than 500 miles from where I live. I wrote within the first hour of paying and they refused to reimburse me. I paid $32 to learn that they fill your beeline with people you‚Äôd never date just to entice you to pay for premium. ***update: the developer response below doesn‚Äôt even make sense relative to my review. I wrote that I paid and they‚Äôre refusing to reimburse despite dishonest marketing tactics, and the response is about a way to pay more and see features that change nothing about what I wrote. Smh. Deflection just makes you appear more deceptive Bumble.
title: Beeline is a SCAM ‚Äî do not buy!

developerResponse: {'id': 29438147, 'body': "We appreciate you sharing your feedback with us, erinh31. We are always looking for ways to improve our users' experience on the app so we will make sure to pass your input along to our Product Team. Should you need further assistance, please message us at bumble.com/contact and we'll be happy to help.", 'modified': '2022-04-28T00:10:15Z'}
review:
The good: the interface is user-friendly and looks nice. Prompts are fine, not great.

The bad: my profile identifies me as a woman interested in women; but probably at least 1 in 10 profiles is a heterosexual couple **looking for a third!** which is really fetishy and uncomfortable. First of all, it seems bizarre that bumble isn‚Äôt regulating or tracking whether profiles belong to individuals or couples, and second, if they‚Äôre allowing couples to have profiles, then they should at least also give users the option to filter them out and only see individuals if they so choose.

The whole experience just feels icky to me because I‚Äôm looking for someone to date monogamously, and I don‚Äôt like thinking that these straight men are just reviewing my profile wondering if I‚Äôll be the one to help him fulfill his gross fantasy of a threesome with a lesbian who **maybe he can turn!**
title: Uncomfortable for queer women

developerResponse: {'id': 28331171, 'body': "We appreciate you sharing your feedback with us. We are always looking for ways to improve our users' experience on the app so we will make sure to pass your input along to our Product Team.", 'modified': '2022-03-02T10:45:40Z'}
review:
It greatly confuses me that bumble does not have a place to filter by or indicate my sexuality. Only being able to choose between men and women is crazy, considering the growing number of people coming out of the closet who are neither men nor women. It‚Äôs really frustrating that I can‚Äôt filter by sexuality, I have to choose between seeing men, women, or everybody. I don‚Äôt want to see men I want to see everyone else who isn‚Äôt straight. Insane to have a dating app that doesn‚Äôt let you put your sexuality in the year 2022 like what.

Also the app really needs to include options for people to indicate that they are ethically non-monogamous or a couple looking for a third because that is half of the people I see on the app when my preferences are set to be interested in women. Also, some men are listed as women, so there are straight men that pop up on my feed. Again, this is why there should be a sexuality feature.
title: It‚Äôs 2022 and still no sexuality feature??

developerResponse: {'id': 18947347, 'body': "This is amazing! We're so honored to be part of your story and we'd love if you could tell us more at bumble.com/success.", 'modified': '2020-11-06T16:58:30Z'}
review: I was using Bumble and other dating apps casually before meeting my now girlfriend. We matched and hit it off instantly. Can‚Äôt say I believed a dating app would ever lead me to a successful relationship before this experience. However, my now girlfriend and I probably never would have met another way if not for Bumble! No one in our circles of friends overlapped before we matched. Personally, I believe that Bumble is the most conducive dating app for finding an actual romantic connection because of the feature that requires women to message men first. In my experience, this leads to higher quality matches than other apps. If a woman messages a guy first then you know they must be at least slightly interested and more likely to continue a conversation!
title: Thanks Bumble!

developerResponse: {'id': 11063735, 'body': 'Hi! Our team moderates based solely on our Community Guidelines. We would never ban someone for any reason outside of those guidelines. We would be happy to personally review your account; you can contact our Support Team at feedback@team.bumble.com.', 'modified': '2019-10-04T20:48:57Z'}
review: Giving this a one star review. At first I enjoyed this app. I use a lot of dating apps. I am an attractive guy and have no issue getting dates. For some reason I could not longer log on to bumble and couldn‚Äôt figure out why. I emailed them to try and solve this issue. They responded back saying that after further review and after investigation they have decided to permanently ban. And they did so without giving any reason. It is completely BS. I have legit never been banned from anything in my life. Like i said I was going on many dates and treating people with the upmost respect. Every girl I went on a date with said they had a great time and enjoyed spending time with me. How in the world I got banned is beyond me. I literally did nothing wrong. Hopefully this review reaches someone and I can somehow get my account restored. In the mean time I‚Äôll spend my money on other dating apps, give them good reviews and recommend other dating apps to friends and family.
title: Banning people without cause or justification

developerResponse: {'id': 7988093, 'body': "Thank you for sharing your experience with us. No one deserves to be treated so terribly. Please contact our team at feedback@team.bumble.com, or DM us on Facebook or Twitter (@bumblesupport) and we can ensure this user is removed from our platform.", 'modified': '2019-03-31T19:50:42Z'}
review: Met my bf of 10 months on bumble and turns out he is a 40 year old man instead of a 31 year old as he had claimed on bumble. I thought I was dating someone 2 years younger than me. I believe this app connects to FB for age verification and that can be manipulated easily. I thought I had met a good man until I realized how big of a lie he had kept from me the entire ten months. Found out his real age through the hospital as he was a 40 yr old with an alcohol problem still partying in old town Scottsdale. Overall this app is more of a hook up app. Full of d bags. Just a heads up everyone, run a background check on anyone you meet online and especially bumble. We live and we learn, unfortunately my precious time was wasted because I trusted this app. Requesting bumble to use LinkedIn or another form to verify a simple thing like age. Unfortunately I will not be using this app again.
title: My bf was fraud

review: I'm not sure about all these negative reviews I'm seeing but here's a positive one for anyone who wants to see if it works. I met quite a few women on here at first I had no luck. But then I met my wonderful girlfriend and it was the easiest least stressful or awkward way possible. These other apps feel like your almost hopeless with this one the ice is broken immediately because if they message you they already like you somewhat according to your profile. You just proceed from there   And we genuinely connected on almost everything. So from me it's well worth it just have patience and more importantly be honest and sincere with your information so that the right one gets it. Thank you to the people at bumble I believe I've found the one.
title: Bumble is awesome !!

developerResponse: {'id': 5539225, 'body': "Hey there, thanks for your feedback! We'd love to look into why your photos were removed, this may have been a mistake. Please can you DM us on Facebook or Twitter so we can look into this?", 'modified': '2018-10-17T09:46:58Z'}
review:
Honestly, I‚Äôm not really a fan of this app, but there are less creeps on here than Tinder. First of all, I wish we had more room for text when writing our profiles. 

Secondly, I‚Äôve had photos taken down for being ‚Äúbathroom selfies.‚Äù They were taken in my dinning room and were tasteful, as you can get with a selfie. I put them on my profile to give people an idea of my figure, I‚Äôm petite with curves, so if you‚Äôre looking for a super skinny leggy model, keep swiping, I‚Äôm not your girl. 

Lastly, I can‚Äôt stand that only women can message men. I feel like I‚Äôm throwing myself at people who aren‚Äôt interested. 

I know Bumble is supposed to empower women, but having pictures taken down and making us beg for someone to talk to us does the opposite. Also, I had a photo taken down that Bumble thought was inappropriate, I was in a bodysuit, but never wanted the whole picture shown, just the top where it looked like a shirt. I thought I cropped it, but I guess you can‚Äôt crop on Bumble. It was taken down, but I feel like, as adult women we should be able to put anything we want on our profiles, as long as we‚Äôre covered. I felt like they put a red A on my chest that day. I think nude pics or pics of body parts should be monitored and users who do that should be kicked out. Background checks should be done for all users, I feel like that would make it safer and get rid of the criminals and creepy guys.
title: Disappointed

developerResponse: {'id': 34480857, 'body': "Thanks for reaching out, JojohnD. While our subscriptions are there to help maximize your experience, we can't promise exact results for anyone. If you‚Äôd like to talk to a Support Team Member about your profile to check everything is running as it should be, please message us here: bumble.com/contact.", 'modified': '2023-01-25T15:15:01Z'}
review: This app is no different than any other dating apps. I‚Äôve been on this app for nearly 4 months. I did get four females to like my profile but being a non-paying subscriber I could not see who they were unless payment was made. So I bit the bullet and paid for one week so I could see who liked my profile and maybe we could match. What a disappointment. Of the four likes three of the females were over 250 miles away and the fourth one was in another state. I live in a small town 35 miles away from a major metropolitan city and to get likes from so far away is just totally b. This is Bumble‚Äôs way of manipulating non-paying subscribers to pay. They will dictate who you match with. I‚Äôm know there are a few non-paying males that have matched but those are very, very few just so Bumble can good ratings. Don‚Äôt waste your money and time. Just go out physically and meet someone instead of wasting your time on dating apps.
title: Nope

developerResponse: {'id': 34136015, 'body': "We're sorry you didn't enjoy your experience on Bumble. review:
This app compared to other dating apps is one of those ones where it‚Äôs not that good but every now and then you might get a good lil match. I can go months without being on bumble and come back to barely any action. Although, yes results vary depending on looks and your profile but I have no problem on any other dating app, so I know it‚Äôs not me. Then when I finally get likes they never pop up on my feed so i‚Äôm stuck guessing who these potential matches are. (unless I pay)

Overall I wouldn‚Äôt recommend. On other apps I get way more likes, matches, and dates than when I use bumble. I feel like the main reason is they literally nerf everybody until you pay a crazy fee. I‚Äôve used this for 3 months and still never linked up with anybody from bumble meanwhile other apps it‚Äôs wayyy more likely.

With that being said I deleted my account, deleted the app and will just stick to the other apps.

developerResponse: {'id': 33296623, 'body': "We're so sorry you didn't enjoy your experience on Bumble. Our team would love the opportunity to improve your experience in the Hive! Please message our Support Team on Twitter or Facebook (@BumbleSupport) and we'd be happy to help.", 'modified': '2022-11-22T05:42:16Z'}
review: Honestly I‚Äôve tried all the dating apps and bumble is by far my least favorite. Not only do they have crap rules like the girl must message first and there‚Äôs a 24 hour time limit before your match expires and you have to pay money to get it back. Not only do they have stupid rules, but you then have to pay money (also the most expensive out of all the apps) just to have the regular features of the other dating apps. Their notification‚Äôs also come late and inconsistently. I‚Äôll get a notification that I suddenly have 3 messages sitting in my inbox and when I go to check it the messages will be from multiple days prior. They really try to screw you with their time limits and lack of notifications so that you are forced to pay to use the app. I really don‚Äôt get the point of this app and it‚Äôs unnecessary rules. Sticking to hinge and tinder.

review: I‚Äôve used this app on bff mode for a few years. Met some interesting people. I don‚Äôt sift through my messages or plan my next move on it. Will probably delete soon if this doesn‚Äôt change, as there‚Äôs no point trying to make friends if I can only waste my few swipes a day on accounts that aren‚Äôt even active. DM us on Facebook or Twitter @BumbleSupport to chat further!", 'modified': '2021-02-23T21:02:15Z'}
review: I am now in a relationship with someone I love and makes me so happy thanks to this app. But it took me awhile to get there. I liked being the one to initiate the conversation. It felt like I was in more control of the conversation and who I interacted with. The notifications are a little off. Sometimes I wouldn‚Äôt get alerts. You really have to work the system and get used to being ghosted and ending things with people you barely know. This app could be better if people didn‚Äôt lie in their profile or if certain features were free. A lot of unused profiles or people just wanting followers on other platforms. You might accidentally start something with a bunch of different people at once and you feel the pressure of who to pick. But if you‚Äôre patient and don‚Äôt mind getting your feelings hurt a ton, you might find what you‚Äôre looking for.
title: Successful with effort

review:
So, I first used Bumble about 3 years ago. I think it was during the first week, definitely the first 2 weeks, I ‚Äúbumbled‚Äù upon this amazing man. Messaged for 2 weeks. Went on a date. Kinda awk. But I decided to keep going on dates with him. I‚Äôm so beyond glad I did because 3 years later we are still going strong, moved to a new city, and have our first apartment together. He is definitely the love of my life! 
Now a few months ago I had sent Bumble our story, and they replied and thanked me. I thought nothing more of it! Surprise surprise, today I got home and had a package waiting. I had no idea what it was, so I went and got it. It was the MOST BEAUTIFUL bouquet of flowers! From Bumble! This company cares about you long after your connection made. Thank you Bumble ‚ù§Ô∏èüêù

review:
I did not use Bumble for dating, I used Bumble BFF to find new girl friends after moving to a new state. I think the idea is great and Bumble BFF has potential, but it‚Äôs not as easy to actually find people to talk to. I got hardly any matches which made me think that many accounts are inactive. I also realized that it‚Äôs way easier to approach men than women, even over the internet. Even if you make the first move, its  very hard to keep a conversation going and get past small talk. I found myself getting bored with it most of the time and many conversations just ended after a few times of messaging back and forth because either me or them stopped responding at some point. 
I think that it‚Äôs still easier to approach and meet friends IRL. I‚Äôm not saying you can‚Äôt make great friends using this app, but I‚Äôd say that chances are low.

review:
I love snap I‚Äôll probably always use it. It‚Äôs very convenient in my dating life because I feel like it‚Äôs easier to get to know the person and I don‚Äôt have to give my personal number.
However I have a suggestion. Bumble has made it where it automatically senses inappropriate pics. But men, and sometimes women, don‚Äôt like to stay on the app chatting too long. They ask for snap sometimes. I want to ask if there‚Äôs a way we can put in a switch in settings. So we can choose whether or not we want to accept those pics. review: Downloaded to use the BFF feature so I could befriend fellow likeminded women in my area. First two days went fine, but then the app wouldn‚Äôt allow me to further use it unless I, ‚Äòpicked a cause,‚Äô which was utterly annoying. I am not on Bumble to, ‚Äòmake first moves,‚Äô for controversial causes, I‚Äôm there to find friends because making friends as an adult is pitifully difficult. I hate that this app is exploits you just because you want to meet people in your area. I deleted my account and the app after I couldn‚Äôt find a way around the measly THREE feminist causes they demand you to pick from. If animal rights were listed, I would have chosen that. If a child protection foundation was listed, I would have chosen that. If a homeless awareness foundation, I would have chosen it. The fact that the only causes were feminist left a bad taste in my mouth; just like how feminists do. I won‚Äôt be forced to advocate for someone else‚Äôs bias agenda. Thanks, pip pip cheerio I‚Äôm out.
title: Scam

My wonderful boyfriend and I met this summer on Bumble and we are so happy together! I have tried a lot of other dating apps including Tinder, Hinge, Coffee Meets Bagel, and OK Cupid. review: This could be 5 stars without the bugs, but they are just too limiting, and they have been there long enough they should be fixed by now. There are a couple bugs in the like feed (beeline) which is the most useful part of the app. The newest one is it keeps jumping back to the top while I‚Äôm scrolling down so I can‚Äôt see all my matches, which is extremely annoying and makes it unusable. It‚Äôs a really dumb design if this is intentional. The other bug is I can‚Äôt undo a left swipe even though I am supposed to be able to with premium, which is extremely easy to do accidentally while scrolling. The video interface is a great idea but doesn‚Äôt work. I haven‚Äôt tried it in a while to be fair. Other than the poor execution, this has the best matches, filtering (in theory), and interface.

review: I‚Äôve been a user on bumble now for a while, one of things that this app sets apart from the others is for the ability to set specific filters (so you can see people that have similar interests and beliefs as your own). For the last 3 years or more you‚Äôve able to select up to two different ‚Äúadvanced filters‚Äù for no cost. However with the latest update now in order to get any ‚Äúadvanced filters‚Äù you either have to pay $20 every week or $40 every month. I understand Bumble like any other corporation wants to make a higher profit, but I think being able to get two ‚Äúadvanced filters‚Äù or even just one is reasonable. After this change it makes me no longer want to use this app anymore, if I‚Äôm gonna pay for a dating app I would rather pay for a higher quality app like Eharmony.

review:
Bumble used to be a decent app to get on if your a guy. But now it‚Äôs become super predatory on the consumer. Bumble used to allow what felt like 50 swipes a day and they‚Äôve reduced it to maybe 15 swipes before they say you‚Äôve hit the end of the line. They also had a really cool feature that tinder don‚Äôt even have which allowed you one back track which came in super handy if you mindlessly swipe and realize you wanted to learn more about someone. Like all good things they took that feature away and locked it behind a paywall. 
The apps intentions are in the right place but they have made it so disadvantageous for guys that it‚Äôs legit not worth. Simple economics, when a substitute good is both cheaper and a better quality then the demand for your good is going to decrease.  How this app remains open is a grim reality of how much this industry preys on lonely people, specifically lonely men on this app.
title: Subpar

review: The app seems harmless and trendy, but it‚Äôs a trap. They filter out your matches. Many of the options they present in the beginning are fake profiles to help the algorithm figure out your ‚Äútype‚Äù then the mix it up and send you completely opposite matches and throw a good one in there once in a while to keep you interested. Also not the safest app since they show your profile to even unmatched users. It‚Äôs like tagged and tinder repackaged, definitely not worth the premium price and they don‚Äôt offer refunds. Lots of fake profiles and unscreened matches. They don‚Äôt verify so you could end up dating someone who is married. title: It‚Äôs a trap

NO Confirmation screen, and apparently no fingerprint verification. Now, it just happened again‚Ä¶ I was being extremely careful and in fact tried to double-click the home button so I could close the app completely and thereby eliminate any chance of bumble grabbing my payment against my will.  But that‚Äôs not what happened‚Ä¶ Instead the INSTANT I touched the home button, bumble ‚Äúthanked‚Äù me for buying super swipes and charged my account. title: Be careful how you swipe. This app is crooked.

review:
I casually used Bumble Date for a few weeks.  All of a sudden I could no longer log in.  When I asked about it, Bumble told me they were permanently blocking my profile for being in violation of their guidelines, to which they provided a link.

I closely perused said guidelines and found myself to be FAR from violating ANY of them.  Most were about photograph content, and I wasn‚Äôt so much as wearing short pants in any of the images I had uploaded.  I inquired of Bumble which guidelines I had violated, and their response was that they did not discuss individual cases for purposes of privacy.  

What?  So you‚Äôll just block my account suddenly, permanently, and irrevocably, and not even hint as to why?  For an app that claims to be open-minded and forward-thinking, that is a dangerously unreceptive practice.  Bumble‚Äôs first E-Mail said (and I quote) ‚Äúour decision about your profile cannot be changed and no exceptions will be made.‚Äù  Their second said ‚Äúall complaints are investigated to their fullest extent, and all decisions are final.‚Äù  This is pretty toxic policy if an atmosphere of good feeling is what Bumble is trying to foster.

I certainly didn‚Äôt even use the app or interact directly with enough people thereupon to offend anyone, so I am truly flummoxed about why Bumble booted me.  I obviously cannot recommend an app (or any institution) that enacts arbitrary bans and censorship without warning, discussion, or explanation.
title: Zero Stars.

review:
It‚Äôs okay, it‚Äôs your typical dating app. I purchased for a month (boy was that a mistake)...
1. Price is steep, especially when you have other sites for a fraction the cost for the same amount of time... AND BETTER SPECIAL UPGRADES!
2. The upgrades you get for purchases aren‚Äôt really worth it... you get 5 ‚Äúsuper likes‚Äù for a whole month... 5... what?? I paid $30 for 5 and the ability to swipe unlimited for a month... nice (that‚Äôs on me for not doing my research)
3. (This is just a personal take) I feel like I got more matches without the purchase. Before I had purchased I regularly got 15/20+ matches a week everytime I started anew, but when I started anew and purchased, at this point I‚Äôve had 5 and it‚Äôs been past a week...(I understand it could just be a miss week) This leads to the next point and BIGGEST 
4. ALLOW ME TO RECOVER MY PURCHASE... the fact that I can‚Äôt delete my profile to start a new one and recover my purchase, in app, makes purchasing it the biggest mistake ever. (Ive read you have to reach out to Bumbles Twitter support to get it transferred over but that‚Äôs... obnoxious, just make an in-app option)

I wish the app the best honestly, I think there more quality people on here (and maybe that‚Äôs why the steeper price) but I wish and hope they fix and improve some of the other things.
title: It... needs a some improvement

review: I used this app for 3 days.  3 days is all it took for Bumble to stick its bleeding heart where it doesn‚Äôt belong!  I am an armed guard.  That‚Äôs how I pay my bills and feed myself.  I posted 6 pictures of myself, 1 of which, was of me training.  Bumble kept removing it and I couldn‚Äôt figure out why.  I disputed it and they sent me an email practically saying that I was to blame for the mass shootings that happen in America.  Their excuse is that ‚Äúwith mass shootings devastating our communities we don‚Äôt support any violence on our platform‚Äù.  Violence?  What violence?  Bumble is an anti American company that forces illogical and ignorant policies into subjects they obviously know absolutely nothing about.  Oh!  And then they said it‚Äôs for the safety of their members.  WHAT???  How is a picture of me aiming a handgun at a steel plate against a mountain side endangering their members?  And how is taking it down going to stop some but job from shooting up a school?  It‚Äôs not!  I‚Äôll never go back to bumble and I highly urge nobody creates an account!

Feel free to utilize our Report and Block button which directly alerts an investigating by our Moderation Team if you buzz by a suspicious account!", 'modified': '2018-12-27T17:08:41Z'}
review: Sites like Bumble, Tinder and Coffee meets Bagel are sites designed to scam singles into believing that the technology they use can help singles find a date or someone for a long term relationship. The truth is that the technology is designed to create robo matches with pictures stolen from the internet and fake profile information created which then can go out and like your profile, message you, reply to your messages. Then  after a brief encounter the robo match stops communicating with you. The objective is so that you get a feeling of potential connections and it also releases the site of any fraud claims by showing that there was activity between you and other would be members. The bottom line is don‚Äôt bother paying to use these apps, because at the end of the day you don‚Äôt know if the person you are communicating with on the other end is real or fake especially if you have no way to tell if they are in fact on-line or a computer generated profile.
title: Scam sites singles beware

review:
(26M, Miami) Although it is certainly not a perfect dating app, Bumble offers the best online platform and algorithm to match and meet someone locally. Whatever algorithm they use effectively pushes the best people to the front of the line, saving you time of needless swiping. The information section provides key insights on the person but not uncomfortably so (political leaning, what they are looking for, height, academic achievement, etc.) It also connects to Instagram but blocks a direct link to the site, helping prevent people from using Bumble to simply farm insta followers.
I would recommend using the premium version for guys. My first few weeks using it were worth the price: my matches increased tenfold. I‚Äôve met and had long relationships over the past few years of using bumble bad highly recommend it.
title: Best Dating App Available

These men on bumble have very low standards in my experience and expect you to be the same way. Most of them clearly have mental health issues and take it out on the woman by reporting our accounts as ‚Äúusing bumble to buy or sell‚Äù let me say I‚Äôve never asked these men to buy anything or for any money. I simply tell them my standards because they ask and say we should go to a nice dinner and some of them get very offended and start assuming things based on my standards if they can‚Äôt meet them and bumble doesn't double check the conversations for proof they will just delete you based off these mens lies. review: My biggest problem is they tell you there are "likes" that they blur out only after a full month of swiping it still never showed me these "likes". My other issues are the description section is WAY too small. Woman have to message first after you match and I find that many women don't login regularly cause they never send that first message. So what was the point? I could tell many women never read my profile as once I said I loved sports they lost interest when it's literally the first thing I talked about. I have tried many different dating apps. And this is only one I was never able to setup a single first date.  I think it proves that women don't like to be the ones to send the first message.

review: So the app itself is fine. I‚Äôve used it for free and both tiers of the paid membership. It‚Äôs nice to filter people out and see who likes you. That being said, of the few people I‚Äôve met here I‚Äôm either not interested in them at best or they were genuinely terrible people. People seem to say their seeking a relationship when they just want hook ups. Maybe they could have a review feature? Hinge asks if you meet up and if you‚Äôd see them again, I think bumble would benefit. Also maybe ask more questions about what people want? Like why they want a relationship? developerResponse: {'id': 19812180, 'body': 'Hi there, our team would love the opportunity to improve your experience in the Hive! Please message our Support Team on Twitter or Facebook (@bumblesupport).', 'modified': '2020-12-16T18:34:30Z'}
review:
Bumble is an alright dating app. They really want to push you to purchase the Beeline to the point where they suppress your matches to heavily incentivize you to spend money. Honestly, download Hinge if you‚Äôre looking for a serious relationship and Tinder if you‚Äôre looking for something more casual. Bumble has positioned themself where they are the loss leader in any category while flaunting around like their more sophisticated.

Also, apparently I‚Äôve had the app for a week or so and even though Bumble limits the amount of people you can swipe on, there is no one between the ages of 18-99 in a 99 mile radius so I‚Äôm forced to swipe across the entire country.  This seems extremely unlikely since there are people 10 miles away that appear in the country-wide search. This is yet another example of how Bumble manipulates the search algorithm to heavily incentivize spending money. Anything less than whole country and it says that I‚Äôve seen all the people nearby.
title: Predatory practices

developerResponse: {'id': 19498109, 'body': "Hi there, we appreciate you sharing your feedback with us. We are always looking for ways to improve our users' experience on the app so we will make sure to pass your input along to our Product Team.", 'modified': '2020-12-02T18:52:18Z'}
review:
Maybe this app used to be good, but these days it isn‚Äôt even worth trying. I‚Äôm a man who was looking for a ltr, and for that purpose bumble isn‚Äôt at all worth the time I spent on it. I can‚Äôt see who is interested in me (if we haven‚Äôt matched) without a premium subscription, and even if you do match the other person has at most 48 hours to respond. Plus I kept seeing people I‚Äôd already swiped left on in my rotation. Seems like every account is inactive enough that matching hardly matters.

In 4 weeks of using this thing for 20-30 mins/day, I got 4 matches, had 0 conversations, and went on 0 dates. With the same profile pics, bio, and time spent on Hinge, I‚Äôve matched with 10+ people, had 5 chats, and been on 2 dates so far. If you really want to meet people and go on dates, use something else.

Update: Bumble has offered to help me ‚Äúoptimizer‚Äù my account. Really helpful. I‚Äôm sure changing my profile will fix the fundamental flaws in how app operates.
title: Worthless

review: I appreciate the quality of the potential matches and the formatting used to describe each person. However, it‚Äôs extremely frustrating that matches are constantly disappearing. Most times I receive a notification that I have a new match but once I go to message them, the match is gone within minutes. The same has happened after I message someone. I‚Äôve been using this app for three months. Early on, I thought the disappearing matches were because the men were no longer interested. However, because this is happening so often and so quickly, I no longer think that‚Äôs the case. I also question the messaging portion. Most men do not respond to any communication. Of course that‚Äôs can be for various reasons but it‚Äôs becoming a consistent occurrence. As much as I appreciate the quality of Bumble, I‚Äôm no longer interested in using an app with these types of issues.
title: Disappearing Matches

review: I‚Äôve been using bumble for several years now and things have changed drastically. You used to be able to use whatever profile picture you wanted. Now they ‚Äúmoderate‚Äù your profile pictures to make sure your face is in it. Bad part is I got stuck with a picture that doesn‚Äôt even show my face and they wouldn‚Äôt let me change it. Also apparently everybody in their company is so sensitive that they can‚Äôt stand to let someone put a gun in their profile picture. Now that‚Äôs just ridiculous. That‚Äôs like saying it offends me if you‚Äôre hair isn‚Äôt a natural color so you should ban pictures of pink haired people. Lastly and most importantly they ripped me off $9. I bought the 1 week premium just to give it a shot. I used it for one day and i couldn‚Äôt decide if I liked it or not. When I tried to log back in the next day I find out that I‚Äôve been banned. This app is absolute trash and I would give it 0 stars if I could.

review:
I get push notifications that I have a match, but I don‚Äôt see them on the app. I see potential people - who have swiped right on me, but not the ones I also have swiped right on. And I see the expired matches - that I never got to see when active! AND to actually view both potential and expired you have to pay. 
I don‚Äôt like how matches expire in 24 hours either. When I swipe right on someone who has already swiped right on me, I send a message instantly. They only have 24 hours to respond or it disappears. A man doesn‚Äôt have the option to message a woman first, so when they‚Äôve swiped right on me (and I‚Äôve already swiped right on them), I have 24 hours to send a message, but I‚Äôm not even seeing them to do so! Ugh!
The 24 hour thing needs to change. And new matches need to be clearly visible. The app could use a little tweaking.
title: Where‚Äôs my match?

review: So, I just wanted to say that Bumble, by far, is the best dating platform out there. I found my person in August of 2021 and we are now engaged to be married in November 2023. review: I used to prefer Bumble to Tinder. Now I don‚Äôt for 3 reasons. First, the profiles are too detailed and messy now. Second, they send me annoying push notifications all the time (‚ÄúYou‚Äôre amazing! Just be you!‚Äù) to get me to swipe more. Third, they‚Äôve leaned too far into the dating police shtick. I was notified that a photo was taken down and it didn‚Äôt say specifically why but said that nudes, abusive photos, and mirror selfies get removed. My photo was none of those. It was a photo of me in a bodysuit at a party, which I posted specifically to communicate something about myself (i.e., I‚Äôm the type of person who goes to wild parties dressed in an animal print bodysuit and fishnets. If you‚Äôre not cool with wild parties or women who wear sexy silly costumes to them, we won‚Äôt get along so don‚Äôt swipe right on me). It‚Äôs very 1950s to take down a photo of a woman wearing a bodysuit. It‚Äôs not feminist at all and is actually quite oppressive. Deleting the app as soon as I post this. Tinder is way better.

developerResponse: {'id': 4612985, 'body': "We really appreciate your feedback! If there's anything else we can do to improve your Bumble experience, please don't hesitate to message us on Facebook (@bumbleapp) or Twitter (@bumble). We're always here to help.", 'modified': '2018-08-10T20:49:34Z'}
review:
The app serves it‚Äôs purpose, but the developers need to calibrate the distance radius with driving distances through GPS and maps, and not by how the crow flies. Living across large bodies of water tends to be an issue when setting distance. Someone 20 miles across a body of water will show up even though in reality it may take hours to get to that point, and driving can be 2 to 3 times that distance.

Another isssue, and I‚Äôm sure it‚Äôs so we don‚Äôt swipe through everyone in one day, but you have to manipulate your distance to get potential matches to show up who are actually in the radius you set. This may also just be an issue of individuals going from WiFi to LTE and having location services shut off when not in use. Either way there shouldn‚Äôt be a limiting algorithm to keep people from showing within your radius.
title: Distance Issues

developerResponse: {'id': 32754411, 'body': "We appreciate you sharing your feedback with us. We are always looking for ways to improve our users' experience on the app so we will make sure to pass your input along to our Product Team. üíõ", 'modified': '2022-10-24T14:08:36Z'}
review:
I understand the objection of any company is to make money. And I used to have some decent luck and enjoyed this app, I‚Äôve even purchased premium a time or two when it was more reasonably priced. 

But lately their Match Queue algorithm makes it impossible for you to match on people who have already swiped right on you. I‚Äôve been swiping for over a week now to try and match with the 2 women in my ‚ÄúBeeline‚Äù and will run out of my daily like limit before ever seeing their unblured photo show up. 

You used to have to swipe a bit to find your matches but It never used to be this bad. I‚Äôve done everything from expanding my filters, clearing cache, re-installing the app and reaching out to customer service. Was basically told, that‚Äôs just the way it is. Just makes me not want to use the app anymore to meet people. Really hope this gets fixed but I‚Äôm no holding my breath.
title: Greedy premium tactics

Totally agree with reviewers who say the app is good except men should be the ones to initiate conversation. The men on here are lazy and make endless conversation but rarely ask for my number. It goes against nature to make the first move to a guy. I hate tinder and like the feel of this app- I like the timed out matching. But please give women the choice to have the men initiate first.
‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî
In response : I know Bumble wants to challenge the gender norms but I think if it hurts women in their dating experiences, then challenging the norms is NOT pro- women, it‚Äôs actually against women. I am suggesting giving women the choice whether they wish to make the first move or not. Most women like many of the features but would prefer that men make the first move. If there was a way to screen for which men can contact (instead of saying hi first women can pre- approve the men you allow to say Hi) would be a nice alternative to Tinder and other free for all apps.

review: If I could give this app zero stars I would. I am educated as well as emotionally and professionally stable. I am a single woman looking for the same. From the moment I started using this app, I have encountered nothing but men who are no where near professionally stable or emotionally stable. Each date was worse than the last. My dates have consisted of an unmedicated bipolar patient with anxiety that ended up only going out with me because I looked like his ex and he unloaded all of his mental angst on me after the date. I‚Äôve had a date with another man who turned out to be an nearby hospital outpatient. My last date turned out to be a drunk who only wanted to talk about his aunt sleeping with his best friend. This has been the overall experience I‚Äôve had with this app for the past 9 months. Please adopt a better system so that people like me don‚Äôt end up becoming therapist for people who have no business dating in the first place considering their overall status.
title: Worst Outcomes

review: I downloaded bumble after deciding to get my feet wet after a long period of living and loving the single life. After a few days I ended up matching with a total dream boat: adventurous, funny, deep, and really cute. We were going to meet up to go scuba diving of all things. I was excited, but thought I should do a little digging beforehand and discovered he was married with a kid. So I contacted his wife. Turns out he was extremely emotionally and physically abusive to both her and their child. Her and I ended up having a nice talk and I pointed her in the direction of some resources. She‚Äôs now filing for divorce, got an order of protection, and found herself a therapist. Thanks Bumble for creating a platform where women can look out for and support other women.

Your location updates every time you open the app, but we will never display someone's exact location to ensure your safety and comfortability on our platform. Also, we appreciate your feedback about adding filters. We hope to have this type of feature in the near future!", 'modified': '2018-12-03T20:28:06Z'}
review: I kept hearing how great Bumble is but I‚Äôve been disappointed in the features and format. The worst feature is that the app bases location on your phone‚Äôs GPS tracking with no option to manually indicate your location in a more general way (i.e., major city or metropolitan area) ‚Äî that means the app tracks me all over the area and my matches can see the specific neighborhoods and towns I‚Äôm in and will show a different location when I‚Äôm traveling. For privacy and safety reasons, that‚Äôs a horrible feature!! I can‚Äôt believe an app focused on women would allow that. Also, matches are sent only by age and location. No option to search or filter by other characteristics (kids, education, politics, non-smokers, etc) so I have to read through every profile only to discover we aren‚Äôt compatible on the basics.
title: Disappointing format/features

review: First, the app has a good concept, like a more serious version of Tinder. But, follow the logic on why my title makes sense. Women get at least 10x (at least) more connections than guys, because women seem to be more selective. Then they choose out of the hundreds who they respond to?  From what I‚Äôve heard about other sites, a lot of guys either can‚Äôt hold conversations or are looking for one thing that most ladies are not interested in. That weeds out the d-bags!  With this system, women get so many choices of who to respond to, possible good matches for them are buried at the bottom as new ones continue to flow in. After a few months, I think I‚Äôve had maybe ten matches (yes aim attractive and I‚Äôll admit I‚Äôm picky) but only 30% even respond, then they get bombarded with other matches before we even get to know each other. Fix the system, it‚Äôs a waste of time for the guys.
title: Women Starting Conversations Doesn‚Äôt Work

But that‚Äôs if you want the gold, vs premium, and don‚Äôt forget about the little super swipes and other gimmicks there are to make money off of you. Bumble used to be a fair service, and even if you where free you weren‚Äôt punished. I used to like bumble back when it worked. Back when there weren‚Äôt so many forces behind the scenes implemented just to convince us we need to pay 30 bucks a month for this. If you‚Äôd like to talk to a Support Team Member about your profile to check everything is running as it should be, please message us here: bumble.com/contact.", 'modified': '2022-11-08T15:45:09Z'}
review: As a free member, I kept getting ‚Äúliked‚Äù by ladies until I finally ponied up the money for a premium membership. None of the 7 ladies who liked me ever sent me a message. I didn‚Äôt find out until later that if I sent a like to someone, they‚Äôd only see it if they had purchased a Bumble Boost membership. As the lady has to make the first move, all I could do was hope one of the ladies I sent a like to had a membership and reached out. Amazingly, I did not get a single ‚Äúlike‚Äù from someone while I had my premium membership. But, once it expired, incredibly I started getting at least 2 ‚Äúlikes‚Äù a day which I could only see if I purchased another premium membership. Nope, fool me once, shame on you, fool me twice, shame on me. Classic bait and switch. Bumble should at least let all the ladies see a profile of a man who has a premium membership, not expect both parties to pay to see one another.
title: Bait and switch

review:
This platform has violated my name. I was kicked off the app when I would try to access it on my phone, but didn't pay it much mind since I was not having much success with the matches anyways. I cancelled my payed service and wanted to get on to my profile to delete it, I tried my laptop since my phone app was not successful, to find that the account that I was not able to access had been blocked because of "several reports" of some sort of misconduct. 

This was not me since I was not even able to access the service I paid for. I would like to know what this alleged misconduct was and why no one ever reached out to me? My account was obviously hacked which causes great concern and anger for me when these are my pictures and name attached to whatever was done. 

I have been off and on of this app for a few years and would recommend to friends. Never again. This has been a terrible experience, and that is now my messaging. I would also like insurance that my profile has been completely deleted since I have been "banned" and cannot do it on my own. 
 
This is what I tried to go to the ‚Äúhelp center‚Äù with, but couldn‚Äôt even get through there. Hopefully someone is able to reach out in this way. I demand that my profile is deleted.
title: If I could give less stars I would

review:
When my sister first told me about Bumble early in 2016, I was hesitant and skeptical thinking "another stupid Tinder app" but what sold me was that ladies make the first move, eliminating dozens and dozens of repulsive emails, which saves a lot of time.  I also like the time limit that got me moving faster to message someone I'm interested in (although I learned the time limit doesn't really make them go away forever, at least not when I was using it).
No more unwanted disgusting & creepy messages!! 

Within a week I started talking to a guy I was interested in and we hit it off right away.  I‚Äôve had some not so happy endings in the past, as many of us have, and this man I met through Bumble is literally the man of my dreams!!  We‚Äôve been married just under a year and we are so happy and in love!!  :) :) I'm very grateful I decided to give this app a chance or I may not have ever met this amazing man!  I also recommended Bumble to a friend who has  found someone she is very happy with and is getting married within the next year! 
 
I hope Bumble has continued to be as great as it was back in 2016!!  Thank you BUMBLE!!!! <3 <3
title: Great service

developerResponse: {'id': 28986241, 'body': "Thanks for sharing this feedback with us. Bumble is always looking for new ways to improve the experience of our members. We really appreciate you taking the time to leave us your feedback about this, and we'll be sure to share it with our Product Team.", 'modified': '2022-04-05T20:40:57Z'}
review:
The developer had made his own Bumble obsolete on older iPhones, but now has apparently fixed that problem so I‚Äôm back to testing if it‚Äôs really usable. 

Two major problems I see are 

1) the use of meaningless hieroglyphic icons that seem to randomly switch around on every page makes navigation very tedious and difficult; WHEN will developers learn to use text menus that we can just look at to see what they‚Äôre for, instead of having to experiment by clicking on every one to see if they do something useful or are what we‚Äôre looking for?  A single drop down text menu in the upper left corner where menus belong would be a massive improvement in usability, instead of scattering meaningless hieroglyphs randomly around the screen. 

2) poor contrast of light yellow-orangey text on white backgrounds in Setup areas makes certain operations slow and difficult. Not as bad as the use of meaningless icons, but still unnecessary. Suspect the developer isn‚Äôt using naive testers on a variety of devices like he should, but instead is probably developing on a Mac with a high contrast screen where his light-on-light text is discernible and where the use of meaningless hieroglyphics for navigation has long been standard practice‚Äîand the reason that I and many others loathe Apple products.
title: Improved from before

It‚Äôs honestly a shame because until now i preferred bumble to other dating apps but there really isn‚Äôt much point if i can only like five people a day, i mean if i just go to Walmart I end up seeing like 50 people so my chances of finding someone are 10 times higher if I try to pick up girl in Walmart. review: I like the app, it has a wide variety of women of different professions. To be able to swipe unlimitedly, you need to pay 8 dollars per week, which is quite high of a price. As a result of the limit on swipes, it may take longer to swipe right on someone who may like you and has already swiped right. You can‚Äôt see the ones who‚Äôve swiped right on you, until you connect with them. Despite these flaws, I believe most women are interested in dating but some are more interested on adding Instagram followers or will message you and not respond. Regardless, I am hopeful I may meet my long term match and I do recommend it.

review: So I think this app has a lot going for it. I love the idea that girls have to start the conversation and they have time limits so you are more motivated to actually chat & meet people. It sounds easy and simple but so many times I have accidentally swiped left/right while scrolling a persons profile. It shouldn‚Äôt be so sensitive. The app needs improvement on this and should separate looking at a profile and swiping yes/no on a person. I would give this app more stars if I had better control of swiping yes/no. The biggest issue I‚Äôve had is the mistaken swipes. I will just be scrolling down their profile and it will go right or left on me. It‚Äôs just too easy to make a mistake and miss someone I wanted to match, or match with someone I didn‚Äôt. 
The super swipe button is also in a bad spot, makes it way too easy to mistakenly hit. I super swiped my ex on accident and had to completely delete my account and start over.

I do not recommend this app unless you are ready to sit there & check all day or everyday to catch matches & etc. I don‚Äôt recommend unless you are willing to pay for the full version. & I still don‚Äôt recommend it after that as I did so to see if it‚Äôs worth it. review: First off I like that the women get to start the conversation as it cuts down on creepers but there are massive draw backs to the free version. You only have a certain number of likes you can use in a 24hr period, so if you ran out of likes at 11:55pm you will have to wait till 11:55pm to use the app again the next day. You can only message people who have matched with you, while other apps let you message anyone who catches your eye. I understand they need to make money but this app is insane for what it charges. It‚Äôs $20/week, $77/3month, $230/lifetime membership for premium which allows unlimited likes, unlimited backtrack (go back to someone you left swiped on), unlimited rematch (match with someone you unmatched), beeline (see who likes you), and a couple fancy filters and other features that are offered cheaper on other apps.
title: You‚Äôre only gonna get the benefits of this app if you have deep pockets

developerResponse: {'id': 24203593, 'body': "On Bumble we empower women to make the first move in their relationships to shift old-fashioned power dynamics and encourage equality from the start. If you have any other suggestions feel free to contact our team at bumble.com/contact.", 'modified': '2021-07-29T17:16:33Z'}
review:
They do not state any statistics about how frequently women actually engage, because they just don‚Äôt.

This is going to sound bitter, but this app is just terrible, and you will be more successful on other platforms. I am conventionally good looking and so forth, but Bumble is just awful for men because of the ‚Äúladies message first‚Äù. Do not give them your money, the founder and key staff are openly hostile towards men. Search online for the people who have requested their privacy data - it‚Äôs something like 50 messages per 25,000 swipes on this app for a dude.  

Anecdotally:
Currently active bumble matches: 0 (used app for months) 
Matches within Tinder within 72 hours: 105, messages back and forth with 33, move to text with 11, dates arranged with 6. 
Literally 0 from Bumble, for the same profile - matches just expire when they‚Äôre time expired and you have to rely on the ladies to make the move. They make so much money because of the psychological trick, making women ‚Äúmatch‚Äù with men but be unmessageable still allows men false hope they will meet the more-attractive demographic this attracts (instagram handle promoters). 

Online dating can work, but not with this (terrible, hostile to men, obvious money grab) app, which has dramatically inferior (1) match (2) date (3) satisfaction scores than other comparable apps.
title: Surprise, ripoff for men

developerResponse: {'id': 23084040, 'body': "Hi there, we're sorry to hear you haven't had the best experience on Bumble. Please message us at support@team.bumble.com so we can look in to this for you :)", 'modified': '2021-05-30T08:30:23Z'}
review: I‚Äôve came to the conclusion that like many other dating apps, Bumble is pretty much a rip off. After signing up, I received several likes in just a few hours. So I decided to upgrade for a week. I ended up matching with 12 to 15 of these likes. Not a single message and not another like came in before the week long upgrade ended. As soon as my subscription ran out, I received several more likes within just a couple of days. So, I subscribed for another week. I matched with even more of these likes and not a single reply and no more incoming likes. So I could guess what was happening. As soon as my second subscription ended, the likes started pouring in. Just to prove my hunch, I subscribed for a third week and as you can probably guess, not a single reply from any of the several matches. It‚Äôs just a hoax.
title: Not impressed

review:
I downloaded this app at the request of a friend. She told me that women have to message you first which was intriguing , so I decided to try it out. Long story short, I met many people, and then one particularly wonderful person after about a week of using the app. I deleted the app a week after that and we‚Äôve been dating for a month now. 

I really like a dating app that I can delete quickly. 

Key features that make this possible:
Questions to answer so you don‚Äôt have to think of a bio if you don‚Äôt want.
There aren‚Äôt a ton of photos so you‚Äôre encouraged to base your swipe on their personality traits.
(For straight/bi men) women have to message you first! You already know they want to talk to you, so there‚Äôs not much fear of rejection. 
Each profile on the account is different in some way, not many bio-less accounts like tinder. 

Overall I‚Äôll just say this app worked for me and made me feel comfortable talking to new people after a bad break up and multiple months single (all during quarantine) so I think that‚Äôs a pretty good determiner for it‚Äôs worth. 
Hope you find your person.
title: Tinder but 100x better

review: I had some good conversations and everything was going well, until Bumble suspended my account because a moderator decided I was under 18, with no warning or reasoning given. I‚Äôm 19 and nothing in my profile suggested I might be under 18, but after contacting their customer support, they said they require a personal document to prove I‚Äôm 19. I don‚Äôt think I should have to compromise my privacy because someone randomly (and mistakenly) thought I was lying about my age. I‚Äôve now had to make a new account to try to find the people I was having conversations with again, since I wasn‚Äôt given any sort of warning before being suspended for no reason. I understand keeping underage people off the app and enforcing their terms and conditions, but I don‚Äôt get why they‚Äôd kick me (a legal adult) off the app without even a shred of evidence that I was underage. So frustrating.
title: Suspended my account for no reason

review: Bumble itself is a great idea and when the app is working properly I was happy. But days spent with tech support just to get into my account after getting a new phone was awful. I actually had a date planned for the next day, poor guy thinks I just disappeared on him, thanks bumble! Seriously though it‚Äôs frustrating to not be able to call a customer service number. I felt like the emails responding to my problem was an automated thing because their suggestions were something I already said didn‚Äôt work. This review is solely on the fact that their tech support is the absolute worst. Can I also ask what is the point of giving your email as a way to recover your account when you can‚Äôt use your email if you need to recover your account?

review: All right, I like the app. However, there is a problem. Most girls that I match with do not ever start conversations. And then, we will match on another app (Tinder) and I will start the conversation, and we will go on a date or start texting. Therefore, I haven‚Äôt met a lot of girls through Bumble, but through Tinder. In other words, I get the reasons behind giving girls the choice to start the convos first, but most girls are absolutely afraid of this. And this has been my experience and also the experience of other guys. Therefore, girls should be able to select if they want the guy to start the convo or not, that way we don‚Äôt go to another app. If they don‚Äôt want to talk, I mean, the match is going to disappear in 24 hours anyway.
title: Girls should have the option to have guys start the convos.....

review: I had this app for about two weeks. One day I went to get on and I was signed out of my account. I tried signing in and it let me put my password and account information in. I emailed the Bumble team and they said Bumble is for 18 years or older. I must send them my personal information such as my drivers license which holds very personal information such as my address and DL Number. Based on how I look, they assumed I‚Äôm under 18. No further questions asked, they banned me. I understand when I am carded for alcohol, but to be carded for a dating website? If your site can‚Äôt be held to a certain standard to not inform someone of a ban let alone assume the age of someone based on looks, it‚Äôs not worth it. There are so many other apps better than Bumble.

review:
The app itself is programmed well and works flawlessly. 

I have been matched at least 25-30 times (I‚Äôm a dude) and never once has anyone ever initiated a conversation.  The app obviously does nothing to encourage the people to start conversations.   Also matches disappear from your queue LITERALLY RIGHT AFTER YOU MATCH. How this happens I have no idea. The whole women initiate thing is great but not if they don‚Äôt actually do it - you should be able to say a respectful hello or something at least.  Maybe even canned messages.  For now try Hinge, works much better and I‚Äôve had tons of conversations on there in half the time and guess what...  I‚Äôve initiated 3/4 of them.  Have talked to at least 10 matches inside a month on Hinge and already met three. They also remind you to talk when it‚Äôs your turn, encouraging conversation.  Maybe take a look at it Bumble devs...

And they will not see your like in your bee line.

I was really upset and convinced that I would lose all of those contacts and have to start fresh. But the Bumble support team worked with me to confirm my identity and change my login so I could recover my account. I cannot say thank you enough! But it was mostly my favorite because it use to let you have I think two or three advanced filters set without having to pay. Now I have to pay for EVERYTHING and it‚Äôs ridiculously expensive! I can‚Äôt even put a filter on what kind of COVID-safety date I want???? This may as well be Tinder with what little information I can narrow down without emptying my whole wallet. At least on there my matches don‚Äôt expire and I have unlimited swipes. Y‚Äôall have really thrown this app in the toilet by making it pretty much a terrible mixture between Tinder and Hinge. This app use to be great, and now it‚Äôs trash

review: I decided to give this app a try a couple months ago. I‚Äôm not anything special....I know that up front and I‚Äôm not going to pretend I‚Äôm not. I‚Äôve seen reviews saying how this app makes men lazy, but I disagree. Your experience may vary, and I honestly hope it does for the positive...but I hate this app.

it‚Äôs really frustrating that you can‚Äôt delete your 1-3 responses to the app‚Äôs 20-ish open-ended questions, and that if you choose to answer any of them, you always have to have that many on your profile. it‚Äôs only ‚Äúupdate‚Äù or ‚Äúreplace‚Äù with a different question. i liked my first answer, but my second one was impulsive, and now i need to come up with something else. i‚Äôm considering deleting the app for this reason because there aren‚Äôt even many interesting ones. most people just have the same few, over and over: how many times do i have to see ‚Äúbeach or mountains‚Äù while swiping?

bumble, consider changing your policy, it‚Äôs incredibly annoying. when i googled it, i saw multiple forums where bumble users complained about this problem.
