title: Fake users and scam free trial

review: This app does not clearly state that you get billed as soon as you start what is supposed to be a free trial. I was charged an absurd amount and was on the phone for an hour with Apple support getting a refund. I cancelled my subscription right away and was still billed. No where did it say you get charged right away. It said you you get charged after the trial is over. Very unsatisfied with the bumble support team and information you have regarding subscriptions on your app. I also spoke with other people that had the same experience as me. I would not recommend this app at all because of my experience. It ruined my day and now I have to wait for my refund to come in. Please learn that a free trial means you should not get charged. Very misleading when you‚Äôre charged right away and cancel the subscription within seconds.
title: Subscription Issues

review:
I have not gone on a date as a result from this dating site. I downloaded Bumble because it is touted as a relationship app, but my experience has been quite the opposite. I am happy to hear that others have had great experiences with this site but mine has been simply negative. 

Firstly, like Tinder there are more empty profiles than ones that are moderately filled out. If they are not empty, they may just say ‚Äú6‚Äô2‚Äù or have one letter written. If someone can not put about 5 minutes of their time to fill out their profile, they‚Äôre not serious about finding a relationship. 

Second, you have 24 hours to respond to a message. I‚Äôve had many matches that ran out of time. It feels like a waste of time because I send thoughtful messages, not just ‚Äúhey.‚Äù

Thirdly, like Tinder many of the profiles are people passing through the area and want to be shown around. Many are people in the area for the night, again not relationship seeking. 

In sum, this app does not feel different than Tinder. I have deleted it for the last time and will not be back. It may just be the area where I live but I am far too busy to waste any more of my time on dead-end conversations or matches who won‚Äôt respond.
title: Not much different than Tinder

developerResponse: {'id': 35023154, 'body': 'Thanks for updating your review.\nWe always appreciate feedback from our users.', 'modified': '2023-02-22T22:26:39Z'}
review:
This app is 30% dating and 70% pop ups imploring you to buy a subscription or some other item off their virtual shelf. 

You get maybe 12-15 swipes a day and after that you‚Äôre done. No more swiping or ‚Äúlove-finding‚Äù experience for you. Instead, after you‚Äôve used your meager amount of swipes, you get a pop-up ever single time you open up the app. Not only that, but you also get random bumble messages asking you to buy something, giving you hollowed-out tips/tricks for dating, or some other useless/pointless message. 

Bumble‚Äôs interface is pretty basic and doesn‚Äôt stand out as better than many of the other dating apps out there. Even tinder has less ads or unwanted messages.
title: Don‚Äôt forget to subscribe!

developerResponse: {'id': 32207582, 'body': "Thanks for reaching out to us! Bumble is always looking for new ways to improve the experience of our members. We really appreciate you taking the time to leave us your feedback about this, and we'll be sure to share it with our Product Team.", 'modified': '2022-09-24T17:32:53Z'}
review: It‚Äôs definitely better at attracting the more legitimate people who are looking for real relationships. review:
If you pay for bumble boost, you get to see everyone that has already swiped right on you. I like this feature because work keeps me very busy and I can just focus on the girls that I already know are interested during the limited time that I have.
Up until just a day or two ago these girls were displayed in the Beeline with the most recent on top. With the recent update though the Beeline is now totally randomized - meaning a girl who swiped right on me 2 weeks ago might be on top. Worse yet, I travel a lot for work and the girls in the Beeline are now from all different locations with no order! For instance, I am home now in southern California but my Beeline literally looks like this, starting at the top:

Manhattan, NY; St Louis Park, MN; Dallas, TX; Peoria, AZ - and all the way on down like this, totally random! What a joke!! 

When I left home last time I know I had at least 30 girls that had swiped right on me while I was home, but now I can‚Äôt find any of them in the Beeline. Why would one pay to see a totally random, orderless list?!

I‚Äôm trying to figure out how this update adds any sort of value for any user whatsoever, and I can‚Äôt think of a single thing. What a horrible move Bumble.
title: Recent Update Renders Boost Useless

review:
Like many other reviewers on here, after giving this app 2 weeks, I received zero matches.  You may think ‚Äúwell maybe women did not like you during the 2 weeks.‚Äù However, women did like me because the app notified me multiple times stating you have someone who liked you.  But when I checked the app., it said I have no matches.

So the apps seems broken (at least, in my case).  Maybe the app will fix itself, maybe it will not.  In either case, maybe this is a sign for me go back to dating the old fashion way.

I normally date the old fashion way (asking women out in person).  It worked just fine but I thought ‚Äúlet me give online dating a chance - I may meet women I normally would not for whatever reason (different friends, hang-out spots, & so on).

For everyone out there dating, dating is fun & tough at the same time (nothing like investing time & effort only to realize the other person is not right for you or vise versa).

Keep dating, keep meeting new people (regardless of this app), and overtime you will meet the person who is right for you. It may be tomorrow. It may be months. It may be years.  But you will. Enjoy the journey because it is not about getting to the finish line.

review:
For bumble bizz only:

I was very excited for the concept of an app the helps you network. But this is not that app. I live in a major city and the only people on the bizz app were either real estate agents trying to sell houses, kids fresh out of undergrad, or people using it as another way to find dates. The fact that they seem to have changed nothing about the interface is just lazy. Why would matches disappear in 24 hours if you haven‚Äôt said anything? This is networking not dating. And why is there no feature to actually search for people‚Äôs interests/fields. The fact you have to swipe through a million people that have nothing to do with your interests is a huge deterrent. If I had known this was literally just their dating app I would not have bothered. Just going to stick with LinkedIn.
title: Bumble bizz... more like bumble bizzn‚Äôt

Because all though it says there‚Äôs thousands of people using this app, the fact is that about 75% are no longer active. So you are really wasting your time going through the process of trying to match with someone. It also is very baffling that they expect you to make in app purchases when the app it‚Äôs self no longer has ACTIVE users especially compared to what it once had when it was first popular. Dating apps are suppose to increase in ACTIVE users and if and when they don‚Äôt it becomes obvious that there are problems with this app. So in conclusion BUMBLE IS GARBAGE.

developerResponse: {'id': 34024105, 'body': "Hi there. We hate to hear you didn't get what you were looking for from our Support Team. We would be more than happy to take a closer look at this for you. Send us a message at: bumble.com/contact.", 'modified': '2022-12-31T15:11:17Z'}
review:
I‚Äôve been off and on this app for years with hopes of matching with guys that were dating a little more intentionally than guys on other apps out there. No luck, and it‚Äôs not entirely because of the men. It‚Äôs mostly the app itself. 

I‚Äôve contacted bumble multiple times about the issue of never matching with hardly anyone. Their responses were to expand my search radius or not swipe left so much‚Ä¶ seriously? I live in Houston.  I think a 30 mile radius is plenty enough. And even when I did expand to 75+ miles, just for fun. Nothing. Still. 

Where are the matches with any of the people who swiped right? Additionally, when the addition of banter, which is like a little speed dating round, I missed out on matches due to them saying I ran out of likes‚Ä¶I have pictures of that. They left the chat, but never appeared to me until 30+ minutes later as someone who left the conversation. 

Over the years, the number of likes you can make as a consumer, for free, have dwindled to‚Ä¶ maybe 10 a day. At this point I don‚Äôt think I‚Äôll use bumble again as this past experience has been the most frustrating.
title: Not really free. Misleading. Doesn‚Äôt offer matches.

review: So Bumble has started limiting likes to encourage considerate right swiping but doesn‚Äôt tell their users how many likes they have available before it just arbitrarily stops you unless you pay for more. Is the goal thoughtful swiping and improved experience for all their users or Bumble continuing to move features behind a pay wall? Is the goal of this app to encourage matching, or is it just like the match group apps now? Limiting likes just means more likes for the top 1% of profiles and less matching for everyone else anywhere near a major metropolitan area (if you happen to have an airport in between you and that major city, you‚Äôre even more screwed)‚Ä¶ online dating is so brutal!

I‚Äôve been thinking of getting back on a dating app, and bumble is truly my first choice. I was reading the reviews, and there not the greatest. My advice is if you‚Äôre thinking about joining a dating app, just be realistic with your expectations. Keep in mind that it is just a dating app. I‚Äôm glad I gave it a shot.

review:
Being a guy on a dating app is hard in itself because there‚Äôs significantly more of us than women and these apps know that so they purposefully make it extremely hard to even get seen by women.

Not only that but Bumble specifically has some of the worse ‚ÄúLike‚Äù limits I‚Äôve ever seen. Hinge is by far the worst (I think I only got 5 free likes) but bumble isn‚Äôt that far behind. 

The only way to even get seen is to pay for premium or boost and premium is $40 PER MONTH. That‚Äôs absolutely ridiculous and its not only unfair but borderline sexist that bumble purposefully makes it harder for men to find matches than women.

And I‚Äôm not an ugly guy. When I paid for boost I got an overwhelming amount of likes and matches from ideal women for me but if you don‚Äôt pay you only get  a couple likes every now and then and it‚Äôs always from un-ideal women.

Plus the whole idea behind Bumble being that women message first is a god-awful idea for men because women get so many matches that the 24 hours expires before they even have time to go through their matches. Get rid of the time limits or let men be able to message first without a time limit.

Sure, there is a place to write a little bit about yourself however it‚Äôs awfully short.. and the options of religion , no room to explain wether you are pentecostal like long hair no makeup and only dresses or pentecostal like filled with the spirit of God. The only other thing I don‚Äôt care for is that only women can message first???? What woman wants to ‚Äúchase‚Äù a man down... and what man wants to wait around on women to talk to him? 
Like I said, overall, not a bad app it just needs some tweaking!
title: Bumble dating app review

review: Honestly, Bumble is such an annoying dating app that overcharges for their service. It is not an enjoyable app to use for free, as the company makes it near impossible to get anywhere without paying. The AI often suggests the same people 2-3 times after swiping left on them, so they take up your daily swipes and you end up having to pay to see more potentials! Bumble is also horrible at detecting e-girls who are on here just to gain followers on social media. I also despise the ‚Äúwomen-first‚Äù approach. Most women don‚Äôt even take initiative, so guys are stuck having to pay to extend the 24-hour time limit Bumble in hopes that they will start the chat. Not a helpful app and a disgusting money grab for those of us looking for relationships. In this market, I would look to other dating apps that provide a better experience.
title: Annoying Money Grab

review: I returned to OKC after a few months of inactivity and found my account was deleted. My favorite feature of the app, being able to scroll through a wall of different profiles, has been removed (so now you can only see one person at a time and must swipe to see the next). This was the one feature that distinguished OKC from other dating apps. Additionally, a ton of BLM and covid19 questions have been added, and are seriously clogging up the match percentage feature. I do care deeply about these issues, but adding this many questions which are loosely rephrasing the same point is too much - especially considering that half of the initial questions asked during sign-up are about these two topics. Bad move, OKC.
title: They should not have changed it!

review: I love this app, especially because it so easy to use. There‚Äôs just a few things I wish were different, 1) I wish the match response time was longer than 24 hours. I, for one, have a very busy life. Sometimes I forget that someone has sent me a message and by the time I go to reply it‚Äôs too late. I‚Äôm sure this is the case for many people. 2) I wish each part off this app was its own app. I‚Äôd love to be able to use more than one version at once. While I‚Äôm sure it‚Äôs more convenient for the developers to have it as one, I‚Äôd love to be able to use bff and bizz at the same time

I recently had the single most frustrating experience I‚Äôve ever had on an app that while well designed. Its customer Service team is Full of #%^*.

I like many of you, am a causal user of apps and even less frequently dating apps but I use them. After seeing Tinder for the money grab that it was. I had given up. But as I was getting bored Bumble offered a free trial membership. I took it thinking it was fine and I could cancel even if I was a day or 2 late. The trial membership was for 90 days. A couple of days wouldn‚Äôt even be 5% of that time.

developerResponse: {'id': 12781035, 'body': "We hate to hear that you had issues creating an account and would be happy to get this situation straightened out. To clarify, your Facebook profile isn't displayed on your Bumble profile. In regards to setting location, we have an update coming soon you're going to love. DM us on Facebook or Twitter @BumbleSupport or email support@team.bumble.com.", 'modified': '2020-01-08T00:12:15Z'}
review:
I let my friend create an account on my phone since I had the app, and we suddenly realized it automatically linked to MY Facebook account because I guess I was logged in. So we deleted hers and tried to make a new one but we were restricted. 

That‚Äôs my first issue. I love how the developers want to control bots, but that was ridiculous. Now she can‚Äôt even make an account because of a silly mistake. 

Being unable to hide your location and Facebook profile is frightening. I want to find matches near me but I don‚Äôt want people to know where I am every time I open the app. What if I‚Äôm out of town but want to find someone near my hometown? It finds matches based on your current location, not based on where you live etc. and now people have access to my current location. That‚Äôs way too invasive for an app that supposedly tries to cater to women. 

The lack of control I have over my profile is frustrating and I feel scared to use this app. 
I was really excited for an app that encouraged female empowerment and seemed to be geared towards women and even non-binary, trans, etc communities but this app will need a serious overhaul on the way it does some things.
title: Scary and frustrating to use

We‚Äôre engaged and getting married at the end of August! 

I was only on Bumble for about 3 months, and out of the ~10 guys I chose to meet, I went out on 3+ dates with 4 of them. I loved the filters and the women-first culture, which helped narrow contact to what I wanted quickly. Far less wasted time. 

Despite living in Colorado, I‚Äôm not much into the outdoors. Yes, I swiped left on a lot of marathon-running, jeep-driving fish-wavers (although Bumble‚Äôs definitely a good place if you‚Äôre into that), but I also found plenty of weed-free men who prefer art museums, movies, and the Oxford comma. Lots of diverse people looking for genuine connection. 

As far as my demographics, I‚Äôm a 41 year old woman with an 8-year-old. I‚Äôm a solid 7 üòú According to the men I met, they didn‚Äôt go on as many dates, but the ones they did go on were quality. review: My fiance and I met on here over two years ago! This was the only dating site I used because I liked that the women messaged first, resulting in less creepy booty call messages and more real relationships formed. We were able to connect via messaging on bumble to find out that we had many interests in common before our first date. We owe our relationship, the past two years of happiness, and our whole lives to come, to this app. If you‚Äôre out in the dating world today, please give bumble a try, we are sure glad that we did :)
title: Great Way to start a relationship

developerResponse: {'id': 16342400, 'body': "Thanks for sharing your candid experience. We want our platform to be a place for authentic connection. Any commercial or fake behavior should be reported, so we can take action. We want you to swipe, match and message for free and hate to hear this hasn't been the case. We want to help take a look‚ÄîDM us on Facebook or Twitter @BumbleSupport!", 'modified': '2020-07-01T16:43:16Z'}
review:
I‚Äôve used both OKC and this, stick with OKC. 

I used to get on the app once every few days or maybe weeks. They try to get your money for every little thing every which way to the point of impeding functionality, on top of that it is loaded with fake profiles promoting Instagram/snap chat accounts. 
If I‚Äôm going to pay for a dating app I‚Äôll go to match. 

The swiping is designed to make you mis-swipe and then it tries to get you to pay to reverse it. I‚Äôll try to scroll up on a profile and it will swipe them. Try to view a user‚Äôs Instagram pics, it swipes them. (No it‚Äôs not my screen this is the only app that has any problem with any gestures) 

If you match with someone and they message you, you only get 24 hours to respond... otherwise, you guessed it, you have to pay! 
They‚Äôre trying to either: 
A.) force you to use the app more.
B.) get as much money out of desperate people as possible. 

I can understand promoting to be a paid service, but sending a message to a match??? 
Come on, I‚Äôm not spending $10 to message someone who I might not even end up liking or might even be a bot....
title: Used car salesman of dating apps

review: Just a few things, having the women always initiate the conversation is completely sexist while trying to fight sexism at the same time. I do enjoy the app but men will match me and never respond so that‚Äôs annoying. Also, the swipe is WAY too sensitive, I‚Äôve accidentally swiped right so many times while simply trying to scroll through pictures. The men are respectful for the most part, I think it‚Äôs common knowledge that this really isn‚Äôt a ‚Äúhookup‚Äù app and that it‚Äôs more so tinder that does that. I like it, just minor issues. Messages should be open to let anyone message each other, not forcing women to start the conversation.
title: Good app

review: After previously using other apps with no luck, decided to return having met a great gal on here before . I now have a great new match. We decided to meet up for quick evening coffee date that ended at 4AM. After hours of talking, joking, & laughing hysterically we agreed that Bumble should add a way of leaving reviews on users you have matched with. We decided to text ourselves reviews on each other just for fun & came to the conclusion it would definitely enhance the experience on the app. Sandra you have 2 thumbs up from me only because that‚Äôs all I have. üëçüëç
title: Just a tip for developers

review:
1. The option to filter the beeline by radii smaller than 100 miles? I WOULD NOT CONSIDER PAYING FOR BOOST UNLESS THIS WERE ADDED AS A FEATURE. (I've used beeline when given the free week trials.) I don't understand why the age filter is applied to the beeline but the radius is not.
2. I feel it's too easy to accidentally swipe left or right on people when scrolling through the beeline.
3. "Don't know yet" option for the kids question in basic info? I can't be the only person who isn't sure about that very serious life choice.
4. An "other" option for the political basic info? Liberal and conservative are so reductive and I'm definitely not apolitical (or moderate).
title: 4 cents

review: I had almost completely given up hope in finding the one. Many years, I searched, to no avail. I was under the pretense that I wasn‚Äôt enough, and after a few months of using this, I was to the point of deleting all dating apps and giving up, but then I got a message from the most beautiful girl ever and here we are. All I can say is, social media and dating sites aren‚Äôt for everyone. That‚Äôs the truth. And real life dating is harder. You just gotta stick it out and keep trying. So thanks, Bumble, literally I would have never met my girlfriend if not for this site. 5 stars.
title: Bumble

review: I work in a male-dominated field of work where I am the only woman at my job. In desperate need of some balance, I downloaded Bumble BFF after seeing Serena William‚Äôs rad Super Bowl commercial. I kept my expectations low and just thought ‚ÄúWhat the heck, it‚Äôs worth a shot.‚Äù Within a week, I had connected with five other awesome girls my age and made plans to meet up and go out. I met two of them the first weekend ‚Äîboth awesome ladies‚Äî and made plans with three others to meet up a few weeks later. Thanks Bumble for creating a space for young adults to meet each other and build new friendships!!
title: So thankful Bumble BFF exists!

developerResponse: {'id': 8320070, 'body': "Hey there! Thanks for sharing your experience with us. We'd love to help improve it! We know that you can make some empowering connections on Bumble, and our Support Team is here to help! Feel free to send us a DM over Facebook or Twitter (@bumblesupport).", 'modified': '2019-04-22T19:12:55Z'}
review:
-Men I match with never reply to messages, or reply with one word and do not care to engage in any conversation
-When I paid for the app, I set only 3 filters, education, smoking, and politics; but guess what, the app decided there are only around 10-15 men in a 20 mile radius from NYC That I could match with, which does not make any sense. 
-the app is very misleading, when I had the paid subscription, I was on the app a few seconds before my subscription expired, and it was showing no one in the queue of men that would have swiped right on me, and suddenly a second after my subscription expired, the queue showed that there were 50+ hidden profiles that swiped right on me and was asking me to extend my subscription to see them, which is misleading
-the BFF option is only limited to the same gender
title: Men do not reply to messages

review: My overall experience about Bumble is very good. However, like other dating apps, scammers is also a big issue. It‚Äôs easy to cheat the photo verification system. I highly recommend the developers could consider using video verification in the future. For example, ask the users to make gestures of number 0 to 9 in a sequence with their face showing. For each user, the system will randomly pick five numbers and in a random sequence. This way it‚Äôll be hard for scammers to cheat.
title: Nice app but still need to solve the scammers issue

developerResponse: {'id': 4610168, 'body': "Hey there, we're sorry to hear this and we'd really like to investigate the customer service that you were provided, please can you DM us on Facebook or Twitter so we can do so?", 'modified': '2018-08-10T13:39:13Z'}
review: I used bumble and actually liked the app a lot. I did a free trial of their subscription and cancelled on time. I was shocked to see a charge after the free trial was complete. When I emailed to ask I was given a blatant copy/paste answer that fees aren‚Äôt refundable. When I replied I had cancelled I got the same type of auto response of you just not have so it‚Äôs not refundable. After many emails back and forth over a long period of time, I requested someone call me to discuss how this happened and they replied that subscription payments are actually through Apple so if I had an issue I needed to contact them directly and basically to stop emailing them. It was so unprofessional. I‚Äôll never use the app or recommend it again. Horrible customer service.
title: Beware of Subscriptions that don‚Äôt cancel and horrible customer service

developerResponse: {'id': 4225804, 'body': "Hi! Thanks for your feedback. We're sorry you've had a negative experience so far. Bumble is a platform for users to make deep and authentic connections, and we know there are some amazing bees in the Hive looking to do just that! Please reach out to us over FB (@bumbleapp) or Twitter (@bumble) if we can do anything to improve your experience!", 'modified': '2018-07-13T18:15:35Z'}
review:
I get a lot of matches and I barely get a response. When I finally get the courage to message there‚Äôs a 95% chance they won‚Äôt respond I honestly don‚Äôt see the concept of liking me but not responding. And when they do respond they either want to hookup even though I said specifically on there that I‚Äôm looking for more than that,or I don‚Äôt hear from them again. 
I honestly feel like there should an app or function for people seriously looking for relationship or a partner or whatever. The reason why I go on here or other going on instead of tinder is because they having finding what they outside of this app and this is not making any easier. Please make a change that fits what others want
title: It could be better or make another app

developerResponse: {'id': 32215284, 'body': "Thank you for your review! Your feedback is extremely valuable to us, so we will definitely share your input with the appropriate team. We're always working to increase the number of genuine, quality connections for our users. Part of that means encouraging more intentional swiping. We incorporated a swipe limit to help our users get the results they‚Äôre hoping for. Our premium features are all completely optional. Please know you don't have to pay to make connections in the Hive! If you have any questions about our premium features, please contact bumble.com/contact üêù", 'modified': '2022-09-25T13:01:57Z'}
review:
There are definitely fewer fake accounts and bots on Bumble than their are on Tinder. Matches are general higher quality but the time limit kills off a lot of conversations before they begin.

Swipes are also limited much more than tinder in the free version, and upgraded versions are ridiculously priced. Starting at $10/week, I could have almost every video streaming service for the same cost.

Until they come up with a more reasonable pricing structure, what they‚Äôre offering for what they‚Äôre charging just isn‚Äôt worth it. You might get lucky and meet someone through the free version, but upgrades just aren‚Äôt worth what they want for them.
title: The dating app that costs more than cable

developerResponse: {'id': 31412583, 'body': "It's 100% against our Community Guidelines for users to create fake profiles, and our moderators work around the clock to ensure that all of our users are authentically representing themselves in the Hive. If you'd like our Profile Assistants to review your account & offer tips to show off your best self, reach out at bumble.com/contact. üíõ", 'modified': '2022-08-11T16:59:11Z'}
review: Guys‚Ä¶bumble isn‚Äôt what it use to be. Girls don‚Äôt respond anymore really. Even the women who seem decent don‚Äôt usually respond. Girls who seems attractive to you. May not respond at all and let the timer run out even if you extend it. Bumble doesn‚Äôt seem to address the issue on unresponsive ness and frankly there may be some fake profiles that have never gotten on in months to years - that are made just not gonna get removed‚Ä¶.save your money and time and read from those that been around a time or two. For new users, save your money, apply it to the gym, and let love or companionship flow naturally. It seems better just to passively look rather than actively look. Good luck with this info.
title: Bumble lost traction

developerResponse: {'id': 27514883, 'body': "We really appreciate you sharing your feedback!. To make sure you don't miss any matches, head to your in-app settings to turn on your notifications.", 'modified': '2022-01-18T14:17:03Z'}
review:
I rated it a 3 because it‚Äôs a decent app to make friends or even find a relationship MAYBE! Since
Us women have to text first (not speaking for all ) but since I have to text first I never get a reply back from anyone after they like me back & we match. I don‚Äôt get it lol. I‚Äôm not sure if anyone have the same problem as me. I honestly think bumble can give us extra time for us to text someone or for the guy to text us back before the time is up. I also wish bumble would give us more free trials of premium!! I had it before & haven‚Äôt gotten it since then. This problem not an review you was looking for but this is my opinion ahaha!
title: It‚Äôs ok!

developerResponse: {'id': 26318475, 'body': "We're sorry you didn't enjoy your experience on Bumble. Our team would love the opportunity to improve your experience in the Hive! Please message our Support Team on Twitter or Facebook (@BumbleSupport) and we'd be happy to help.", 'modified': '2021-11-17T09:39:19Z'}
review:
Paid for a month subscription to try it out, with a decent amount of matches. However, 1 out of 5 conversations were started by women, essentially making the matches nonexistent. Subscription expired and SOMEHOW had 10 more matches from the hour previous to when it expired. I‚Äôm pretty sure Bumble withholds matches for this exact reason to take money from you, then matches you with people you‚Äôre not interested in once you decide to pay. Terrible app. Hinge is way better.

Update: Support contacted me and said I shouldn‚Äôt have to pay to match with people, however, matches disappear after 24 hours and these nine in my beeline have been there for 72+ hours. Therefore proving my point that you have to pay to view matches. The app is a total scam.
title: What A Scam

developerResponse: {'id': 23607911, 'body': "We're sorry to hear you haven't heard back from us yet! Your message is important to us, so please rest assured we'll be replying to you shortly. We can't thank you enough for your patience. üíõ", 'modified': '2021-06-27T09:03:50Z'}
review:
Let me start by saying they removed my review once because they thought they had fixed the issue, but they haven‚Äôt corrected anything. I‚Äôve been a premium member, and randomly 10 days ago it asked me to sign back in. So I did as I usually do through my Facebook account. Well I cannot login. It does the whole process over and over and just leads back to the login page. However, they are still taking my money. I have contacted their support through their website, email, and their Facebook messenger. I have never gotten a response. Nothing. In 10+ days! If they had responded I would change my mind about my review, however I am sure they will also remove this review too. 

*DO NOT WASTE YOUR TIME*
title: Doesn‚Äôt even work. No customer support.

review:
I was already paying for Bumble Boost and Bumble kept telling me every day that 20-30 people had liked me. I could either swipe through and hope I come across them or pay for Premium and get to see who they are.  After weeks of swiping and only seeing a few of them I decided to upgrade for premium for $30/mo - NOT cheap. As soon as I do I excitedly go to see who liked me and a message appears: ‚ÄúThese users are all out of your area but they saw you before and liked you. You‚Äôre free to match with them.‚Äù Seriously!? All these people live 500+ miles away from me. Maybe 1 of the 22 was something close to my type. THAT‚ÄôS what you kept teasing me with? 

I‚Äôm fine with paying for a legitimate service but this is not it.
title: Deceptive - don‚Äôt upgrade to Premium.

developerResponse: {'id': 19703840, 'body': "Hi there, we're sorry to hear you haven't had the best experience on Bumble. review: See i might be selfish giving this app one star but honestly it just made me feel terrible. My friend she got matches within the hour, and on her second day she found her boyfriend who she started dateing and shes really happy with him. They both forced me to get it and i tried really hard and i put good pictures and i was honest in my bio and i really put my effort into it. And then when i swipe i read the bios and not just randomly swipe. I live in New Jersey and within range of NYC so i should be getting exposed to alot of people but im not getting any matches i also spent 30bucks on premium. I just think how its unfair that my friend got matches within the hour and a boyfriend and here i am two weeks later with nothing but less selfesteem. And theres a chance im just super ugly and im too stupid to realize it.
title: Sexist broken app

review: I don‚Äôt write reviews...and while I can say I happily deleted this app almost 3 years ago...the reason was only because of the happy relationship I found through Bumble. I had just moved home to Ohio after 6 years and was really just looking for social entertainment. What I found was my future freaking husband!!! He proposed on blended knee in front of all of our family and friends as a surprise for my birthday over the weekend...BUMBLE! THANK YOU! From the bottom of my heart, somehow someway, because of you I have found my happily ever after. I wish I could give you ten stars.
title: This is NO JOKE

developerResponse: {'id': 14530216, 'body': "We are continually working to improve our platform, and we're so thankful for your feedback. We will pass it along to our team to consider for future updates. In the meantime, we would love the opportunity to give you some personalized tips to improve your experience. Send us a message on Facebook or Twitter (@bumblesupport) so we can help!", 'modified': '2020-04-08T03:08:14Z'}
review:
I have enjoyed Bumble BFF more than Bumble Date.  

I agree with most reviews here that there should be a filter for race/ethnicity because, why not?  Also, the concept of women empowerment is great in theory but is not how this app is interpreted for most men.  It gives men the perception (and accurately so) that they‚Äôre the chase and we as women need to pine for their attention.  I find that the conversation once being initiated goes to nowhere unless it is BFF, & most men have that they are looking for a relationship and once the convo is initiated they want something casual and that this option was ‚Äúprefilled‚Äù.  

I would suggest expanding the feature to incl. race/ethnicity and also when you ‚Äúmatch‚Äù regardless of gender let an intro be seen and from there the women can continue the engagement.
title: Not for Dating

developerResponse: {'id': 5323685, 'body': 'Hey there, we do show users to you again incase you have changed your mind! If this does not happen soon please DM us on Facebook or Twitter so we can look into this for you!', 'modified': '2018-10-02T09:18:50Z'}
review:
This app is very user friendly however, take your time to read directions. Once you decide to swipe right or left, that is it. You can go back only 3 times but once you have viewed everyone, you can‚Äôt go back to see them again. I rushed through this and definitely would have taken my time deciding if I truly wanted to talk with someone or not knowing I couldn‚Äôt not view their profile again. 

It would be great to be able to review profiles more than just once. This is the only reason I gave it 3 stars instead of 5 but that is a huge issue for me. After all, we are here to review profiles. (Yes, I should have been more careful.. doubt I‚Äôm the only oneüò¨).
title: Like BUT...

developerResponse: {'id': 7440793, 'body': 'Hi there! We are sorry you had a negative experience on the app. All Bumble subscriptions are authorized by the user, and like most apps, all purchases are managed directly by Apple. Therefore, only their team can offer refunds to our users. Email us anytime at feedback@team.bumble.com if you need assistance unsubscribing.', 'modified': '2019-02-25T02:25:17Z'}
review: I accidentally tapped the button for purchasing 6 months of bumble boost while fumbling with my phone. I saw the screen to request authorization come up, I instinctively tried to get out of it by pressing the home button, but that triggered touch id and authorized the payment. I immediately reached out to their support to ask for a refund and explained the situation. They just replied with a standard message saying to cancel the subscription, which I have done but is not enough since the subscription has a period of 6 months. So, ok, sure I wont be charged in six months, but they've already taken 80 of my dollars for this cycle of 6 months, and they wont give that back. This is not an uncommon issue if you google it, I‚Äôm not the first person this has happened to and bumble refuses to do refunds.
title: Shady - no refunds

review: So I won‚Äôt lie I swipe right on everyone just to match. On Tinder I had over 15 likes, yet not one of them popped up for the over a month. They eventually decreased and all disappeared. Now with Bumble I‚Äôve had for a few days and I had three likes. All of them popped up in single matching que. one of the girls was good looking and seems to be doing well with life. The other two? I couldn‚Äôt even call decent looking. Some of the ugliest women I‚Äôve seen in my entire life. The fact that they even swiped right on me has made me feel like garbage and ugly. But other than that, this app works unlike Tinder. I‚Äôd use it.
title: Unlike Tinder, actually works

review: Take it from me as a girl who has had multiple Tinder dates and has a lot of matches. The app having girls message first puts pressure on the girl to do all the footwork. When you do message guys, all they have to say is ‚Äúhi how are you‚Äù and it never goes anywhere. The guys on bumble are a lot better looking and seem to be more career based, which any women would want. But they‚Äôre almost all muscle heads who don‚Äôt know how to initiate or maintain conversation. The concept of girls being able to ‚Äúcontrol the conversation‚Äù is admirable, but doesn‚Äôt work in the long run. It almost seems as if guys don‚Äôt feel they have to court you because the app is based on the girls initiation. Have been on for months and have yet to meet anybody. Don‚Äôt bother with bumble
title: Tinder is actually better

developerResponse: {'id': 3273394, 'body': "Hi there Al. We've released a feature where you'll be able to sign into Bumble without a Facebook account! Go to your App Store and download the latest version of Bumble!", 'modified': '2018-04-26T16:57:55Z'}
review: Wish there was a way to use this without having to use a Facebook account. There‚Äôs a lot of people out there who‚Äôve chosen not to allow FB to mine their personal data and siphon it off to third parties (yes I understand the irony in what I‚Äôm saying as Bumble probably takes certain liberties too) but let‚Äôs get real for a second. How many profiles in the form of ‚ÄòInstagram models‚Äô that are on this app and synced with Facebook are there? The answer: a lot. So in actuality mandating that Facebook is a requirement in order to prevent fake profiles does nothing since all those gorgeous early twenties totally legit Instagram models are so serious about connecting. Yes, I‚Äôve matched with them and no they don‚Äôt respond. Not ever.
title: Facebook

review: This app, much like most other dating apps, is designed with capitalism in mind and not your romantic success. With only 5 right swipes every 3 days and bizarrely expensive premium rates on top of them hiding your matches from you, it‚Äôs almost as if these developers want you to die alone desperately glued to your phone in hopes of one day finding a half decent partner. What‚Äôs the reason behind your cruelty? Is it corporate greed? Or your insecurities as developers? Please take the time to put yourself in the shoes of your consumer: the average financially strained millennial searching for love. Do you really expect good reviews if this is how you are running your app? Shame for a once-thought-to-be progressive female empowering dating app.
title: Capitalism. Not romance. They only want your money. Not your happiness.

developerResponse: {'id': 33771477, 'body': 'We‚Äôre thrilled you made such a special connection in the Hive! Please tell us more about your story at https://bumble.com/success-stories/share üíõ', 'modified': '2022-12-16T22:42:55Z'}
review:
Moving in together, she‚Äôs a quality woman unlike my last few fatherless exes. I always tell her ‚ÄúThank god I swiped right!‚Äù

I paid for a month of premium, met her and then cancelled. My ugly friend got a really cute girl on there too. Just don‚Äôt go on there looking for exclusively anorexic girls or you‚Äôll be let down. You‚Äôre in your 20‚Äôs/30‚Äôs, mature a little and try to appreciate someone for their personality and sense of humor. Super hot chicks will always make you feel paranoid anyway.

‚Ä¶ So yeah download this app. It changed my life. Thanks, Bumble!
title: Met my partner on Bumble

Either they do not EVER respond, unmatch after I send the 1st message, only respond twice and never hear from them again, or they want to chat for weeks and never meet in person. I don‚Äôt even know why they are on this app! I‚Äôm so tired of messaging these men first and nothing happens. It‚Äôs a complete waste of my time! I‚Äôve been on this app for 3 months and have not met a man in person. Many of them list they are seeking relationships, then only want to chat about or meet up for hookups. At that point, I unmatch them. There is an option for that on this app anyways. The bad communication and no dates within 3 months is ridiculous and very frustrating! title: Men are not Serious on this App

developerResponse: {'id': 31104795, 'body': "Thank you for taking the time to share your experience! We will make sure all your feedback is heard by the appropriate teams. If you have any other suggestions on how we can improve your experience, please reach out to us at bumble.com/contact - We're here to help! Please know we are wishing you meaningful connections wherever you may find them! üêù", 'modified': '2022-07-26T12:41:13Z'}
review:
I‚Äôve had Bumble for a few years now. When I first got the app there were no swiping limits, you could filter potential matches by education, what they were looking for, etc. All of these features were free and the app seemed really fun and inviting! I met lots of great people and was truly enjoying it!

Since those features have been taken away and now you must pay for them, the app seems to have a different feel. Genuinely making a connection is now harder than ever, and other life events (the COVID-19 pandemic) have made it harder without their help. Swiping on 10 people a day is simply not enough, especially when you don‚Äôt know if those people are near you or even interested in you. 

Because of the app going downhill and limiting all those wonderful features, I deleted my profile and will be joining and trying out other sites.

If you like Bumble and it works for you, that‚Äôs great! I‚Äôm happy for you. It‚Äôs not working for me anymore due to these changes, so I‚Äôm going to make a change and try something else.
title: Going Downhill

developerResponse: {'id': 31110051, 'body': 'Thanks so much for giving us a chance and checking us out! We hope to have you back in the Hive one day. üíõ', 'modified': '2022-07-26T16:55:02Z'}
review:
I wanted to test this application so I downloaded it and spent a few days sorting through it. When I was ready to delete it there was the most satisfying escape I have ever experienced. 
The "Delete Account" feature was the easiest and most satisfying piece of mind.
The application is not solely a dating platform! It is also used for finding friends and expanding your business reach. I can say that I appreciated the fact that I did not have to provide my e-mail address or any other information apart from my phone number. 
I can not speak about the experience of matching up with anyone, because I did not spend enough time on the application, but I did see that there was a nice energy to the purpose and people involved. 
Thanks for the opportunity to check you out. 

I would recommend this application for anyone who is seeking this type of service.
title: Satisfying Application

developerResponse: {'id': 28448912, 'body': "We're sorry you didn't enjoy your experience on Bumble. Our team would love the opportunity to improve your experience in the Hive! Please message our Support Team on Twitter or Facebook (@BumbleSupport) and we'd be happy to help.", 'modified': '2022-03-08T12:40:30Z'}
review:
I‚Äôve been on Bumble for 5-6 months and made full use of the app. The concept is cool, but only if it actually works. 

Men seem to have the general mentality that because the woman initiates the conversation, she‚Äôll be the one to keep it rolling. As a whole, they‚Äôre just very lazy - more so than in other settings. Men!! It‚Äôs on women to send the first message. After that, you owe it to the conversation to be an active and engaged participant, too. 

The vast majority of users on Bumble have no desire to meet in person, or to even have a voice/video conversation. They‚Äôre just looking to chitchat and pass the time. If not that, they‚Äôre looking for a hookup. There seems to be no real in between. 

I had one problem, one time and reached out to Bumble for help. The response was canned and clearly indicated they hadn‚Äôt really looked at my question. I followed up, asking for further review and a more personalized response. I got a second canned reply back.  

All in all I feel like the money and time I‚Äôve invested have yielded fruit that wasn‚Äôt worth the effort. 

Zero plans here to continue past my current subscription.
title: Not worth the time or money

developerResponse: {'id': 27561277, 'body': "We really appreciate your feedback, and we'll be sure to share it with our Product Team. In the meantime, you're always welcome to pick a short subscription term (like 1 day) to try it out and see if you like it. If not, you can still quickly review each users' info badges with a quick scroll before you swipe.", 'modified': '2022-01-20T14:40:41Z'}
review: With a recent update you're unable to filter what type of BFFs you're looking for. What's the point? You can't choose a particular activity such as only gaming or only love music, etc. without having to pay. I understand charging for more than one filter but charging for just the one? That's ridiculous. Without paying and no option to filter what you're looking for in the free version it renders the the app a waste of time because you match with a bunch people that don't meet your criteria. For this reason I'm barely using the app now because I have too many incompatible matches to swipe through to find the rare ones that have the same interest.
title: New Update Wastes Time

developerResponse: {'id': 19082276, 'body': "We appreciate you sharing your feedback with us. We are always looking for ways to improve our users' experience on the app so we will make sure to pass your input along to our Product Team.", 'modified': '2020-11-13T07:02:45Z'}
review:
If you like extremely boring white girls, this is most definitely the app for you presuming you‚Äôre a dude.

This coming from a white dude that doesn‚Äôt mind white girls, but that is 98% of the women displayed to me. Generally speaking, most of the girls typically found on this app aren‚Äôt the most exciting. Most are seeking attention, as is the case with most dating apps, although at least there‚Äôs a variety otherwiseS 

I‚Äôve found most women on Bumble hovering between 21 and 30 are career oriented and driven, and that‚Äôs a good thing. What isn‚Äôt is that most are timid, or desperately seeking someone to marry as they grow in age. 

After apparently swiping right on line 4 or 5 white girls, more on the pretty end, that is literally all of the women displayed to me. That or some other algorithm is really sucking, and pairing me with pretty white girls solely because I‚Äôm white. I‚Äôve never had such a strange issue on other apps.

So long story short, unless you‚Äôre a bit easy to boss around, and you enjoy going to wineries and dying of boredom with girls taking pics in front of sun flowers, nah I wouldn‚Äôt exactly recommend bumble. Even Facebook dating beats the crap out of it.
title: Match making is inadequate, possibly racially based

review: Paid for the 3 month membership and it‚Äôs a joke if you match with someone, women have the first move in a message form within 24 hrs if not men have an option to extend it an additional 24 hrs with paid membership but if they don‚Äôt message gone forever it‚Äôd be nice if after that time maybe give the man an option to follow up if felt so inclined I mean some people are busy, a lot of the profiles of women say something like ‚Äú any questions just ask‚Äù or something along those lines as a man you can not in anyway it‚Äôs so stupid, just all around not happy with it and it‚Äôs not me I do have a different app recently with all the same stuff in both profiles and at the very least can have a conversation with someone there
title: Stupid don‚Äôt waste your money!

developerResponse: {'id': 14821288, 'body': 'Our Support Team would be happy to review your case. Please contact us directly via Facebook or Twitter (@BumbleSupport) or by email at feedback@team.bumble.com.', 'modified': '2020-04-21T21:11:27Z'}
review: I used the app the first time months ago everything was fine, followed all the rules But all of a sudden the app deletes my account without reasoning, I used safe photos that aren‚Äôt innapproriate. I created the same account under the same details and 1 day later after using I have to create the account again with the same details. It‚Äôs Annoying. Tried doing it with different email still does the same thing. You‚Äôre better off going with match  or eharmony and paying for their service. At least they are sorry for the mishap and restore your account and don‚Äôt make you go through the whole process and make your time difficult as with bumble, they don‚Äôt care because no customer service. Avoid at all cost. Never again
title: Terrible better off going elsewhere

developerResponse: {'id': 7388833, 'body': "Hi there! Thank you so much for your feedback. If you ever have any questions or additional feedback, feel free to contact us at feedback@team.bumble.com- we're here for you!", 'modified': '2019-02-20T22:01:19Z'}
review:
Bumble, PLEASE give the option to allow guys to chat first. Like some kind of additional on/off private feature. I understand the reasoning behind girls talk first but why not allow the flexibility for those who HATE talking first??? After all, it takes TWO to tango and would boost your sales.  

Secondly, the distance feature needs an upgrade. I have selected within 10 miles on my
filter but still my profile goes out to men 60 miles away who come up on my recent likes. The filter should work both ways if I want to extend the distance I should be able to. Also I should be able to turn off my direct location and have it just say, 14 miles away not 14 miles away in Stephens city, Virginia.‚Äù

Lastly, living close to the city with 2 international airports nearby, +50% of the men who swipe on me are traveling. It‚Äôs such a waste of my time when I‚Äôm looking for a relationship with someone who is local. Most users don‚Äôt update their profile that they are traveling and only in town for 2 days. How can you improve this??
title: Constructive criticism...

developerResponse: {'id': 9602383, 'body': 'Thank you for sharing your experience with us. We will happily pass your feedback along to our Product Team. If you feel that you may have an active profile on our platform, our team would be happy to help. Please contact our team at feedback@team.bumble.com, or DM us on Facebook or Twitter (@bumblesupport) and we can look into everything for you.', 'modified': '2019-07-11T02:32:40Z'}
review:
First off - once you create a profile - good luck deleting it. I‚Äôve gone around and around trying to delete it and it says my password is incorrect when it indeed is not. I was able to write to the developers and they wrote me back saying my page was deleted, only to get notifications couple of hours later than I had a ‚Äúmatch‚Äù this is my second go around with trying to get my page deleted.
It is an unrealistic design to only allow someone a 24 hour period to reply to a message. Most of us are pretty busy and can‚Äôt be on a site every day. Of course if you want to recap a match or send a new message to an expired match once a 24 hour period has expired - it‚Äôs not possible unless you into spend money. 
Good thinking on their part, but just Not realistic!
title: Poor Dating App

developerResponse: {'id': 9369621, 'body': "We're saddened to hear that you're having a negative experience with our app, and we want to uncover what might be occurring on our end. We believe you'll meet incredible people in the Hive, and we have a zero-tolerance policy for behavior that's rude or abusive. We're here for you, and we encourage you to DM @BumbleSupport via Facebook or Twitter.", 'modified': '2019-06-26T20:41:08Z'}
review: This app is terrible, it‚Äôs my third time using it and each time it gets worse and I paid for it twice, because I can‚Äôt bare to spend my time endlessly swiping.  Everyday bumble states 50 plus like you.......when you find someone you might be interested in, and reach out you never get a response or you get 1 response then nothing, sometimes I wonder how recently the person swiped on me, it just seems like a strange algorithm.  It‚Äôs hard to tell where someone lives and lastly, and maybe it‚Äôs just the cowardly men hiding behind their phones but the way men talk to you is just disgusting , I have had many sexually explicit things said to me after the very first exchange, I guess they figure what do they have to lose... I don‚Äôt know, it really saddens me that this is what modern dating has evolved into.
title: Soul crushing

developerResponse: {'id': 8320109, 'body': "Thanks for sharing your feedback! We know everyone has busy lives, this is why we've introduced features like Extend and Super Swipe. These let users know that you're very interested in chatting so you can make a fabulous first impression without even having to say a word. Try them out and let us know how it goes!", 'modified': '2019-04-22T19:16:24Z'}
review:
The premise is good but unless you want to pay for the service, which you almost have to because the chances of you swiping right on someone who has swiped right on you are astronomical. Your beeline is only visible if you pay a weekly, monthly, or lifetime subscription fee. I understand everyone needs to make money; however, this leaves those of us who do not want to pay to meet someone endlessly swiping (usually left if I‚Äôm honest) to see if there might be someone who might be of interest we can swipe right on. Then what happens? If the other person don‚Äôt not have a subscription they may never see you. 

The time limit for them to respond when you are a match is less than ideal. People are busy and may not be checking their account within the 24 hours required for them to respond so the conversation goes nowhere. 

All that being said, I don‚Äôt have the solution to make this better, that‚Äôs not my job. Maybe lengthening the time they have to respond might be a good start or advertisements to boost revenue so clients are not required to pay. 

Something needs to change.
title: Not great

developerResponse: {'id': 6849340, 'body': "Hi there! Thank you for your feedback - we will definitely pass this along to our Product Team! We know users are busy, which is why we offer Bumble Boost, which allows you to extend expiring connections and rematch with them. We have a zero tolerance for fake profiles on Bumble, and a team that works 24/7 to remove them. We're here for you!", 'modified': '2019-03-05T22:15:04Z'}
review: First complaint is the iOS app won‚Äôt even let me update or change anything in my profile right now. My second complaint is since men can‚Äôt send the first message and we all have lives there should be way more time if not an infinite amount of time given to respond. It‚Äôs ridiculous that we‚Äôll never be seen by certain users just cause they were too busy to check their app the last 24 hours. There‚Äôs cases where people just aren‚Äôt interested obviously but the problem is when people just aren‚Äôt using the app to even see our like. Also noticing that people have found a way to get around the Live Photo verification. Definitely seen a catfish or two on bumble. Get on that, please.
title: Only 24 Hours to Respond?!

developerResponse: {'id': 7135536, 'body': "Hi there! Thanks for your feedback. We've recently released new features like Move Makers, Badges, and Filters, which allow users to personalize their profile and share more about themselves. We hope these help to improve your experience in the Hive. We are certain that you'll make an authentic connection soon!", 'modified': '2019-02-03T13:22:10Z'}
review:
Pro: More people and less business-like thank Match. Also way easier to connect on than match. 

Cons: It‚Äôs shallow in that it is almost entirely based on static photos (physical beauty).  Nobody writes anything, so there is almost no personality accessible in the average profile. I‚Äôm not saying that because of my looks either! I got a lot of connections in the first 24 hours of making a profile. It‚Äôs just sad that a site that promotes female empowerment is still shallowly focused on looks in its basic structure. 

Notification messages from your lock screen rapidly also disappear, and can‚Äôt be found after. Seriously? What‚Äôs the point of sending them?
title: Better than match but still shallow

developerResponse: {'id': 6916656, 'body': 'Hi Angie! You can contact us at any of our support channels, whether this be via email or social media. We want to best help you with your Bumble experience, and we believe that these users you are referring to are creating new accounts which are qualifying within your set age and distance preferences. For us to confirm and help you, message us!', 'modified': '2019-01-19T22:56:22Z'}
review:
I wrote the below review and weeks later development replied with directions on reaching out to get a response from social media customer service. What was the point of submitting a report via the app then?!! What is that popup/submit for review message for?!?!

I was going to let it go but I just got a profile I blocked appear again as an option. Bumble is supposed to be the one to be women friendly. Initiating the conversation isn‚Äôt enough - when I block someone, they need to stay blocked. What is that about!?! 

So since my last review, nothing has improved, it got worse. They couldn‚Äôt care less about the users. Worst dating app out there. 

‚Äî-

The app is ok - it is what it is. But the customer service is lacking despite Bumble‚Äôs reputation. 

The app automatically keeps banning my photo - fully clothed close up of a snuggle with my dog - as inappropriate. The notification popup gives you the option to reach out to flag it as a mistake. Then nothing. No response from bumble. 

I emailed to correct my age in my profile multiple times, then nothing. 

Absolutely no response from bumble. They clearly do not care at all about the users.
title: Decent app terrible customer service

developerResponse: {'id': 6578430, 'body': "Hi there, we appreciate your feedback on how we can better our profile badge and filtering features. We want to help our users make meaningful, intentional connections, and we'd love to personally hear more about your perspective. Feel free to message us via Facebook or Twitter - we'd love to hear from you!", 'modified': '2018-12-27T17:06:10Z'}
review: Joining a dating site in general is a huge step for some people. It doesn‚Äôt necessarily mean we have a hard time meeting people, but more importantly, we haven‚Äôt met the right types of people. Without sounding offensive or rude, I would like to be able to see choices that reflect the matches I have made in the past; ie: racially. I have a photo of my son on my profile, who is biracial, in order to give hints to my preferences, but would rather have another way of choosing it. This type of option would remove the countless people that I most likely wouldn‚Äôt be interested in. It‚Äôs just a thought.
title: Maybe a few more options

developerResponse: {'id': 27862003, 'body': "We appreciate you sharing your feedback with us. We are always looking for ways to improve our users' experience on the app so we will make sure to pass your input along to our Product Team.", 'modified': '2022-02-05T10:54:47Z'}
review:
Unlike Coffee Meets Bagel, you can see more than ten matches a day for free. You can also see on people‚Äôs profiles important details like whether they drink or do drugs. There doesn‚Äôt seem to be a time limit on how long you can chat with someone.
Unlike Plenty of Fish and MeetMe, the people using the app are higher quality and less likely to be scammers.
Unlike Tinder, there is a bit of a profile so you can see personality, not just looks.
The main way this app could improve is if it had match questions like Okcupid and allowed for longer profiles.
title: Better than most

developerResponse: {'id': 5527635, 'body': "Hi there! We'd love to answer your two questions! In terms of distance, if you see someone outside of your parameters, this means that at one point in time they were within your range. We hope this helps!", 'modified': '2018-10-16T17:29:15Z'}
review:
The idea of needing to message first is awesome. Forces you to make the move without having to overthink it and just do it. Although I‚Äôm gay so that‚Äôs actually irrelevant here. Haha. My faults are a couple. Number one is repeating profiles. So often you come across the same profile you‚Äôve swiped past two or three times. I understand running out of profiles. But to keep swiping all the times to receive barely anything is very disappointing. Distance is also a problem in search parameter. I have mines set for 50 miles and I keep seeing profiles 70+ miles away. What‚Äôs the point of the parameters?!?!
Other wise I like the style of the app and hope it can improve.
title: Love the concept, not the execution

review:
Hi! 2 years ago today July 20th I went on a coffee date in San Clemente. Easy great conversation ( date was one hour long ) 
Next week we went on another date and then another a week later.
We really enjoy each others company, we laughed allot ( laughing is my love language )
At week 7 and many dates in between I was diagnose with stage three breast cancer that spread into my Lymph nodes.
We sat down that night and talked, I expected to tell me that he couldn‚Äôt go through this and to be honest I totally understand.
However that‚Äôs not what happened, he told me he really liked me, tell me nothing about cancer ( neither did I )
He told me he really liked me a lot and wanted to see if this would go anywhere.
6 rounds of chemo, surgery , 33 rounds of radiation. And we are still together and still laughing!
October 3rd 2018 we are going to Bermuda with 8 friends and getting married 

Thank you to my niece for putting me on Bumble 

Kerry and Randy
title: Started with a coffee date

I really like this app. As a young woman with low self esteem issues, finding that there are people who would swipe right on my card and actually respond to a me was a really uplifting thought! So why aren't I rating this with 5 stars? Because I woke up this morning to find myself signed out of the app. No biggie, right? So I try to sign back in using my phone number, only to find that it doesn't work. Have all my matches been lost? All those conversations? I want this fixed. This app deserves 5 stars, but I cannot deliver that rating until I can get the help I need.

review: The thing I hate about dating apps is spending excessive amounts of money to fully use their services. Just using the premium for a week (15 dollars) or life time use (200 dollars). title: Great until

review: This app is so amazing I loved it for the time I‚Äôve used  it I highly recommend it for anyone who want a relationship or just something casual, my only concern was just having to pay $10 a week in order to just see who likes you and message them. review: I used to use bumble a lot! I enjoyed the concept and the features. However I downloaded the app again and things aren‚Äôt quite the same. In the past there was no limit to your swipes but for any other feature you were required to pay. Then you could swipe a lot and they capped the swipes, it refreshed about 2 times a day. Now you get about 15 swipes and you‚Äôre capped, this refreshes only ONCE a day and mine has now been over a day still with no refresh. I suppose they want you to buy a subscription to swipe, which I have with tinder, but it‚Äôs a whopping $13 A WEEK with nothing else included, not even a spotlight. Over all, I‚Äôm very disappointed that the developers money grabbing has ruined such a cool dating app.

review:
Bumble was the first and only dating app I used, and the first person I ever went on a date with, I am still with today! I‚Äôm positive the system just randomly pairs people due to this. Also no one, and do I mean no one will ever reply with more than a few words and no interest in connection, unless you want sex. In that case, 90% of the men here are looking for something casual or in replace of that to not be so upfront they will put that they don‚Äôt know what they want....like I‚Äôm talking 40-50 year olds saying that they don‚Äôt know. Oh we know alright. The business section, will also leave you in the dark, no one answers. But there is a stronger possibility that you will find your bff on here. title: Worthless

review:
The women are different on these apps. As a man, on Tinder, I have formed LTRs, dated far more successful women (lawyers, surgeons, engineers), and had far more meaningful connections, including just getting laid too. 

I felt like Bumble wasn‚Äôt working as I used both apps in parallel for a couple weeks. So I sat down and just listed all the women I had had meaningful connections, relationships or sex with. And not a single one from Bumble. Why? 

Maybe bad luck. But Bumble attracts a lot of self-important 49‚Äôer career women (4s who think they are 9s), it is just downright a bad scene for men. Tinder is more straightforward, less pretense. In the Bay Area this app is wildly popular, but also, no one gets married here. This app was built by people who know how to addict you to an app but not how to find love. And that‚Äôs why the app fails and leaves everyone unhappy.
title: Tinder succeeds, Bumble fails

review:
When did ghosting become acceptable? 

Sometimes it‚Äôs after a very basic and very simple exchange of only three or four responses. Sometimes it‚Äôs after a few dates and getting text messages from someone every day for several weeks. 

I understand the need to feel attractive to another person. However the extent to which it seems that that‚Äôs all the other person is interested in occurs at an alarmingly high rate in relationship to actually getting to know someone. I have friends who use this app and they tell me that they swipe without thinking and chat without real interest. Maybe their behavior creates a vicious cycle in which people are treating me the way my friends have treated someone else?  Is it really possible to find love on an app? Is it this seductive potential that makes me come back each time I swear off?  

So many questions. Where is the support group app?
title: Doesn‚Äôt quite scratch the itch.

review:

review:
So I took a break from this app for a bit, but decided to give it another shot. The app is still nice and does have plenty of people on it. But there are two big problems to me.

First, finding people is weird. It took almost 15 minutes after logging in on a fresh account to find anyone in my town. There‚Äôs a good number of people nearby that have the app as well, and they only live about 5-10 miles away. Yet I was getting shown people as far as 90 miles away first, and my range was not even that high! It was kind of strange to me.

My biggest problem is the Beeline. I get that the people running this app need money... sure, I know. But we have to pay just to see who swiped us? I‚Äôm not sure if girls have to do this too, but it‚Äôs frustrating as a guy to know that someone, somewhere, liked our profile but I have to pay for a subscription just to know who that person is? Absurd.

I‚Äôm gonna use the app for now, it‚Äôs still pretty good, but I‚Äôd like for these problems to get fixed, at least a little.

review: I would say I am a decently attractive looking guy. Maybe not the cream of the crop but certainly not an ogre. The probability of that is very low. Either something is wrong with the app or this is a very unpopulated app with many inactive profiles taking up a majority of the profiles to swipe on. Maybe an inactivity cleanse would do the app a lot of good? Maybe even just automatically turn to snooze mode after a certain period of inactivity? In contrast, my tinder profile (that I use the same exact photos) that I made 3 days later (and has a swipe limit) already yielded 5 matches.

review:
Under Bumble‚Äôs Values and Allyship category, there‚Äôs a bias towards Liberal values only (apart from Human Rights). Though a large percentage of Bumble users are Conservative, there are no options for Conservative values or causes, such as pro-life, free speech, 2nd amendment, or health freedom. 

A recent pop-up in the app asked me to click a button to show I was pro-choice giving me no other option. This not only completely ignores and discriminates against people of other views, but attempts to push one view as the only acceptable view onto users. Don‚Äôt pretend to be inclusive when it comes to things like gender identity options, and then disclude a large percentage of the population on your app.

We hope to hear from you soon.", 'modified': '2021-09-29T20:43:31Z'}
review:
Want to know why this is such a horrible dating app?  It bases the location of the match you are looking for off of current GPS coordinates tied to the person‚Äôs phone.

So say you live in Philadelphia PA and you want to find someone who lives in the local area. Well, Bumble doesn‚Äôt give you the person‚Äôs actual residential location in your search results. What you often get is a list of matches whose phones are presently in that location but quite often are just visiting for the day.

I have sent many complaints to the Bumble support team but they keep diverting the issue in their replies as if they know this is a problem ‚Äî have received many complaints about the GPS issue ‚Äî but don‚Äôt want to address the problem with their customers.

Shouldn‚Äôt your list of potential matches be based upon the city or town they actually live on? Most every other dating app thinks so. For some reason Bumble would rather give you phone locations that have nothing to do with actual residency.

Try Match instead. It‚Äôs better than this garbage
title: Bumble just doesn‚Äôt get it! You shouldn‚Äôt either!

developerResponse: {'id': 18765773, 'body': "Thanks for sharing honest experience. On Bumble, swiping, matching and messaging are all free. review:
Without access to any sort of analytics‚Äîe.g. insights‚Äîyou have no idea whether Bumble is doing what it purports to do. 

OK Cupid doesn‚Äôt have insights (at least not freely accessible ones), yet regardless of whether I was matching and engaging with people I wanted to be connecting with, engagement there seemed fairly easy to cause, even commonplace.

While I‚Äôve matched and gone on dates with people on Bumble, the more I‚Äôve used it the more it seems that receiving any matches whatsoever was confined to a brief period immediately after sign-up.

Furthermore, while paying for ‚Äúcoins‚Äù seems to have had some marginal effect on engagement, without any way to confirm that my match chances were indeed increased, Bumble always has plausible deniability; there is no way for users to know whether Bumble‚Äôs matchmaking system is merely broken or built on a perpetual, deceptive loot-crate model.

Either provide analytics‚Äîwhich must be accessible in both free and paid settings so the user can accept or refuse the ROI‚Äîor convince me this service is even functioning.

Because right now it feels like a scam.
title: Worthy of suspicion

review:
So I can complain about online dating in general but that‚Äôs not the issue. 

The real issue is that bumble just changed how when people swipe right on you populate on your banner at the top for you to see and match with.  Previously it showed you only those within your preferred distance and then if you wanted to expand your distance to find other matches you could.  Now, it‚Äôs set to show you all your matches regardless of your preferences.  This is horrible and annoying. 

I am paying extra to see my matches at the top and avoid having the swipe for hours.  Now, I am bombarded from matches in other cities that I will NEVER be interested in due to distance.  I mean i‚Äôm talking like 1900 miles away!!

Also, apparently guys swipe right on every single profile to see who writes to them and use the app that way. Good times.
My last 4 dates were nice guys in their 40s who didn‚Äôt have steady jobs but had lots of roommates. 
Pray for me. 
Boost does absolutely nothing. I received a TON of likes from guys who were 90+ miles away and didn‚Äôt want kids (my one deal breaker). If you‚Äôre paying for boost shouldn‚Äôt you be matched with guys that fit your requirements?

With Boost I got quite a few matches but non that lead to any good conversation or even close to a date. Long story short I spent about $50 and didn‚Äôt get a single date out of it. Think it‚Äôs lame that if you are paying $23 to sign up they won‚Äôt show your profile to everyone around you unless you pay an additional $4 for a 30 minute exposure. title: Good concept, but possible bug issues?

review:
This will sound like a salty customer who misbehaved and wants to lash out through review. I don‚Äôt know how to refute that idea, and show that I‚Äôm legitimate. So I‚Äôll press forward and hope that this disclaimer is sufficient. 

I started this app thinking it was a great alternative to Tinder and I was seeing a lot of success with the app. 

However suddenly and without a warning I was banned. I was given no explanation and I was not allowed to see the reason for my ban. 

I don‚Äôt sext, I don‚Äôt ask for nudes. I don‚Äôt swear, I don‚Äôt insult women, and to the best of my knowledge I had not broken any of the terms of service. So I reach out to the developers to see what the problem was. 

They refused to show me the conversation that got me banned. All they said was that they received ‚Äúmultiple reports‚Äù and that bans were permanent with no chance of forgiveness. 

This feels like a very oppressive policy. At the minimum we should see what comment we made that broke policy. To date I do not know if I actually said something upsetting or if one of the women I rejected got upset and reported me. We can‚Äôt grow if we don‚Äôt know the wrongs we‚Äôve done.

review:
Bumble changed their policy to include that you will never sue them through traditional litigation. I can no longer use the app without clicking ‚Äúagree,‚Äù however it says those who signed up prior to a certain date can opt out. No way to click ‚Äúopt out.‚Äù  

After research into why people are suing them, it‚Äôs my understanding that bumble auto renewed boost features without informing customers and against certain state laws, and made it difficult to unsubscribe after noticing. Additionally refusing to refund the unauthorized charges. You can google this for a better legal description, but In my opinion that‚Äôs shady. And forcing people to ‚Äúaccept‚Äù terms that they will never sue you makes me feel like they are actively doing things worthy of being sued. And I‚Äôm out.
title: Sketchy user policy

Email us at support@team.bumble.com or DM us on Facebook or Twitter @BumbleSupport‚Äîwe'd love to chat more!", 'modified': '2021-01-13T21:28:17Z'}
review:
Apparently, in one of the most recent updates, Bumble rolled out some feature called ‚ÄòBumble Premium.‚Äô

‚ÄúSo a super deluxe form of Boost, I‚Äôm assuming?‚Äù NO!

They stripped Boost of what seems like literally everything except unlimited swipes and backtrack! Beeline? Gone! Extra filters? Gone! $15 a month? Oh, well that‚Äôs still there, thankfully. /s

And where have all these paid features gone? Why, to the shiny new Bumble Premium, which‚Äîwhat a deal!‚Äîis ONLY $18 more than what I‚Äôm currently paying!

I saw Tinder also introduced its own take on this, at the same exact time, but at least on there, they didn‚Äôt remove features I had already been paying for on Gold, nor want to charge me over DOUBLE what I was already paying, just to get the same features I used to have.

I have used this app for a couple of years by now, at least, and have never been so disappointed or betrayed by an app developer. I sincerely hope they remedy this, but I doubt it. After my month of Boost that I just foolishly renewed, unless something drastically changes with this app, I may never use it again.

review: Bumble is conceptually alright, but I‚Äôm weary of companies that take advantage of small print policies to keep your payment. Where I may have considered returning to the service in the future, now I won‚Äôt.  Beware!

review: A friend got banned from the app for saying something in a chat that they did not get reported for. I have tried multiple pics that are clearly of my face and even if they are approved they can be unapproved later it seems like? Overall not a fan of the app. It also has multiple bugs within the messaging part of it in that some messages will be sent twice and some not at all... just a poorly designed app with poor intentions.

To summarize, this app will help you find what you‚Äôre looking for and pretty quickly. I‚Äôm grateful there are other aspects to the app besides dating üôÇ

I‚Äôm not happy about the feature that asks you to reset your filters to get more matches, but then just ignores all of them instead of choosing individual categories to reset instead of doing a total reset.
