I‚Äôm also going to put this out there. It‚Äôs a dating app, I get it. I‚Äôm not judging sex workers by saying this, but man! It‚Äôs amazing to me how people on Bumble are confused by the difference in ‚Äúsex worker‚Äù and ‚Äúdater.‚Äù Is there an app that explains the difference? There should be. Bumble could use a place where that‚Äôs explained? They can clue in more some of their ‚Äúbees‚Äù

My technical suggestions would be to add time stamps on messages. Currently the app only has a stamp of ‚Äòyesterday‚Äô. Also, there‚Äôs a bug that glitches when you send a message. The messages will squish together and also show duplicates.

title: Scammed me into Subscription

developerResponse: {'id': 4856391, 'body': "Hey there, Bumble is all about meaningful connections please DM us on Facebook or Twitter and we can give you some tips and tricks that will have the bees in your Hive buzzing. Our moderators work 24/7 to maintain the Hive and we're also rolling out photo verification to tackle this issue.", 'modified': '2018-08-29T09:30:07Z'}
review:
So the initial premise of the app was intriguing, women have to make the first move to communicate and men have to be charming enough to continue a conversation.  

That being said, I've right swiped over 300 times and it seems that a majority of the people on here are not active, are looking for Instagram followers, or are fake profiles.  
Distance measurement is a major problem as well given the GPS on this thing thinks I live 70 miles outside of the nearest major city (when I'm 10 miles out).  I've gone as far as increasing my range from 30 - 60 miles, only to add 3 more profiles to choose from.
The Facebook verification sounds like a great idea until you realize it's a fake Facebook profile that was actually verified (catfish anyone?).

There are about a dozen things that could be done (or done better), and feel that I could make a better app with better execution.  
Overall, good effort, but falls well short of hitting the intended mark especially for a paid app.
title: 4 weeks..1 match...weak execution

developerResponse: {'id': 26318182, 'body': "We're sorry you didn't enjoy your experience on Bumble. Our team would love the opportunity to improve your experience in the Hive! Please message our Support Team on Twitter or Facebook (@BumbleSupport) and we'd be happy to help.", 'modified': '2021-11-17T09:26:17Z'}
review:
Whether you‚Äôre a paid subscriber (I was at one point) or a free user (I was until recently), you are very likely not going to have much success on this app. You can swipe hundreds of profiles and maybe land two matches. More than likely the match will result in a, ‚Äúhey,‚Äù ‚Äúhey,‚Äù and then you‚Äôll go about your life.

By the way, I one time suggested to customer service that most of the profiles listed were likely either fake or dead, and their response was a comically over-the-top ‚Äúhow dare you‚Äù response. Not the best at inspiring confidence in their service. Thing is that there‚Äôs a good chance my suggestion is correct, as there is no statistical chance that if all these profiles are active and real that the response is so minimal.

Do things the old fashioned way: meet people in real life, interact with them like normal, build interest through those natural interactions. This showboat performance on apps like Bumble is a waste of time.

This app should be viewed more as a social experiment, not as the new way to meet real people and make real connections.
title: Most Need Not Bother

review:
I cannot thank Bumble enough! 

I had circled through so many dating apps, each with no success. I‚Äôd go on a couple dates, but nothing ever worked out. Until one day. 

I matched with one guy, and I thought ‚Äúhe was pretty cute, I guess I‚Äôll chat him up and see where that goes.‚Äù We met at the bar for a drink, eight and a half months later we‚Äôre sitting on our couch, watching Brooklyn 99 while our baby girl kicks away in my stomach. We got married about a month ago, and I have Bumble to thank for that!

review: I don‚Äôt typically update apps that don‚Äôt describe what they‚Äôre updating. Not only does this app *never* provider that information, the app contains a built in mechanism to prompt the user to update. At first, it comes with the ability to dismiss the prompt but(seemingly) coincidentally I started to have performance issues also. Since they weren‚Äôt significant I still didn‚Äôt update. review:
I don‚Äôt normally leave reviews for apps, but as a ‚Äúpower user‚Äù of technology I was surprised this could happen to me and wonder how many others have been robbed at digital gunpoint by Bumble Trading Inc. 

When using the app, I accidentally clicked a button that brought up an in-app purchase menu for ‚Äúcoins‚Äù. When trying to exit on my iPhone, I clicked the middle button to close out of the app. Instead in one swoop it READ MY FINGERPRINT AND AUTHORIZED A PURCHASE as I was exiting.

The realm of deceptive interface design for accidental purchases was normally reserved for top spam and adware providers on the web. Now it‚Äôs been embedded as a ‚Äúfeature‚Äù in an app that touts its higher ground and ethical standing.

When I reached out to explain what happened I was told that according to their terms of service I authorized the purchases and there‚Äôs nothing they can do. I feel like I was digitally robbed at gunpoint in the safety of my home. I‚Äôm not only asking for a refund of this truly unauthorized purchase, but a response to the user interface fraud embedded around your in-app purchases.
title: Predatory Unauthorized Purchase Fraud ‚Äî In-App User Interface Design

review:
So I don‚Äôt normally write reviews because I don‚Äôt think with big apps like this to be heard but here we go..

This is definitely a top dating app next to Tinder. I haven‚Äôt ran into any bots or fake accounts like other dating sites, which is a plus. I like the events they hold and the women having to message first is a nice change.

What I don‚Äôt like about the app is first in foremost the price. I‚Äôm sure other dating sites cost more, but $20 for a week premium is kinda crazy. I think Tinder charges the same amount with all the perks for a month. I‚Äôm also not a fan of the timer, though you do get 1 free extension per day, but if you have 2 matches you‚Äôre stuck with extending one of them. And I‚Äôm sure I‚Äôm not the only one that doesn‚Äôt check the app every day so you‚Äôre losing out on potential matches.

All n all, it‚Äôs a great app with minor tweaks! Hopefully it gets considered on dropping the pricing down a bit

review:
As everyone knows, dating apps in 2022 are just about as bad a way to meet someone as it gets. Bumble leads this pack of soulless, mindless apps where looks matter above all else. Where the art of the dating essay is lost, where the art of the conversation is lost. I applaud equal rights, and have no issue with having women make the first move. I do, however, take issue with the awful interface, abundance of obviously fake profiles, and constant barrage of requests to upgrade for what is a terrible value. 

Go out in the real world if you‚Äôre lonely. Get involved in local volunteering, or for god sake adopt a cat. Anything is infinitely more rewarding than eating yor time on this mind-numbingly poor excuse for a dating app.

review:
First off, I have to say it‚Äôs pretty nice. Lots of users, lots of good information included, and it‚Äôs not as in-your-face about upgrading as Plenty Of Fish. 

The major issue that I have is that it is WAY too sensitive to swiping! I will scroll down on someone to learn more, then, next thing I know I‚Äôve accidentally swiped left or right when I didn‚Äôt mean to. I‚Äôm using this on an iPhone 8 and I have done 15+ mis-swipes after downloading yesterday. For those that I‚Äôve accidentally swiped right on, it‚Äôll be awkward if/when we match. For those that I‚Äôve accidentally swiped left on, I may never see them again.

Send us a message on Facebook or Twitter @BumbleSupport if you have further questions!", 'modified': '2020-09-10T19:20:26Z'}
review:
I have in the past given this app high praise for being one of the few non-underhanded apps to try and trick users into subscriptions but today I change my mind 100%. 

Your beeline is where you see other members who have ‚Äúliked‚Äù you. I like to keep mine clear unless we are talking, we last few days it has been empty as again I removed the other members. Lol today my subscription ended and amazingly I have 14 new members to see. Of course I need to pay to see them. Lol. It‚Äôs a shame that bumble has resorted to this share tactic as the majority of the low rent dating apps. 

I could pay but why? To see profiles of members not within my criteria or didn‚Äôt even most likely ‚Äúlike‚Äù me to start.. just doesn‚Äôt make sense to me.
title: Disappointing

review:
I‚Äôm new to this app, but a very seasoned online dating app user overall. Although I‚Äôm trying to embrace the concept of ‚Äúwomen‚Äôs empowerment,‚Äù I‚Äôve been quite disappointed thus far. It‚Äôs perplexing that out of dozens and dozens of matches I‚Äôve had so far, only two men replied to my messages. Are these profiles even real? What‚Äôs the point of swiping right if you have no intention of connecting?! 
Also, I don‚Äôt believe allowing only 24 hours to respond is sufficient enough. I‚Äôm assuming most professionals and busy adults don‚Äôt have time checking the app multiple times a week. Why not extend it to a week for instance?
title: Not impressed

review:
This app is awesome. So much better than Tinder. 
I was banned from Tinder without any reason as to why. And I enjoyed tinder just as much as bumble, however I noticed that in America there isn't many people I can connect with as opposed to other countries. It would be so awesome if you could implement the location setting around the world for free, and make us pay for the whole country setting. 
I would pay to change the location setting. But during this coronavirus outbreak, I need the money.

review:
The Bumble app was easy to set up and I like the fact that I can edit my profile from a computer instead of strictly from the mobile app.

I'm not quite sure how the app fully works. It would be great to have some sort of in-app video or a quick guide. 

The downside and the reason why I'm giving the app three stars is that you must share your current location with users and it is shown on your profile. That to me is a little intrusive, and plus I travel so I don't care to look for ‚Äùhookups‚Äù nearby or outside of where I live. For that reason, I deleted the app.

review: As a girl you only get about 20-25 swipes per day if your are looking for any type of connections. But as a dude you basically can‚Äôt do anything and you have to pay for everything. It keeps telling me that I ran out of swipes and to come back tomorrow. But to be honest I‚Äôm just going to delete this app. It‚Äôs glitchy, fake matches and once again I only get a certain amount of swipes. Why can‚Äôt it go back to how it was a couple years ago, the app was so much better then. Do not download this app, try a different app. Also, make sure to read the reviews before paying for anything. Apparently they will scam you out of your money. review: I really love almost every aspect of it. I love that you can put on filters and add things about yourself, and that you can be verified, and all the little prompts. It's well done and a wonderful dating app, except that I don't want to have to text first?? If I'm truly interested I will text first even if he doesn't, but to not even give him the option i literally feel so much pressure. Like dude i'm not clever and funny and i'm a little too socially awkward to start a random convo about why he likes the beach or the mountains more. And then the app harasses me and tells me that my "hi" isn't good enough. I'm doing my best, okay bumble, but let him text me first

The matches are all recycled, the same matches tend to appear, eventually a match will greet you but it is a bot generated by the system w a ‚Äúhi!‚Äù Generated greeting.  Poor personalization possible, lack of support in short for non-existing, please tell me a success story out there that is not a short term one.  This is not an app worth your time.  This is not my first review, if this site would care I‚Äôd heard a call back wanting my one to one feedback.  All I heard is echos....  good luck. Ah, and the site prompts continuously for you to upgrade in order to get additional matching time.  A true match responds and does not wait 24 hours to respond. When you know what you want you go for it. Bumble. Good luck!

title: Sub Standard app. Poor at best. Does not connect people whether paying or not.

review: The app and the overall idea are great. I‚Äôm glad they added filters recently but I wish they would allow advanced filtering. I am looking to meet a woman who doesn‚Äôt have kids and doesn‚Äôt want them. Right now I can only filter for people who specifically say that. However, I think a lot of women choose not to say anything about children for fear that any answer might alienate someone. I‚Äôd like to be able to filter for women who have left that data point blank as well as those who indicated they don‚Äôt want children.
title: Please allow advanced filtering

developerResponse: {'id': 11536647, 'body': "We're so sorry to hear this has been your experience! We'd love for you to reach out to us on Facebook or Twitter (@BumbleSupport) so we can give you the more personalized support we should have given you the first time.", 'modified': '2019-10-29T16:18:31Z'}
review:
I‚Äôm writing from Alaska, not sure if it means anything but it may be a factor in why this didn‚Äôt work for me.
I paid for the app for the first time to see how it affected my experience on Bumble and it was a total waste of money! It seemed like there were less matches than before and I don‚Äôt receive any messages back.
This isn‚Äôt something I paid for and expected to sit back and let things happen. I looked up how to improve my profile and how to have more engaging conversations, a skill I have also fine-tuned as a journalist. Still nothing after two weeks. 
The paid version let me see who swiped yes to my profile but there were never any matches for me to choose from. So I‚Äôm guessing that feature would work well in a larger community with more potential matches? 
When I reached out to bumble about this they sent back a generic article about how to improve my profile.
I wasted $20 on the app and received worse service than if I had just used the free version. I came here to write a review so others can save their money. It‚Äôs not worth it.
title: Waste of time and money in Alaska

developerResponse: {'id': 31373758, 'body': "We totally hear you on this and we appreciate you reaching out to us about it! Bumble is always looking for new ways to improve the experience of our members. We really appreciate you taking the time to leave us your feedback about this, and we'll be sure to share it with our Product Team.", 'modified': '2022-08-09T22:55:09Z'}
review:
Instead of just "moderate" as a middle option, maybe add "independent left leaning" and "independent right leaning" or "moderate left" and "moderate right".
I've found that a lot of people call themselves "moderate" but still have extreme views to the right or left. 
Political alignment is a very important factor in figuring out compatibility, but people are afraid to align as strictly liberal or conservative, so they just say moderate... But that allows too much room for interpretation (and wasted texting/dating time if this is important to you).
title: I have a politics suggestion

developerResponse: {'id': 6014619, 'body': "Hi there! Thank you so much for your feedback. We will make sure to pass it along to our Product Team. We want you to have the opportunity to match and connect with everyone who has liked your profile, which is why you're seeing these people in your queue. \nWe‚Äôve noticed that this has led to many more connections and success stories!", 'modified': '2018-11-19T21:27:02Z'}
review: I‚Äôve always loved the concept of Bumble. I‚Äôve met great guys through it and feel in control of the conversation 99% of the time. I used to love that I could come into Bumble and see the guys near me who have already swiped right on me. Worth the money to save me time. But now the distance setting doesn‚Äôt work for the Beeline and I‚Äôll see guys 1 mile away in the same group as those 100 miles away. The paid feature has become completely useless to me now as I‚Äôm not going to sort through them manually. I commute for work so now my matches are all over the place and it‚Äôs such a bummer. I plan on canceling my subscription until it‚Äôs changed back and I‚Äôm sure others will be doing the same.

developerResponse: {'id': 5790318, 'body': "Hi there! Thank you so much for this feedback. We will pass it along to our Product Team! Please feel free to reach out to us directly anytime via Facebook (@bumbleapp) or Twitter (@bumble). You can turn on notifications by going to Settings - Notification Settings. If you're still experiencing issues, please DM us- we're here for you!", 'modified': '2018-11-03T20:14:24Z'}
review:
I like this app, I enjoy the way it has updated and it‚Äôs nice to know that I can control more of the situations. But I‚Äôm frustrated with a few things.

1. Religion options. There are only like 8 religion options on there and you can‚Äôt fill in your personal religion if it isn‚Äôt offered. I get that there are thousands of religions but as someone who is Quaker I doesn‚Äôt want to identify as Christian nor other. Please just have a search bar or something.

2. A way to contact bumble. Again i searched high and low for a way to ask about adding more religions before resorting to an app review. 

3. Relationship status. It‚Äôs on the bff site but not on dating site which I think it matters more. And polygamy should be an option 

4. Sexuality. Some people are straight, some people are gay, some are pansexual, asexual. Why can‚Äôt we just have a little tab there? 

5. Better notifications. I can‚Äôt see when I am matched with someone or someone sends me a message. It‚Äôs annoying
title: Some suggestions

developerResponse: {'id': 5264410, 'body': 'Congratulations! We are thrilled to hear that you met your match on Bumble!', 'modified': '2018-09-27T15:53:54Z'}
review: I met someone that was so incredible! Our first date was at a nice restaurant close to my place of work (he went out of his way for me). review:
Hello out there,

If you‚Äôre like me, you‚Äôre liking using Bumble to date and network. Back in the day, Bumble was, IMO, one of the best dating apps out there. It tends to maintain a database of real people, fielding out undedicated flakes so that you can enjoy the use of the app without the uncertainty and frustration. Thats my bases for its 3 stars. It lost 2 stars over the course of time due to the limiting in swiping. When you only get to swipe 10 times, matching with only one and having 2-3 potential matches, only to be told ‚Äúthanks, you‚Äôre done for the day‚Äù that is very frustrating. 

I totally understand the limitation part. But at best I should get 3-5 matches in one day from swiping before being told that I can‚Äôt make any more match attempts. That way I‚Äôm ‚Äúencouraged‚Äù to talk to those people. Then maybe I won‚Äôt have to swipe again.

I guess bumble is more concerned about consistent app use then getting people to the end goal - the success story.

review:
I have had Bumble for over 2 years. One day, the app logs me out, making it so I cannot log back in when I try. I messaged Bumble Support on Facebook and got repeated automated messages and never once received a response from a human.

Frustrated, I went to Bumble‚Äôs website and filled out a form explaining my situation and being promised contact within 48 hours because ‚Äúfeeling ghosted‚Äù is one of the few things they like less than auto replies. Well, I feel ghosted.

I responded to that email after waiting over 48 hours and received a message saying, ‚Äú It appears as though you have replied to a resolved query, which unfortunately will not reach our support team. Please reach out to Bumble on our Contact Us form, we're here for you!‚Äù

This is incredibly unprofessional and insulting. Bumble Support has proven to not only be nonexistent but also intentionally close a case that I opened without ever looking into my issue or providing a response. I recommend using Hinge, because it seems like the makers of that app actually care if you can use their app.

review: Bumble was previously my favorite dating app. I actually met a girl on Bumble that I ended up dating for 2 years. However, like many dating apps that have matured, Bumble has been adding in more and more limiting features in order to monetize. Paid for the boost so I could see who liked me. Turns out those 50+ matches were hundreds of miles away. No use in that, I‚Äôm not interested in long distant dating. Also, I would prefer that people just visiting my state not show up in my swipe stack.  

There needs to be a way for you to set preferences. As a woman of color swiping through a sea of Caucasian men (which seems to be about 80% of the dating pool on this app) it would helpful to know who is interested in dating outside of their race before I swipe on them. Very discouraging aspect of this app.

Matches constantly disappear. I‚Äôve had well over twenty matches and out of those maybe three replied. Most of the time the match will disappear as soon as I send a message or the match will just stop replying. I don‚Äôt know if guys are just lazy, uninterested or if they are even active to reply in 24 hours. 

Even the apps interface is not as pleasant as other dating apps. I‚Äôve had more luck with tinder and the app‚Äôs interface and usability is much more exciting.

And it doesn‚Äôt recycle back to the beginning of the options you‚Äôve already viewed.  So if you swipe left, and don‚Äôt pay to go back, you‚Äôre out of luck. I only gave it 3 stars because, once you do match, it works well.

review: The app functions fine. You‚Äôll just (if your‚Äôre a guy) never get any matches and (If you‚Äôre a girl) get so many matches that you don‚Äôt even care to look through them all. You‚Äôll just swipe a couple until you find someone you like (there is a high probability that he‚Äôs already liked you) and boom! Date. You are basically (as a guy) hoping that the girl you like sees your profile before anyone else. I also suspect their to be a disproportionate amount of men compared to ladies on here which only further overwhelms the ladies and underwhelms they guys. My advice? Grab some friends and go to a concert or other event. Regardless of your gender/orientation, you‚Äôll have better luck just doing it the old fashioned way.

review: So the way the bumble app works is that it puts the prettiest people on top of the stack. The more right swipes you get the further up the stack you move. It works the same for men and women. On other apps I have no problem getting regular matches and going on dates. With bumble, if you‚Äôre not in the top you‚Äôll never get a match unless you‚Äôre in that top group. It makes sense to a fault... if you‚Äôre a new user you want to open it up and see all the pretty people. But the problem is that if you‚Äôre not getting swiped on you‚Äôll also never be on top, so it doesn‚Äôt even give people a fair shot at matching that otherwise would. Paying for the app makes no difference either.
title: Terrible algorithm. Doesn‚Äôt work unless you‚Äôre pretty

developerResponse: {'id': 5931571, 'body': 'Hi there! As we grow and innovate, our team comes up with new and exciting features or changes to our platform to better your experience. Your thoughts have been given to our Product Team, and we appreciate your perspective and thorough feedback on how we can further improve our platform.', 'modified': '2018-11-13T22:43:14Z'}
review:
This app needs a lot of work. 

If you‚Äôre in your 20s and 30s and are too lazy, broke, lame, and/or socially awkward to meet people to date (hookup) in a real world setting, then this app will do just wonders, especially if you are a man. Just make sure you are attractive because this app is heavily reliant on attractiveness/good pictures to make matches. 

Developers, here‚Äôs some suggestions:
- ALL users should be required to verify their identity.
- Let users keep a list of those they blocked. 
- Allow men to message women if they match. Just as you do with same sex couples. 
-Allow women to message men without a mutual match if women have a premium membership. 
- Remove users who were, but no longer, in your preferred mile radius. People go on vacation and go back home and it does me no use to see their profile when they are out of state because my preference is 15 miles.
-It would be helpful to see WHEN a user matched or swiped right on me.
title: Decent dating app, could be great

review:
I had this app for sometime. It was pretty cool. Randomly Monday I woke up and was logged out. When I went to login in said ‚Äúplease check your number‚Äù. Customer service could not for the life of them find my profile even with my phone number, and other information given (occupation, location, etc). THEN they got back to me the next day saying oh we BANNED you indefinitely because you violated guidelines. This is a lie, I would never disrespect someone, and on top of that, I never EVER got a notification saying I violated guidelines and my account was suspended/banned (as they are suppose to do). 

Basically the moronic developers messed up, and then tried to make me feel like a bad person to cover their mistake. Delete Bumble.
title: Do not get!!!

Selecting locations and regions should be a feature, it‚Äôs more like a nightmare if you live on the Connecticut shoreline.

review:
I started using both Bumble and Hinge at the same time and for about a year. So far I have dated quite a few people from Hinge in person and 0 in person date from Bumble. The only thing I get that‚Äôs slightly similar to a date is a video chat that made me look at the other person‚Äôs chin for about an hour.

The 24 hour deadline for the other person to reply is a key failure. People might need more time to think about whether or not to connect and the 24 hour deadline makes them feel pressured to make a decision and they just don‚Äôt want to do it. 

The average attractiveness level of people Bumble is below 5, while 7 on Hinge, in my opinion. 

I regret paying for permanent membership for Bumble because I‚Äôm now stuck with it for the money I paid while being disappointed over and over again by it. I‚Äôm going to delete it soon and go with Hinge. A 159 dollar lesson learned.

Hinge has yet to help me find the love of my life but at least I get to meet people through it and that increases the chance.
title: Bumble failed me

developerResponse: {'id': 23713661, 'body': "Hi there, we appreciate you sharing your feedback with us. We are always looking for ways to improve our users' experience on the app so we will make sure to pass your input along to our Product Team.", 'modified': '2021-07-02T13:50:09Z'}
review:
You can‚Äôt just include a one word description of your occupation. You have to have have the Title, Description, Address, business permit, phone number, manager‚Äôs number as well.
(Exaggerating- But it forces you to go into more detail than other apps require).
You cannot personalize your education experience; example you cannot input ‚Äúsome college‚Äù or ‚Äú2 years completed in _____ field‚Äù.
The platform is extremely rigid.
There are 5 options available for ‚ÄúWhat You‚Äôre Looking For‚Äù and while they‚Äôre great, you cannot select multiple &, again, you cannot insert what you‚Äôre looking for.
I could go on with examples like this throughout the app. 

I don‚Äôt understand why it tries so hard to be different from other apps. 
Just market it as a more friend/date/networking oriented app & have the same customizable options that Scruff & other apps have. 

Way too rigid & uptight. Not as many people on this compared to other apps.
title: Why is this app so uptight & rigid?

It even warns you that will happen when you go to turn off date mode, yet when you come out of hiding your date mode. they‚Äôre still there. Someone needs to fix this app.

title: Mostly fake profiles

review:
This app has horrible customer service and refund polices. 

I opened this app one morning to check messages and something popped up on my screen asking me if I wanted to buy ‚Äúboost‚Äù or some sort of coin. I attempted to get the message off screen, but being first thing in the morning I can‚Äôt see too well, and it takes me to a screen with purchase options. 

I press the home button hoping to close the app and the phone takes my fingerprint and waste $80 on something I didn‚Äôt intend to buy or need. 

I contact Bumble asking for a refund for a subscription I didn‚Äôt want or need and they refuse to give me a refund because I ‚Äúauthorized the purchase‚Äù. I never intended to buy the coins and would still be using this app today if it wasn‚Äôt for the pop up in app purchase ads. I even told them I cancelled the subscription right after I realized what happened, and they still refused a refund. 

I revived a refund from Apple, who understood 100% that accidents do happen, unlike Bumble. I‚Äôve since uninstalled and deleted my profile.
title: Horrible Customer Service

review: I was charged almost $90 for a subscription I did not authorize. When I got a notification a charge was made I immediately emailed Bumble only to receive an automated response that I would receive an actual response within 48 hours. I never got a response within 48 hours so I had to email two more times before being told that no refund would be issued. Thankfully Apple support gladly issued a credit when they heard that the charge was a mistake.
title: Poor Customer Support

review: I purchased a normal subscription via iOS. Four days later, I upgraded to a premium account. Rather than charging me the difference, they charged me the full amount. How would Apple know what I purchased? Bumble controls the subscription. I work as VP of finance for a technology company that sells an app on Apple. They have failed to take any ownership for the upgrade, and refused to refund money that I‚Äôve clearly proof, and they double charged me. Horrible!!!

Bumble is free to get started and does work.  However, there is very little you may enter to describe yourself.  That works both ways. You have little to evaluate someone on.

Overall, after nearly 1 month on Bumble, I‚Äôm ready to give up on it. 
It‚Äôs much like a Porsche body hiding a VW engine.   It looks great but there is no substance beyond the most basic functionality
It has led to several potential matches for me but it is frustrating to work with so little information.

The design they went for, matching with people that have liked you, makes it impossible to match with all of the people that like you or find you interesting or attractive. review:
Since a few updates back, the app is gone downhill. It lies to you about the # of prospective matches you have ‚Äúwaiting‚Äù. There‚Äôll be 78, I‚Äôll left swipe twice, and I‚Äôll have 66 matches- you can‚Äôt unswipe someone you‚Äôve liked, so there‚Äôs no way the numbers are accurate. It‚Äôs a ploy to get you to pay for premium features. 
Then the new layout feature they implemented is horrible. Each photo once enlarged, can only be viewed one at a time, and then you have to scroll back n forth to see age, profile info etc.
 Use hinge, it‚Äôs much better- and 95% of 1st messages on here are hey, or something that‚Äôs barely a message at all, leaving men to make the first move anyways. So Then what‚Äôs the appeal?

review:
A dumb and hyper-controlling app. It won‚Äôt work unless location is turned on. That seems every time you travel, be it for a week, a day, or a few hours, Bumble is trying to match you in these places. Why would I want to make a friend in a place where I don‚Äôt live and may never return to? Why don‚Äôt I have control over my location services??

Exhibit B: Greed. If you make a slip and swipe left when you meant yo swipe right (or vice versa), Bumble pounces on you and wants to sell you a $10/month subscription in order to correct your mistake. Talk about greed and bad faith.

Constant (pricey) upselling is really annoying every time you open the app. 

Profile tools are minimal and dumb. Most people lazily use the preset icons on their profiles, and Bumble facilitates this, so it‚Äôs hard to know the person in any way except from their photo. This is a pretty poor way of judging compatibility. 

Bumble gets a meh.
title: Lots o‚Äô problems & greed

title: Money scam!

review:

review: What‚Äôs frustrating about this I have is how many matches do not reply. Theoretically, a match is an indication of mutual interest. Most of these swipe based dating apps haven‚Äôt found a true remedy for the lack of communication between matches. It is a self perpetuating cycle where people don‚Äôt respond, they learn not to respond in turn, and the vicious cycle just repeats itself again and again. It‚Äôs part of the online dating culture to not respond to mutual matches.

title: Annoying app

review:
I love the interface, and especially love being the first to message, as a woman. It makes me feel safer and more focused in my search. I met two amazing people using this app that I only stopped dating because of life circumstances.

However, I do wish that there was a way to note sexual preferences such as being vanilla or kinky, and filter by that. I think that can be very important in looking for a good match. For me, it‚Äôs enough to make me go to a different platform entirely, despite preferring bumble in every other way.
title: Love the app

review: This all gets worse and worse. I‚Äôve watched them over the years morph into a money hungry cash machine. The smallest features now cost money. No more free filters and only like ten likes per day for ‚Äúintentional swiping‚Äù but you can upgrade for unlimited? I think it really lowers the engagement because now my matches expire left and right. No one wants to hop on when you can‚Äôt even DO anything and then point is to browse profiles and like them to connect.  This app purposefully hinders you in connecting with people so you can pay egregious amounts of money. I thought this app was for women by women but it‚Äôs turned into another money trap.
title: Money hungry

Thought Bumble would be a respite from that but you still have to weed through the profiles to figure it out. About 1/4-1-3 of my beeline have been looking for that. On the plus side I don‚Äôt have to deal with their messages just delete from the beeline.

developerResponse: {'id': 23997541, 'body': "Hi there! It sounds like your admirers don't fit the Advanced Filters you have set. Try removing all of your filters; these users should show up then. If not, or if you still have questions, feel free to reach out to us on Facebook or Twitter (@BumbleSupport). We're here for you and always happy to help!", 'modified': '2021-07-19T06:56:15Z'}
review:
So far my experience with this has not been good. At the time of writing this, I‚Äôve been using this app for 2 and a half weeks, and during that time, I‚Äôve only gotten 1 like. That single like I got was received 2-3 hours after I first downloaded the app; before I had premium. The very next day, I decided to get premium for a month (thinking I wouldn‚Äôt need anymore than that). 
Since then, I haven‚Äôt received any likes whatsoever; now, I don‚Äôt consider myself to be perfect, but I know that for a fact it‚Äôs very unlikely for there to be absolute radio silence on this. I live in a populated area, so there‚Äôs plenty of options, but what are the chances that over the course of half a month, I‚Äôve heard nothing? 

It really does feel like Bumble is holding out the likes just to keep me here longer, and I won‚Äôt stand for it. I refuse to pay them anymore money.

Definitely avoid this app, it doesn‚Äôt care for you or your potential happiness, it cares only for money
title: Might be a scam

Bumble is a different concept, but uses the same strategy like any other online dating app:  make people spend money. It‚Äôs like the unused gym membership. While it‚Äôs true there are some success stories out there, I wouldn‚Äôt recommend one to invest their time or money into Bumble.

I will get likes, and sit there going through peoples profiles, eventually reaching the end of my list and getting a message that says thats all I can look at that day. Yet i still have the likes showing and never once saw those profiles appear. 

Or, I will get liked, end up matching with the person who liked me, and never get a chance to speak because the girl never starts messaging. 

In theory, this app sounds good. In practice, its actual crap. Because the guys cannot start the messaging process the girl is under the assumption that I liked them and am waiting for them to message first. Which some girls even put on their profile, ‚ÄúI dont message first, so you start the conversation.‚Äù Well guess what, I cant. It doesnt let men start any conversation because this app is geared for woman. 
Why does dating now a days have to be even more complicated then it already is? Your not weeding out the a-holes, your weeding out the guys who actually want to find someone who could be a serious partner.

review:
I think I have been on this app for over a year now. The app is well designed and easy to use. There seems to be an adequate user base to have a match or maybe not. 

This app maybe better suited to the 20-30 something crowd then me. The outcomes and behavor of users is not worth the price they ask for this service. Maybe $2 a month would be more fitting. 

It maybe my generation where we have our friends and have a lower tolerance for potential bs but the feeling is nobody is interested in chatting or meeting. For some reason this app is a busy box or thumb gym. 

95% of the time woman write and I respond they don‚Äôt write back. It is at a level that is just bizarre. Most of the none responders only type  ‚ÄúHi first name‚Äù so I am thinking that these are sent by a bot. If true that is sad and only makes me feel like this app is not worth it. Why spend money on dead ends. 

I gave it 3 stars since it is a good idea and clean easy to use app. But too expensive and does not cultivate connection of any kind.
title: Well designed app that is a fail

If you're having any trouble using your free daily extend, please DM us on Facebook or Twitter @BumbleSupport!", 'modified': '2020-09-09T21:10:45Z'}
review:
Lets all acknowledge that dating apps want you to spend money on them. Cool. Whatever. I think the asking price is a bit high, but that‚Äôs just an opinion. 

What baffles me though is how bad the free mode is. 

I‚Äôm not bothered that you can see who likes you. That‚Äôs par for the course. What is frustrating though is that you only get 24 hours to both respond after you match. I have now had quite a lot of matches. You know how many people I‚Äôve spoken to? Zero. Not once have both me and my match managed to respond in that time. 

Lest I appear bitter, I will say that Hinged and Lex have given me plenty of matches, conversations, and dates. Even Coffee Meets Bagel has had a few bites, but I‚Äôll admit I‚Äôm the wrong demographic for it. (My sister swears by them.)

When i inquired, I was told (‚Äúreminded‚Äù) that you can extend one match per day. Well perhaps you can when you‚Äôve been talking a while, but for the life of me a still can‚Äôt figure out how. I do know that their support staff are condescending af.
title: Worthless free mode, expensive full mode
